If at any time a player does not correctly insert the card into the right place on their Time line, they lose all the cards they have accumulated this turn in order to keep cards permanently, players must end their turn with a correct answer.  First player with 10 cards in the correct order in their Time line wins.

Name: Wer kennt Kaiserslautern?
Description:
"Who knows Kaiserslautern - The Original City Quiz"

Do You know Yor city or region? With over 500 questions about Kaiserslautern.

The Quizmaster draws a card and asks a question. Plyayers bets correct answer with A/B/C/D-cards face-down or use their joker card. Correct answer scores points and player may continue answering. Wrong answer eliminates player from the session.
Game last until there are no players or the session is over.

Player with the most points is the winner.

Name: Rayman Raving Rabbids
Description:
From back of the case:
"Save Rayman from BUNNIES GONE BAD.

Get wacky with friends in frantic contests for up to 4 players.

Play over 70 quirky games: Throw cows, milk pigs, run races on animals, and more.

Engage in toilet-plunger-shooting action against the nasty Rabbid invaders."

Name: Yahtzee Hands Down Card Game
Description: It's the "Yahtzee Hands Down" Card Game!  Keep your wits about you and your eye on the cards!  Collect dice cards to make classic combinations - 3 of a kind, 4 of a kind, small straight, full house and YAHTZEE!  Re-roll by discarding cards you don't need and taking a chance on new ones!  But here's the twist... pit your hand against another player's.  Score high and win the Combo card points!  Great Yahtzee fun in a card game!

Name: In the Eye of the Goddess
Description:
[i]Publisher blurb:[/i]
The village of Asmire has hired you to find the trident of Blibdoolpoolp, the Blibdoolblop. With this trident, the people of Asmire believe it will have the power to stop the raids from the Pirates of Far North. However, the danger is present when Blibdoolpoolp is involved.

In the Eye of the Goddess in an exciting one to two-night module for a party of 4-5 players on 10thto 13thlevel. This module is broken up into 20 encounters and receiving experience points for each. Each encounter will involve roleplaying, traps, puzzles, or combat.

Name: Smugglers' Hidden Den
Description:
From publisher blurb:

Monstrous Lair #28: Smugglers' Hidden Den provides you — the busy, time-crunched — with the details to effortlessly bring to life the smuggler dens your campaign. Are you a busy GM? Does session prep take too long? Do you never have time to work on the cool little details that can bring your adventures, dungeons and campaign to life? This short, focused compilation gives you, the time-crunched GM, the tools to effortlessly add verisimilitude and detail to your dungeons. Use the material herein either before or during play and bask in your players' adulation.

Name: The Game of the Century or Casey at the Bat!
Description:
From the back cover:

Ah, Spring,
the time of year when a young man's mind turns to 
.. Pay Per View!

The Game of the Century
What do you get when you mix paranormal power, babes in spandex, aliens, killer robots, and baseball? Why, you get ratings! Stonebrenner the Expansive Owner has got his eye on the legendary Bat of Baseball, and he'll got to any length to get it.  He's invited nine selected paranormals (okay, whoever showed up Saturday night and a few NPC's) to play against nine of the AC Universes's most notorious she-devils in an all-out anything goes baseball game.

The Game of the Century is an adventure to be played in the AC Universe using the Femforce or in your own campaign with your own characters.  It is recommended for characters level 10 or higher.

Name: The Legacy of Theft (Pathfinder)
Description:
From publisher blurb:

Three to five PCs of levels 6-7

The town of Ghezbaldi has stood for millennia. Recent construction work to build a new inn uncovered the entranceway to a long abandoned underground complex. The builders of the inn, Edwyn and Jackson Cairn, took it upon themselves to drop down into the dark hallways of what some say is a long forgotten thieves’ guild and explore. That was 3 days ago, and now the townsfolk are concerned.

Name: Fen Fiend
Description:
From publisher blurb:

Each download has enough to get you an encounter (and possibly an adventure) quickly and easily.

Page 1: Stat Page (all of the necessary nuts and bolts to use the creature in your 5e game)

Page 2: Fluff Page (Descriptive text to read to your players. Lore to pique their interest. Ecology to help design encounters. Adventure seeds to spur the DM's imagination.)

Page 3: Standee Stuff (a simplified paper miniature that you can print out for play in a tabletop game)

Page 4: VTT Stuff (a 500 pixel by 500 pixel image for use as a token in your favorite virtual tabletop platform)

Name: 10 All-New Space Monsters
Description:
From publisher blurb:

Beware those things what lurk amongst the stars.
10 All-New Space monsters brings you 10 new extraterrestrial terrors for The Pathfinder Roleplaying game.

Inside you'll find:

    The Saucer Men a new monster race with a set of new technological equipment!
    New rules for “vehicle” creatures.!
    A wide selection of space anemones!
    A bonus updated version of the Amawyte!
    Plus much, much more!

Name: Eyes Like Embers
Description:
Publisher BlurbA Savage Worlds One Sheet™ By Matthew Cutter for use with Deadlands: Reloaded™ or as a Western diversion
 The Denver-Pacific trainyards at Elko, Nevada are legendary in the Tombstone Epitaph for their “unclaimed freight”—misrouted parcels that ended up lost in the vast, dusty warehouses. The legends are true. One of those parcels—containing four specimens of a new type of nosferatu—was originally destined for Baron LaCroix. The Agency’s been looking for it ever since…

Name: The Magic 270
Description:
The Magic 270 is an election game where you can become President of the United States by combining a lucky hand and strategic abilities.

By rolling a die and choosing where to place winks you can fight for all 50 states and Washington, D.C.

Winning a state (also D.C.) and getting all the electoral votes of that state happens if you gather a majority of the votes of the state.

There are currently 538 EV in the Electoral College. To win an election, the player must have a majority of the EV. Half of the votes is 269, so 270 is the magic number to win.

Includes:

* Map board
    * Play board
    * Rules Document
    * 5 Wink (3/4" | 19mm) - Blue (~40 ct)
    * 5 Wink (3/4" | 19mm) - Green (~40 ct)
    * 5 Wink (3/4" | 19mm) - Yellow (~40 ct)
    * 5 Wink (3/4" | 19mm) - Red (~40 ct)

See more https://www.thegamecrafter.com/games/the-magic-270

Name: Names of the Disloyal
Description:
In Russia, everyone is responsible to the Motherland to ensure every citizens is a good comrade.

In Names of the Disloyal, you must turn in the names of those who are striving to disrupt the harmony among the people. Roll dice to gather the letters needed to discover the dissidents, use the help of your comrade workers, and find those rumored to be disloyal.

On your turn, you will roll dice, claim cards to your hand and then make names with those cards. The first player to a set number of names triggers the end game.

Game Contents:
162 Letter Cards (Letters of the Revolution)
36 Name Cards (Find the Disloyal)
8 Multi Letter Cards (Workers Unite)
7 Dice each in 4 different colors
12 Scoring Tiles
1 Scorepad

Name: Thornkeep 2-Pack
Description:
Publisher's Blurb:

Delve the dungeons below Thornkeep, the rough-and-tumble starting town of the Pathfinder Online MMO, with this deluxe Flip-Mat 2-Pack featuring four complete dungeon levels designed by gaming superstars Jason Bulmahn, Ed Greenwood, James Jacobs, and Erik Mona! Printed at miniatures-scale and designed for use with the Pathfinder Online: Thornkeep adventure sourcebook, these four dungeon levels easily adapt to your own creations and campaigns.

Each level has a distinct flavor and unique look: Bulmahn’s “Forgotten Laboratory” details experimentation chambers and eldritch secrets; Jacobs’s “Enigma Vaults” features an uncanny museum of oddities gathered from distant planes, planets, and stars; Mona’s “Sanctum of a Lost Age” reveals the chambers of a cadre of ancient spellcasters; and Greenwood’s “Dark Menagerie” features the varied habitats of a powerful archmage’s collection of beasts.

A co-production of Paizo Publishing and Pathfinder Online video game developers Goblinworks, this deluxe Flip-Mat 2-Pack contains two maps measuring 24" x 30" unfolded, and 8" x 10" folded. Coated surfaces can handle any dry-erase, wet-erase, or even permanent marker. Usable by experienced GMs and novices alike, Flip-Mats fit perfectly into any Game Master’s arsenal!

Don’t waste your time sketching when you could be playing. With Pathfinder Flip-Mat: Thornkeep, your adventurers can dive straight into a world of monsters, magic, and treasures!

Name: The Shadow Sorcerer: A Sorcerer Subclass
Description:
From the introduction:

The shadowfell is a realm of mind-shattering magical power.  It twists and distorts itself without rhyme or reason except to drive its denizens ever deeper into madness and despair.  Sometimes, the power of the Shadowfell can bleed through to the material realm and seep into the very fabric of an individual granting them a measure of power.

Name: Racial Handbook: Over 40 New Races and Subraces
Description:
Form the introduction:

Within the world of Dungeons & Dragons (5th Edition) exist a vast quantity of races, of all shapes, sizes, and walks of life.  Within the Player's Handbook (D&D 5e) is listed the most common of the races as options for players to begin their adventure as.  However, some players are not content with just these choices, and some campaigns may like to expand into other options, including the races of creatures that players more commonly encounter as foes.

Name: Retribution
Description:
Publisher blurb:

In the frozen depths of winter, murderous winds mercilessly batter the crumbling Priory of Cymer. Within, trapped by their duty and the heaped snowdrifts that render travel near impossible, the few remaining faithful huddle together and tend the sacred places of their forbears. With the weather worsening, nerves fray and tempers snap as the wind howls its mournful dirge for the forgotten dead of a fallen time. But the worst is yet to come. One of those trapped within holds a murderous grudge that only blood can expunge and as the storm reaches its savage height terrible revenge is wrought amid the frigid halls and faded glories of a bygone age.

Name: Demagogue Demon (ICONS)
Description:
From publisher blurb:

The Manual of Mutants & Monsters Demagogue Demon for ICONS is Here to Make Things Great Again … Honest!

This release of The Manual of Mutants & Monsters for ICONS provides game stats on the Demagogue Demon, also known as a tr'ump demon. These power-mad monsters seek to infiltrate human society and create upheaval and even revolution by spreading economic ruin, hatred, and prejudice as a way to make people beholden to them.

Name: Chronicles of Albian 2: The Wizbury School of Magic
Description:
Someone took the The Wizbury School of Magic's gold... and right before the Magician's Guild inspection, too! In Chronicles of Albian 2: The Wizbury School of Magic, you must search for the missing gold and help get the school ready for its inspection! Rebuild and upgrade the school by selling items you've found. Meet the quirky wizards, witches, students, ghosts and ghouls who live there. And, find that gold! Your school is counting on you in Chronicles of Albian 2: The Wizbury School of Magic. Download some magical school spirit today!

Source: The Publisher Website.

Name: Fantasy Hero Companion II
Description:
Continuing in the foot steps of Fantasy Hero Companion, this sequel provides new rules and items, including:

- New character archetypes and a new race.
- Rules for ships, barding, and jousting.
- Additional example locations.
- Expanded guidelines for spell casting.
- New magic items and rules for creating them.
- Hundreds of new spells
- A guide to Guilds of the Western Shores campaign setting.

Name: Elementary Math/Bingo Math
Description:
Game Manual

If there were every any methods to make learning addition, subtraction, multiplication, and division fun, playing Speed Math and Bingo Math could be the answer.

Speed Math (one player)

Speed Math is designed to develop arithmetical skills by giving you thirty problems and a ten second interval each in which to answer.

Each second of the ten second interval is worth one point. Answering the problem in less than the initial five second interval will give you ten points. After an initial two seconds, the point value will decrease per each second elapsed. If you answer the problem incorrectly, you will not be awarded any points.

You will find as your score increases, the degree of difficulty of the problems increases. Conversely, if you continually give a wrong answer, the following problems will have the same answer or will be a variation of the same problem.

Bingo Math (two players)

Bingo Math has been designed to achieve the same purpose as Speed Math but the process has been altered. Instead of points, you are awarded a Bingo, and you have an additional feature of competing directly against another player.

Each problem comes at six second intervals, these problems are shown at the bottom of each player's Bingo card.

In order to achieve a Bingo, you must move the * [cursor] from the middle square to the answer of the problem located on the Bingo card . . . When you reach the answer, pull the trigger to leave the * in place of the number. If you put your * on the wrong answer, you will be given the correct answer and your opponent will be allowed the remainder of the six seconds to find the correct answer [to his problem].

Name: Quarriors!
Description:
Summon! Capture! Conquer!

Quarriors! is a unique blend of strategy and chance featuring a revolutionary dice building game mechanic. As a Quarrior - a mighty and mystical warrior - only you have the power to capture dangerous quarry from untamed wilds.  But your rivals plot against you! They will send their own creatures and spells to destroy your quarry before you can deliver them to Empress Quina and claim your reward.

Summon your creatures and protect them from your foes to earn the Glory for yourself.  The first player to earn enough Glory will be hailed as champion of the Empress!

Deck building strategy without the tedium of shuffling featuring
 - full transliteration from thee original dice building board game
 - single player and 2-4 player online and offline multiplayer
 - full tutorial included
 - automatic scoring and rule enforcement
 - challenging strategic gameplay

Source: The Developer Website.

Name: Happy Hooligan Game
Description:
Happy Hooligan was a popular and influential early American comic strip by Frederick Burr Opper.

Target game. The gun fires corks at up to 8 targets, all characters from the comic strip;
Happy Hooligan
Montmorency
Gloomy Gus 
Mr. Dough
The Cop
Boitram
Foidinand
Hoiman

Cover shows Happy Hooligan with a bow and arrow, attempting to shoot an apple off Flip the Dog's head.

The winner is the one with the most successful shots when you call a halt to the game session.

Name: Arctic Settlement
Description:
Publisher's blurb:

This full color battlemap is the 387th of a series featuring various terrains. This installment of the battlemap series features a temporary arctic settlement.

The map is 28 x 30 squares in size, with each 1 inch square scaled to represent 5 feet. It is provided in 12 segments, which need to be assembled, in a single PDF using the letter format.

The product has been updated to include a large gridless JPG image of the map, intended for use with VTT software. It is 2016x2160 pixels in size at 72dpi.

Name: Wingspan: Tower Rex Organizer
Description:
First editionWooden organizer to store all components of your Wingspan board game.

     Keeps all tokens/cards/etc. organized;
     Includes removable token tray;
     Includes wooden dice tower;
     Supports sleeved cards (MayDay and etc);
     Keeps pieces safe during transportation.


Note: Will only fit the European expansion unsleeved
				
				
					Second editionWooden organizer to store all components of your Wingspan base game and the European Expansion.

Features:

     Gift that will give you or your friend a journey through the woods and grasslands of Wingspan;
     Free first player token and dice-tower to give your birds and food-dice a house to dwell;
     Card tray that holds all the cards sleeved and safe;
     Special tray to accompany all the eggs and food tokens;
     A separate tray for automa cards, so solo-plays are even cozier;
     Beautiful engravings make the dive into the game atmosphere even deeper;
     The laser-cut plywood smells like a forest in spring;
     You don't need any instruments to put the organizer together, just a bit of glue for extra sturdiness;
     The assembly is even better and faster with friends, so call up your fellow ornithologists to upgrade your expedition in 25 mins.

Name: Wakfu
Description:
Wakfu is a French Collectible Card Game, named after the Massive Multiplayer Online Role Playing Game that reimplements Dofus.

Each player controls a hero, among 12 that have different stats and abilities, and a dimensional bag, in which 4 cards are safe.

A turn consists in playing new cards from hand to put new characters, equipment or zones in play, and performing one single attack against one single target. The defending player may block the attack with his own characters.

Cards, once in play, can be used either as resources to put new cards in play, or to activate their special abilities, or to attack. Either way, when used they are rotated and are not available until next turn. A rotated card may not be used to block the opponent's attack.

After each attack, some experience points may be awarded to either player. The heroes may level up when they reach 6 experience points, and again when they reach 18 experience points. There are two possible ways to win: either kill the opponent's hero, or level up twice with one's own.

Free translation from the back of the starter box:
Chose your hero and his dimensional bag and explore the world of Dofus and Wakfu. Develop your crafting skills, create powerful items, feed your pets and earn XP... create your own ideal game! Tournament play is awaiting you...

Name: The Heights
Description:
This is a 3-D pyramid game where you move pieces up and down the pyramid.  It actually ships with three games in the rules that utilize the common movement mechanism of moving around the pyramid (and/or jumping like checkers).

Kaptor - capture all of your opponents pieces

The Crown - have 5 of your pieces fill the top five holes at the top of the pyramid

The Voyage - fill the six bottom slots on the opposite side of the board where your opponent started

Name: Wild Terra Online
Description:
Wild Terra Online is a massively multiplayer life simulator in a fully player-driven medieval world. Here everyone will find an occupation that appeals to one’s soul: world exploration, hunting, crafting, home decorating, fights and castle sieges. Start as a survivor - become a medieval king!

Source: The Game Website.

Name: Tark Laps Taskus
Description:
Tark Laps Taskus  means "Smart kid in the pocket".
Like in Tark Mees Taskus there is letter in one side of the card but picture on another side of the card instead of category.

Turn around top card and be the first to say something that is on the picture and starting the letter from another card and You get the card as a point. If nobody can´t say anything or there is a tie the card is kept for the next round.
If the deck runs out the player with the most points is the winner.

Other variants included.

Name: Mythos Too
Description:
From publisher blurb:

From the farthest realm beyond the stars

Something is fundamentally wrong in the universe, and the monsters of the mythos are invading the Pathfinder RPG again, from minor minions like the morlock and skum, debased cultists and the corrupted remnant of civilizations of yore, all the way up to the spectacular sinister creatures like the spawn of Yog-Sothoth and the star-spawn of Cthulhu, as well as the brand-new blackgate behemoth, a tentacular terror that births mysterious monoliths whose inscrutable inscriptions offer the chance at forbidden cosmic knowledge and unknowable cosmic terror. Alien races are here as well, from the foul fungal conquerors, the mi-go, to the thought-projecting yithians and the gene-warping elder things. Stranger things still are found in sky and sea, from flying polyps and bholes to eyes of the deep, and impossible creatures from places beyond understanding like the dream-haunting nightgaunt and the mysterious color out of space. A dozen and one corrupt creatures of every description lie within, from CR 3 to 25, but if two whole books of mythic mythos monsters are just not enough we also provide you with the new xenoid template and its even more awful mythic xenoid version, to turn the humblest creature to a pseudonatural terror of unnatural menace.

Name: Operation Market Garden
Description:
Operation Market Garden was the audacious plan to seize a bridgehead across the Rhine River in Holland, 1944.  Though scale is not mentioned it appears to be operational level (the Allies have fourteen "5-3" parachute units, as a gauge).

This game features weather effects and special rules for airborne drops, armor attack and engineers.  Optional rules include a "Short Hook" objective for the Allies occupying the towns of Goch and Doetinchhem instead of closure to the North Sea.

238 die cut counters (Allies are blue, Germans are red), 12-page rulebook, a 24" x 28" three color map sheet, and a cover sheet. A six-sided die is needed as well as some paper and pencils.

Name: Rollergames
Description:
[User Summary]

Rollergames is a scrolling beat 'em up on roller blades, loosely based on the Rollergames franchise and television show. In addition to the typical fighting of the beat 'em up genre, it features platforming elements and a unique sense of speed.

Name: CZFT Fantasy
Description:
User summary:

This supplement adapts the CZFT rules to a traditional high fantasy genre.  This is the most-developed setting available for the game and is distributed as a series of 43 MS Word files and one JPEG setting map.  In addition to variant rules to support fantasy elements, a substantial number of specific locations are provided and a possible major campaign arc (guild wars) is developed.

Name: Imperium of Man
Description:
Imperium of Man is a solitaire card game set in the Warhammer 40K universe. The player represents the Human Empire who must defeat all enemy units from the alien worlds: Chaos, Eldar, Tyranids, Orks, Necrons, and Tau. There is also 1 Internal Foe: Rebel Worlds.

Each turn in the game contains 10 phases. In these phases, new enemies are spawned, random events happen, new tech is built, and battles are fought. Battles are fought by rolling a D10 and applying any modifiers from built technology. A modified roll of 6+ is a hit for both the enemy aliens and the Human Empire. The player has a supply of Empire Points which grow throughout the game. These points can be used to absorb hits when no Empire Units are left on the battlefield. The Empire Points aslo affect the number of new units that the player can recruit each round.

To win, the player must eliminate all enemy unit. The final score is the number of turns it took to eliminate them. The game is lost if the player loses all Empire Points before eliminating the enemies.

Name: Stick 'em Up
Description:
The game consists of a deck of thirty-two oversized playing cards. Each card depicts a sheriff, a gunman or an ordinary cowboy. Each player is dealt a card and looks at it secretly.

When it is a player's turn, that player returns the card to the bottom of the pile and draws another if it is not a gunman or a sheriff. If a player has a gunman, that player can choose to eliminate another player by saying, "Stick 'em Up!" If the chosen player responds by revealing a card whose cowboy doesn't have his hands up that player is eliminated. Responding with a gunman or sheriff eliminates the player who is taking a turn.

If a player reveals a sheriff on his turn, all players holding gunmen are out of the game. The last player remaining is the winner.

Name: Dreadsands
Description:
From the introduction:

Hearthe is a planet covered in red sand. Fresh water is extremely scarce and the wells that serve the city are guarded heavily. The city is ruled by a merciless Lich-Queen whose magical powers are unrivaled save by her master. Her agents are everywhere and ruthless when they catch a traitor. Yet there are many willing to give their lives to overthrow her and to bring justice to their people. The situation inside the city is barbaric. No one is trusted, and freedom is just a dream.

Outside the city, the desert is roamed by ravenous creatures of unimaginable cunning and cruelty. The once busy trade routes have fallen silent as the other cities either vanished or were abandoned. Haarduune is cut off and stands alone against the encroaching sands. Every day could be her last. Hope is something only whispered about and never given more than a fleeting thought for fear what little of it is left will shatter into a thousand pieces and be scattered by the scorching desert winds.

User summary:

Dreadsands is a genre-specific implementation of the author's generic, universal G.A.M.E. (Generic Action Mediation Engine) System.  However, the Dreadsands manual includes all needed material from The G.A.M.E. System.

Name: Mahjongg Dimensions Mobile
Description:
Mahjongg Dimensions is now available on the App Store! Play your favorite 3D mahjongg game with simple touch screen controls that give you even more precise control over your game! Compare scores with your friends in the online leaderboard, or just play to beat your own scores. No iPhone, iPod touch, or iPad game collection is complete without Mahjongg Dimensions Mobile!

Source: The Publisher Website.

Name: Imperial Settlers: Storage Tiles
Description:
Two new tiles that keep some resources between rounds. These two tiles help every player each round get a few more resources. Workers from Raze actions or leftover goods from previous rounds will get redistributed next round!

Official Rules:
During setup, place 0 to 2 Storage Tiles near the Score Track. Follow the instructions on the tiles during play.

Name: Envoyer (Issue 45 - Jul 2000)
Description: The 45. issue of the german RPG magazine.

Name: Kölle Das Spielchen
Description:
Objective: be the first gaining most winning points after getting rid of all your cards; find correct answers for appropriate questions; learn more about Cologne
- acting by turns -
draw cards (according to number of participants) from a shuffled pile {230 'sag-mal' cards (trivia),90 'mach-mal' cards (action/creativity) and 30 'moment-mal' cards (tactical decisions/gambling)}; 
active player chooses one of his/her cards, reads the question (mostly a poser, sometimes a stumper) about Cologne trying to find/get the right answer... clockwise. Wrong reply => Must draw an additional card. Correct? Put this card upon your bonus pile (=5 bonus points). No one knows => question master must discard this card upon his/her malus pile.
Game ends after anybody got rid of his/her cards
note:
can also be used as an expansion for KÃ¶lle  das Stadt-Spiel

Name: Leave It To Beaver Money Maker Game
Description: Race across the board trying to earn money along the way. Players earn money by drawing cards that can give them a profit or a loss, as well as landing on fixed value spaces. The player to reach the "home" space with the most money wins.

Name: Pomegranate Planet
Description:
In Pomegranate Planet, take on the role of a pomegranate farmer trying to out-grow the competition. You will use Pomegranate Power Pebbles, or “Pom Pebbles” as the locals call them, to acquire items that you will need from the Market. The Market uses a blind bidding system, and each item in the Market will go to the player that bid the most Pom Pebbles for that item. However, you can only put up a single card for bid at a time, each valued at a different number of Pom Pebbles. Water and Fertilizer will help your seeds grow into delicious, nutritious pomegranates.  Pollinate and Greenhouse cards get your fields to produce more pomegranates, and Tractors can help you move items from one field to another, making the most of your farmland. Use your Pom Pebbles wisely; wasting your higher value Pom Pebbles early could allow your opponents to easily snag a more valuable item later on! Win the best items at the market to become the primary purveyor of pomegranates on the planet!

—description from the publisher

Name: Set Schnupperspiel
Description:
Set Schnupperspiel or Set Demo Deck is a small, promotional copy of Set! containing 27 cards.

In SET, each card contains 1-3 objects, with all of the objects on a card having the same color, shape and shading. Colours, shapes, and shadings come in three different types: green, purple and red; oval, diamond and squiggle. As opposed to the original game, there is only one type of shading; solid.

The object of the game is to create sets of 3 cards that are either all alike or all different.

The Set Schnupperspiel, or Set Demo Deck, was available at the AMIGO Spiel + Freizeit GmbH booth, at Spiel '14, as a freebie.

The Set Schnupperspiel was also available in Stadt Land Spielt! Sonderdrucke 2018 as part of that games package.

Name: The Pugmire System Guide For OGL 5E Creators
Description:
Publisher Blurb:

The Pugmire System Guide For OGL 5E Creators is designed to ease you into the process of creating work for the Canis Minor Community Content program. Creators who are familiar with the systems and terms used in the System Reference Document 5.1 (SRD5) will find information within these pages that will aid in the process of creating new materials that are compatible with Pugmire. While Pugmire runs on the same core engine as the OGL 5e, there are a number of items that are addressed differently in Pugmire.

This booklet contains a step by step walk-through of the changes in terminology, system effect, and design between Pugmire and the OGL5e. You will also find a quick reference terminology guide that acts as an OGL 5e to Pugmire dictionary and includes relevant page numbers for Pugmire.

Name: Europa Rundreise
Description:
This 1930s German game is a spin-and-move tour around Europe. There is a spinner in each corner of the board, and the four cute cars provided are in nicely painted ceramic: a very unusual feature in an era of typically metal or wooden pieces.

Each player starts and finishes in Berlin, and may travel either clockwise or counterclockwise. Players must follow directions in the rules if they land on one of Europe's 12 major cities, some good and some bad. In surely unintentional pre-WWII irony, the trip from Berlin goes no further east than Stalingrad, where the directions say the driver "decides to stay a few days in the city of Tractor Works", and loses two turns.

Name: Panzer Elite Action: Dunes of War
Description:
User Summary:

Panzer Elite Action: Dunes of War is a fast paced squad level historical tank battle simulation in which you get to control either an American or a German tank commander during Rommel's offensive in North Africa.

Your goal if you choose to play as an American commander is to drive the Germans out of North Africa. If, on the other hand, you choose to play as a German commander, your task will be to help some Italian allies stranded in the Sahara desert.

In both cases you command a squad of tanks and you can play six levels with an up-to-32 players multiplayer capability in either campaign. Blast enemy tanks and assorted troops to Kingdom Come trying not to be blown away in the meantime.

Name: Subspace
Description:
[User Summary]:

Subspace is a top-down 2d shooter. Players may choose from eight different ships with varying specalties. There are many different game modes including chaos, capture the flag, powerball, and league play. The game is capable of hosting hundreds of players in a single zone, and is often thought of as one of the first massively multiplayer games.

In 2007, a modified client designed to be more secure against game hacks called Continuum was released.  It can be downloaded at http://www.getcontinuum.com/ for free.

Name: Extinction
Description:
Extinction is a chess-like Icehouse game for two players on an 8x8 grid. Each player has five pieces each of three different sized piece. Each size of piece is a different "specie" and has different properties of movement. The largest pieces, "Queens", move like knights in Chess and may only capture the medium pieces, "Drones". Drones move similarly to Rooks, but with a range of motion limited to 2 squares. Drones may capture only the smallest pieces, "Pawns". Lastly, Pawns move similarly to Bishops in Chess, with a limited range of motion of 2 squares, and they may only capture the largest pieces, Queens. A player wins when they have captured 4 pieces of one species of their opponent's playing pieces.

The rules for Extinction are available online at: http://web.archive.org/web/20060818091717/filebox.vt.edu/users/akopczen/Ice-PDFs/Extinction.pdf

Name: Land Ironclads
Description:
From the publisher:

Land Ironclads is a companion game to Aeronef: Victorian Science Fiction Flyer Combat Rules, the immensely popular rules for aerial warfare in an alternative late C.19th by Wessex Games. As its name implies, LI deals with combat on the ground in the same period. The kings of the battlefield are huge fighting machines, the Ironclads of the title, which cross the landscape on tracks, wheels or even primitive mechanical legs, dealing destruction wherever they go. Small steam-driven machines, known as contraptions and akin to the tanks of the First World War, scurry between the hulking ironclads creating their own smaller form of mayhem. More conventional infantry, cavalry and artillery units, albeit augmented with all manner of fantastic weaponry, add to the confusion. Giant aeronef, dirigibles and winged aircraft fight their own battles in the sky while raining down bombs on the units below.

Name: Crossroads
Description:
"Modern Mythic Role Playing"

Characters are Eternals, mortals chosen by a Tempus to fight in the Eternal War (good versus evil). Character types include Sentinels (protectors and shepherds of humanity) and Defilers (with various evil goals).

The default setting is modern day Seattle. Rules (and emphasis) are given on running an Epilogue for characters who die, which includes the appropriate afterlife.

From the back cover:

"So then I'm immortal?" Jade asked.
  "I'm afraid not. You can die like any other human. The difference is that you've been set apart from the rest of humanity. Aided by the Tempus, your essence hides you from the prying eyes of mortals. Even as we speak, computers are losing your files. You will quickly find that if someone looks for you, you simply don't exist," Covell answered.
  "What about my job?" Jade asked.
  "Most of the Eternals leave their jobs and their friends and family."
  "Why?" Jade asked.
  "The Eternals who chose the pah to the celestial become Sentinls. The Eternals that slide towards the nefarious become Defilers. The Defilers, and other Children of the Dark One, don't give a rat's ass about non-combatants."
  "So what do these Sentinels do?" she asked.
  "As the cracks widen in the Great Barrier, more Children of the Dark One escape from Hell to attack humanity."
  "And the Defilers try to break down the Barrier, right?" Jade asked.
  "I think you're starting to see the big picture."

Name: Cutlass Heavy Fighter
Description:
From publisher blurb:

This product is a little booklet of a Traveller compatible starship. The ship introduced in this installment of the series is the heavy Cutlass-Class fighter.

The PDF contains the background of the ship, statistics for it and its crew. In addition the document contains simple deckplans (Without scale or grid!) of individual sections of the ship and images showing the ship from various directions.

Name: Hidden Empires II
Description:
Hidden Empires II is a print-and-play game for 2 to 6 players where each player assumes the role of an ant colony. Players deploy worker ants on an abstracted hex-area map to look for and forage food. Colonies use food to produce more workers to produce more food, etc. Eventually colonies grow large enough to produce reproductive male and female ants. Players score points for each reproductive ant released during a nuptial flight.

A deck of cards provide environmental events and different genetic traits for the various ant species. Conflict between colonies is possible but is not the primary focus of the game. All events, traits, and general game play are based on the natural history of actual ant species.

Hidden Empires II is a major update to Hidden Empires and includes a larger map, less random traits, and clearer rules divided into basic, advanced and optional sections.

Name: Vertigo
Description:
You head an industrial nation and must look after your citizens' welfare.  You must develop your country as fast or faster than your competitors ---but the price to pay is pollution, which affects every one.  The players must negotiate with each other through the United Nations' Council and agree on how to develop their countries.
The winner is the country with the most industrial plants at the end ---if there is a winner!

The rules are simple and there is no clear winning strategy.  There is some downtime during other players' turns, but Vertigo should nevertheless be a solid addition to your game library.

Name: The Asylum & Other Tales
Description:
Seven Call of Cthulhu scenarios designed to be used as transitional scenarios.

Contents:
The Auction (McCall)
The Madman (Harmon)
Black Devil Mountain (Hargrave)
The Asylum (McCall)
The Mauretania (Willner)
Gate from the Past (Clegg)
Westchester House (Wolcott)

From the back of the book:

In every Call of Cthulhu campaign certain situations arise regularly.  This book takes seven of those situations and turns them into horrifying adventures.  Each story is meant to be used freely by the Keeper (the gamemaster) when he or she needs a quick plot for an impromptu game or as fillers in larger campaigns.  Investigators' Information, Keeper's Background, and suggestions for use are provided for each episode.  The center four, gray-edged, pages are to be carefully pulled out and handed to the players appropriately as per the scenario.

Name: Sleepers
Description:
In Sleepers, you are the leader of a resistance network operating in occupied France during World War II. Your primary mission is recruit a network of operatives working throughout the country; failing that, eliminating the other networks which are interfering with your own would allow you to build your network without interference.
 When first recruited, agents are face-down and inactive (sleeper agents); later in the game, they may be activated to perform some task (active agents). The unqualified term agents applies to both active and sleeper agents. Tiles in hand or the bag are merely tiles, bribes and blackmail material which can be used to recruit agents.

EQUIPMENT


     1 hexagonal board (61 hexes)
     30 Agents for each player (different types)


OBJECTIVE

There are several ways to lose Sleepers:


     Morale: a player is eliminated once ten of their agents are killed (the enemy spymaster flees the country).
     Capture: a player is eliminated if they are surrounded by active militia (the enemy spymaster is captured).
     Attrition: a player is eliminated if they cannot move (no more tiles AND no sleeper agents).


There are also several ways to win:


     Success: make a line of active agents joining any two opposite sides of the board (your network covers the whole country).
     Liberation: create a doomsday device by making a line of 5 active Scientists (you destroy Germany and free France).
     Elimination: eliminate all other players.
Mechanics: ['Enclosure', 'Hexagon Grid', 'Memory', 'Network and Route Building', 'Pattern Building', 'Tile Placement']

Name: Climb The Mountain
Description: This track game plays similar to "Snakes and Ladders". A double pointed spinner is used for movement and the player may choose either of the two numbers indicated. For example, if the arrow points to 5 at one end and 2 at the other, the player may advance to the nearest 2 on the track or the nearest 5. Landing on a "Helping Hand" space moves the player up to the space indicated by an arrow to the track above. Landing on a "Landslide" or the "Whirlwind" sends the player down to the space below. The first player to reach the top of the mountain wins.

Name: Silk Roads
Description:
Central Asia circa 160 CE.

The Silk Roads were built for trade between Europe and China. The most trade grew where the longest roads crossed each other. The swiftest traders traveled by horse through plains and mountains to dominate the roads and collect the most wealth.

Work together to build roads, but wealth is only collected on a long road by the player who put down the most sections. Silk Roads is an abstract tile placement game on an 8 x 8 game board. Players take turns to place sections of road (tiles) while following the topological restrictions imposed by the tiles already placed. The game is over when there are no more empty squares on the board or all players have passed. Each player then gains the wealth from the roads they dominate. The winner is the player who has gained the greatest wealth.

Dominate the expanding trade network of Silk Roads, while keeping a close eye on other players’ routes.

SILK ROADS IS ONLY AVAILABLE AS PART OF THE ANCIENT WORLD MULTI GAME SYSTEM FROM PLAYFORD GAMES.

-description from designer

Name: Zyklopen & Katakomben
Description: The players try to kill cyclops and monsters in ancient Greece. Besides monster-hunting you can work to earn money and buy equipment for better hunting.

Name: Super Dungeon Explore: Dragon's Clutch
Description:
Publisher description:

Dragons Clutch - Denizen Box - expand your collection with this single summoning point worth of dragon whelps and critters from the original boxed game.

Box text:

Mighty Starfire has roamed the halls and carved stone of the Dragon Back Peaks for centuries. As much as he enjoys the admiration of his Kobold minions, it is his own children that most delights this ancient beast, as they bicker over the bones of would-be adventurers.

This expansion includes:
7 fully assembled Soda Pop Miniatures, Monster game cards and an unique Dragon's Clutch Treasure Card
Mechanics: ['Action Points', 'Dice Rolling', 'Modular Board', 'Variable Phase Order', 'Variable Player Powers']

Name: Street Starter Set
Description:
User Summary:

The Street Starter Set is part of the City Builder System. The Street Starter Set is made of "Dwarvenite". The item comes in both painted and unpainted versions.

The Street Starter Set comes with these 18 pieces:
(4) Sidewalk, 2x2     
(2) Street, Curve In, 4x4     
(2) Street, Curve Out, 4x4         
(9) Street, Straight, 4x4          
(1) Street, Straight, Sewer Grate, 4x4

Name: Stand at Mortain
Description:
Stand at Mortain is the first game in the Pocket Battle Games series from LPS, Inc.

Following the defeat of the British and Canadian offensives of Operations Goodwood and Spring, in August 1944 the Germans redeployed several Panzer divisions to shut down the American Operation Cobra offensive by attacking due west to the sea. The fiercest fighting occurred to the north and east of Mortain at Hill 314 (hex 1501 on the game map) where surrounded Americans of the 2nd Battalion of the 120th Regiment threw back repeated German attacks. Control of the high ground here would make the Mortain position nearly untenable, and with it the main Allied supply route from Normandy south would be severed.

Stand at Mortain is a mini-game complete with map, rules and counters. No need for dice, use your own deck of standard playing cards and your initiative to enjoy this simple-but-exciting WW2 game.

Name: Recluse
Description:
From publisher blurb:

Sometimes what your campaign needs is a hero of legend, who everyone recognizes, even though they've never met him before.

Recluse (PL 10) is a young, idealistic hero granted the powers of the spider, which are great when facing a villain, and of no use whatsoever when dealing with every other aspect of life.

Name: The Frontiers of Space: Aliens of the Sonora Sector
Description:
From publisher blurb:

The Sonora Sector has many different human and non human worlds. Several alien races live among the humans. Some are peaceful. Some are not. But all have personalities of their own. Meet them in this installment of the Frontiers of Space.

Name: ASL Annual '95
Description:
An extra large magazine/supplement to make up for the 'year without ASL' (1994), containing articles and scenarios. It came with an outer cardstock cover that had overlays for Deluxe ASL; however, these turned out to be printed at the wrong size


( from the Table of Contents:)

Airborne Samurai by Steven C. Swann
Annual Crossfire by Robert Banozic & Mark Nixon
Warriors All! by David Payne
The Chestnuts of Normandy by Jim Stahler
En Garde by Chuck Goetz
The Gentle Art of Routing by Steve Tinsley
The Scenarios of Normandy by Jim Stahler
Series Replay: Festung St. Edouard by Steve Peterson, Brian Youse & Chuck Goetz

Scenarios:
A68 Acts of Defiance
A69 Broich Bash
A70 Wintergewitter
A71 Patton's Prayers
A72 Italian Brothers
A73 Not Out of the Woods Yet
A74 Valhalla Bound
A75 Medal of Honor
A76 Night Drop
A77 Hide & Seek
A78 Prelude to Breakout
A79 Mike Red
A80 Commando Schenke
A81 They Fired on Odessa...
A82 Orange at Walawbum
A83 Last of Their Strength
A84 Endless Struggle
A85 Airborne Samurai
A86 Fighting Sparrow
A87 The Grand Canal
A88 Surprise Encounter
A89 First Day of Diadem
A90 Cutting Out a Strongpoint
DA13 The Mailed Fist

Name: Sexually Transmitted Future
Description:
From publisher blurb:

By 2020, genetic engineering was THE hot new military science, and the first Powered super-soldiers had been decanted. Today, it's 2107 and decades of urban warfare, xeno-immigration and post-human evolution have fundamentally altered the human genome.

As gene-tech advanced, civilian genetic alteration became increasingly common. While genetically altered supersoldiers dominate the battlefield, and display amazing, inhuman powers, even the ordinary citizens of the future are genetically different from 21st century mankind. Many of the ordinary men and women of the future- the teachers, the stockbrokers, the school kids and Enclave block-moms, the wage-slaves and porn stars, the street scum and the swing voters- possess genetic gifts which straddle the line between baseline homo sapiens and Powered.

Each future human being is a species of one- a custom built human being designed to survive the rigors of a segregated planet.

Sexually Transmitted Future is a sourcebook for the Otherverse America campaign setting, but can easily be used with other near-future sci-fi and cyberpunk settings, including Psi-Watch and Galaxy Command. Sexually Transmitted Future includes:

    Expanded racial traits for playing baseline human characters.
    Complete rules for genetic modification, engineering the unborn and cloning.
    New affiliations focused on post-human culture.
    Over 80 new gene mods that grant the recipients unique new racial traits.
    A new kind of feat: Gene Feats, which let genetically engineered characters hack their genome and the DNA of their victims to make the biologically impossible look easy.

Name: Knights vs Steambots
Description:
Card filler on the mechanics of "rock-paper-scissors."

"The old dungeon of the castle of King Cybertania full of weapons, stones, and ancient scrolls. However, the magician Algorimus created evil robots-Golems, who attack anyone who dared to walk through the dungeon. You - a brave knight, whom the king had locked in the dungeon, along with your rivals. Your task - to survive in the dungeon, to preserve and increase your team Knights and collect the most Trophies and destroy more SteamBots"

Players in the game turn-by-turn move tokens of his knights on the game field, consisting of Terrain cards and take the card out of the deck, indicating findings on that place.

It may be Trophies, robots-SteamBots or pieces of another Territory. If two or three players meet on one Terrain card, they fight among themselves for the findings by the "rock-paper-scissors" card.

The winner is the player that kept more Knights in the team, destroy more STEAMBOTs and earned the most Trophies. For all of this, The King get Gold. More Gold - and you are best (and famous) Knight.

Final English Rules: https://drive.google.com/open?id=1Emk6UhyrtiV8kl0vL0e5B0rizKIRUKjt

Name: Desert Ruins
Description:
From the back of the pack:

24" x 30" mat
1" squares on each side

SCORCHING SANDS!

Whether your party is searching for a lost pyramid or fighting to survive in the harsh desert sun, no Game Master wants to interrupt the adventure to draw every single sand dune and fallen obelisk. Fortunately, with Paizo Publishing's latest Pathfinder Flip-Mat, you don't have to! This line of gaming maps provides ready-to-use and captivatingly detailed fantasy set pieces for the busy Game Master. Whether you need a site to unearth buried secrets or battle deadly scorpions, this double-sided combat mat makes the perfect setting!

Don't waste your time sketching when you could be playing. With Pathfinder Flip-Mat: Desert Ruins, you'll be ready next time your players brave the desert sun!

Name: Jack of All Tribes
Description:
User Summary

A game where you are building up a village. You do this by gathering resources upgrading buildings with the resources.

Name: Monopoly: York Edition
Description: A version of the classic game Monopoly, with names and images of board elements taken from York, England.

Name: Duffer Dave
Description:
DUFFER DAVE is a pure strategy problem solving game. Help Duffer Dave reach the bucket of practice golf balls in each of the 50 challenging puzzles. Using crates, gopher holes, balls and other objects, you must avoid the holographic sandtrap lasers and reach the bucket of golf balls to solve these puzzles. The solutions are provided if you need help. A challenge for all problem solvers.

Source: The Developer Website.

Name: Sacrilegium
Description:
UNRELEASED GAME – VAPORWARE

    
    
        
This game is stuck in the development limbo known as Vaporware. Few to no details have been released about about its gameplay, plot, or release date since its announcement many years ago. It may or may not be in active development, but neither has it been cancelled officially.

    


The story follows a 20 year old woman and California college student named Alex across the world, from the misty shores of San Francisco to the fearsome and foreboding corners of the Old Continent. There Alex learns that assumptions can be lethally deceptive and that the seemingly safe modern world is but half of a chamber divided by a dark curtain... that beyond that opaque veil lies the embodiment of nightmares spawned into flesh.

Alone, surrounded, and trapped in darkness Alex is forced to face the Moroi, modern vampires. Thrust in the middle of a deadly plot filled with intrigue and betrayal, Alex must call upon her instincts, skills, knowledge and devotion to survive and make it out alive with her mind and soul intact - as well as save her friends.

Multiple ranged weapons from handguns to crossbows are at Alex's disposal. The game will feature quick time events, a chopper chase, and allow the player to ride a police motorbike.

Source: Wikipedia, "Sacrilegium (video game)", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

Name: Rolemaster Blog Fanzine (Issue 21 - Jan 2019)
Description:
The Rolemaster Blog Fanzine
Issue 21
January 2019

Name: Among Cultists: A Social Deduction Thriller
Description:
Become a member of M, a secret society! 4-8 investigators try to prevent the arrival of a big evil in University... but watch out: evil cultists are already among us!

AMONG CULTISTS, a unique social deduction experience, inspired by the masterpiece AMONG US from Innersloth!

Combining board game elements with traditional social deduction, players are either Investigators or Cultists and move around the board, triggering events, actions and encounters.  Investigators have 10 rounds to reach the necessary victory points or vote out all the Cultists.  The Cultists have 10 rounds to sabotage or kill the Investigators.
Mechanics: ['Action/Event', 'Deduction', 'Hidden Roles', 'Point to Point Movement', 'Team-Based Game', 'Traitor Game', 'Voting']

Name: Crossroads of Destiny, Part One: The Nightmare Begins
Description:
A One-Round Low-Rank Adventure

From the introduction:

The end of the world is just the beginning of the nightmare.

This mod, and all mods in Nightmare War, should be played in order if at all possible.

Name: Imperial Settlers: In-store Event Kit 2018 – Administration Alternate Artwork Cards
Description:
Portal Games created an 2018 event kit with promo-cards for each faction of the base game. If you participate in the event, you can keep the 3 promo-cards of the faction you've played with at the event. For each faction you get 3 copies of the same card.

The Romans get a card called 'Administration' and has a feature: each time you build a faction building, gain 1 gold and 1 star.

These cards are alternate artwork cards and replace the Administration cards found in Roman's deck in the base game

Contained in:
Imperial Settlers: In-store Event Kit 2018

Name: Enviro-Quest
Description:
ENVIRO-QUEST is an environment-based trivia board game.

Players progress around a board answering questions or undertaking other actions dependent on where the playing piece lands.  Scoring counters are won or lost by successfully or incorrectly answering questions.

"Power" cards are gained by landing on certain squares.  These allow a player to move a particular number of spaces(i.e. a power card of value 5 allows you to move 5 spaces) - this is in lieu of actually rolling the dice.

The game is won when a player has collected 20 scoring counters and completed moving around the track to the finish (the Globe).

Name: Schizonauts: The Mnemonic Conspiracy
Description:
User summary:

This highly idiosyncratic and unusual game utilizes character pairs that are in some ways the "same" person and in other ways two distinct people.  Each character sheet has an Agent and a Thief - the two people - and they intersect in the middle third of the sheet in a zone called the "mnemonic overlap".  Each character in the pair has three Attributes (Intimacy, Violence, and Knowledge) with numeric ratings distributed from a standard array.  The Attribute ratings vary between the members of the character pair.  Each character in the pair also has various distinct Traits, or narrative tags.

The game is played in phases and utilizes a complicated combination of specialized cards and fairly large dice pools.  Much of the action (but certainly not all) involves the character pairs attempting to manage their shared "mnemonic overlap".

Name: The Rose Duels
Description:
From the document:

The Rose Duels is a highly narrative game. Most of the game consist of dialogue between the characters. Simply put, narration is like telling a story. Each player plays a role of the character they have created, and they enact the characters throughout the story.
...
The character creation is done in two steps. First the players create the Rose together, and after that they go on creating their own characters.

Name: Orkish Giantslayers
Description:
From Introduction:

They found the beast in its lair, with its heavy-lidded human eyes betraying it by staying closed. They slew it, still asleep, with their poisons and their magic blades. They left the meat of its serpentine body and stripped the flesh from its man-like head, then rowed its skull down the subterranean sea in search of more prey. They are the greatest warriors of the goblinoid world, spitting in the eyes of death every chance they get just to take down the largest prey they can find. They are the orkish giantslayers, and they are truly a breed apart.

It has been over one hundred years since this company was formed. Generations have come and gone, and so many have died, but the traditions remain. All the techniques they have developed in their quest to rid their world of hostile megafauna continue to see use. There is no longer even one single pack of hunters. The giantslayers have grown into a loose community of enthusiasts willing to take risks verging on suicidal to ensure the safety of their own communities and even those of others they will never know.

Examples of their arcane crafts include their emerald medallions, the shards of giant teeth they wear on strings, and their unseeable masks.

Name: Comical Tivoli Game
Description:
The game consists of a board with holes in. Each hole scores a certain number of points. At the back of the board, a three-dimensional 'slide' is erected. Into the top of this slide, a player in his turn, drops a ball. The ball will bounce around the circus clowns at either side of the slide and, eventually, come out at the bottom and score points when it settles into one of the holes.

The points available range from 5 to 100, the latter hole being right in the middle of the board.

The one who earns the most points, wins.

Name: Ambush Road
Description:
From publisher blurb:

This product is a 48 x 30 inch,Battlemap of a Roadway near ruins, it has Hex, Square and No Overlays, it also includes the VTT files for online play.

“Taking the mountain road is indeed faster, but bandits live in the ruins near the caldera. Only take the road if you must reach your destination quickly. It will take weeks to circumnavigate the mountains staying on the lowlands, but it’s much safer.’”

—Post-Apocalyptic Survivor

Ambush Road includes a single level exterior map of a winding canyon road carved out of the surrounding mountains. There are mountains to the north and south of the road, with a water-filled caldera to the north center and a circular ruin to the northeast.

Ambush Road can be utilized in modern, post-apocalyptic, or horror games. It could also be used in fantasy games with the ruins from an ancient fallen culture. It can also be an interesting track in a straightaway course or drag racing kind of game.

Adventure hook for use with this map:

Canyon Run:  Bandits have entrenched themselves in the nearby mountains and taken over a key canyon road that acts as a short cut over a large mountain range. The lowland villagers warn the group of making a run through the canyon and advise going around the mountain range the long way. But the long way around costs vital gasoline; the canyon road is the fastest route to cut through the mountains.

If the group goes up to the canyon pass, they have to survive a gauntlet of bandits and traps along the road to get through. The bandits have made their camp in the ruins of an old circular structure, perhaps a lighthouse that stood before the apocalypse. The bandits seem to be excavating the ruins, digging for old food in cans and lantern oil for light at night. The caldera lake is their water source. They also ambush travelers driving through the pass to rob them of their supplies. If the player characters can defeat the bandits, they’ll find a cache of food, oil, ammo, and enough water to fill their canteens to get over the mountains easily from the lake.

Name: The Sivatag Desert
Description:
(user summary)

A drag-and-drop desert for all of your fantasy games. From the Jigsaw Fantasy Patreon.

Name: The Order of Underworld Travelers
Description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Gran March Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

More than a year ago, hundreds of tons of rock collapsed into a cavern below Shiboleth filled with daemons, killing them and destroying their gateway from Gehenna. Ancient vampires who were caught between the Gran March army and the daemons were also crushed by the collapse. Some folks are concerned that the threat from one or both of those sources is not truly crushed. No one really wants to go into the muddy, dangerous, shifting ground beneath the flooded sinkhole to investigate. Volunteers are being accepted.

A Gran March Regional adventure for [character levels] 2 - 12.

Part Four of the Shattered Reflections series.

Note: This adventure will be of particular interest to members of The Order of World Travelers, Syrloch, The Gran March Army and Knights of the Watch. [Characters] who played GRM6-01: All That is Secret and Hidden or GRM6-07: Athenaeum who are members of a recognized Gran March meta-organization or Sheldomar Valley meta-regional meta-organization would also be requested by that organization. Large size [characters] and companions might experience additional difficulties with this scenario.

Name: Hoard Complete Pack
Description:
User Summary

Hoard Complete Pack includes the base game and its two expansions.

Name: The Exploits of Fingers Malone
Description:
From game inlay

15 levels of sheer thrill-power! Be nimble and be quick for it is up to you to collect all the money stolen in the recent bank raids. However you will not be alone - the raiders themselves are onto you and they will try anything to stop you from uncovering their swag!

Name: A Invasão da Alemanha
Description: Wargame on the invasion of Germany in 1944-1945. Can be combined with Barbarossa and Normandia, two other games in the "II Guerra Mundial" series of wargames.

Name: The Mandela Effect Card Game
Description:
Discover which player among the group is from an the other timeline by revealing their false memories. A carefully assembled set of 260 questions designed just for this purpose are at your finger tips. But, they might keep you from using your chosen question!

To discover who is from the other timeline, players compare memories as they play The Mandela Effect Card Game to see who remembers correctly and who is convinced that their memories are correct. No player knows who will be discovered to be from the alternate timeline until the conclusion of the game.

On a turn, Player One and Player Two will determine which of the five categories will be in play during their turn using the associated power symbols. Player One will then draw a card from the deck and read aloud the question for that category - brand names, celebrity names, history movies & TV, or music - to the Player Two (the player on their right). If the Player Two correctly states the current reality, they earn a point.

Correct or not, play then passes to the player on the right and a new turn begins. The first player to 13 points wins. The person with the lowest score is from the other timeline and should be reported to the Deep State immediately!

—description from the publisher

Name: Quicklings
Description:
From publisher blurb:

Enter the world of the Quicklings. What are they, what do they want? Why do they haunt the realm?

This document includes 5 possible origins, 4 stat blocks, a bunch of hooks and thoughts on the quickling's connections to Icons.

Name: President Nation
Description:
User Summary

President Nation invites players to achieve their own political and governmental ambitions:

1) At the local city level, where they can become a Police or Fire Commissioner, Councilman, and even the Mayor.
2) At the state level, where they can become State Legislators, Lt. Governor, and the Governor.
3) At the national level, by becoming US Legislators, Vice-President, and ultimately, President.

Political Networking:
Political Allies in President Nation are a powerful way to advance your career in the game. Each friend plays an important role in your career by 1) Networking with those who have power to appoint you to a higher position, 2) Helping your friends advance their own career, and 3) Finding allies that will endorse and campaign for you.

Political Power and Influence: 
In President Nation, players can achieve significant power and influence by becoming an elected official.  Mayors, Governors, and the President may introduce legislation to increase or decrease taxes on their citizens while elected legislators may vote on legislation important to their citizens.  By achieving positions of power, players can help their citizens achieve their ambitions and create a world of prosperity or economic turmoil.

Voting: 
President Nation includes a brand new game mechanic where players wield their own influence by voting for their choice of the candidates.  Players can pick and choose a candidate that they feel benefits their city, state and nation.  With such an important ability, players can help create the world of their dreams.

Government Career Tracks:
Players can start their own governmental career in a city of their choice. Players, for example, can start off in the Police Department of a city by becoming a Police Cadet.  When a higher position becomes available players can move up ladder and make a higher salary.  Each city has departments for players to choose from so they can advance their career.  When a player is ready, she can run for an elected position and let others know by using campaign tools available in the game.

Name: Computer Baseball
Description:
Here's all the excitement of an afternoon at the old ball park -- The difference is you play the game. You figure your plays -- your strategy. The game gives you the results. Home runs -- grounder to second -- foul -- strike. It's all here in Computer Baseball.

Electronic Data Controls Corporation released a series of electronic board games under their "Computer Games" line, primarily consisting of two-player sports games. The games all used large wooden game boards depicting the playing field and a  game matrix of various results. Each end of the game board had a set of buttons (i.e. offense and defense) that, depending on the combination pressed, would cause a light to illuminate next to one of the rows on the game matrix. The players would then consult the appropriate column to find out what happened.

Name: Crop Circles
Description:
This may be the strangest game you have ever seen! Players begin by building Stonehenge using nicely-produced blocks, but this is just the start of the strategy. The first player, as a druid or as an alien, to place their altar in the center of the stones (and not having it removed by a competing Merlin card) can collect the Sun Circle and the Heal Circle. Bring these Circles to the Eastern Ley Line, declare the Summer Solstice, and win the game!

This game is wild and fun. It includes Planet counters, start counter, UFOs, crop circle cards, Andromeda counters, Yule Circle counters, Zenith Circle counters, Lunar Eclipse Circles, Star Circle counters, Circle and Night dice, and much more. Super components, creative rules with lots of mystical imagery, but most of all good fun as the secrets of the Crop Circles are revealed.

Name: Watch
Description:
You have just started working at a Soviet watch factory that you've discovered used to be a World War II era munitions factory. You've been sent there to produce gears, which you can sell for money, but you also need those gears to disguise the munitions crates you smuggle out. Dig through the files in the foreman's office to uncover evidence of government corruption during the aftermath of WWII. Use the monitoring infrastructure in the foreman's office to catch your coworkers misbehaving and extract bribes from them — but be careful because someone else might be watching YOU!

The artistically composed thematic Eurogame Watch blends theme into the game mechanisms masterfully: While playing, you can feel the clock ticking as you try to hide your mischievous actions from the other players. To succeed, you must ensure that the gears fall into their specific clockwork spot exactly when and where you need it!

—description from the publisher

Name: Tchin Tchin
Description:
The game is composed of cards with characteristics, characteristics defining the character of each player (German, French, Russian…) and objectives. At the beginning of a round, each player gets a character. This character consists of 1 nationality, 1 drink and 1 localization and, inevitably, 1 gesture and 1 word he has to pronounce when they clink glasses. The cards “aperitif” are mixed and posed face hidden in the center of the table. They consist also of 3 characteristics, but are mixed this time (f.e. a German drinks champagne in front of Big Ben). The active player turns over a card “aperitif”. It is necessary to look at it well if one of your characteristics is on the card which has been just turned over; you will have to make the gesture associated with the drink and to pronounce the word associated with the nationality of that character. Inevitably, it is the fastest player who will win the card. 
The game ends when all “aperitif” cards have been played.

Home Page: http://www.guillaumegames.com/Jeux/TchinTchin/TchinTchinAccueil.htm

Name: Shadows of the Deep
Description:
From publisher blurb:

A Pathfinder Roleplaying Game compatible adventure for four to six PCs of 5th to 7th level

The sun rises on a beautiful morning to find the farming families of Pindleton already out in the fields, tending their crops and collecting their harvests. Their fields cover many acres, and have always yielded a great enough bounty to not only feed the village, but provide enough for sale at the market in a nearby city… yet the people are in danger of starvation. A danger from the depths of the world has come to the surface, their intentions as dark as their scales, and their plans well calculated and insidious.

Shadows of the Deep introduces a new sub-race of kobold to your campaign, one that has not only survived free in the dark and dangerous world beneath the surface, but thrived. It will challenge the investigative skills of your PCs, as well as set them on edge as they wonder what surprise these cunning foes have waiting for them around the next bend. As the adventure begins the party is asked discover who and what is stealing the harvest from the farming village of Pindleton, and bring them to justice. The cunning and creativity of the kobolds makes this challenging to be sure, but the true test begins when the adventurers track them to their Warren, which they will defend with every trap, trick and tactic in their arsenal…

    Adventure through a living dungeon, that changes and responds to the presence of your PCs!
    Face cunning foes who are more than a pile of hit points waiting to fight adventurers!
    Set the stage for future adventures in the depths of the world!
    Kobolds: Not just laughable lizards anymore!

Name: Grind House
Description:
You receive an invitation to take part in a mysterious contest at the “Grind House,” an old mansion that once stood as the largest slaughterhouse in the state. The invitation is signed simply by an individual known as “The Host.” The letter promises you the opportunity to play a game to win a reward greater than you could possibly imagine. You arrive at a decaying mansion on a hill along with five other strangers. A tall, narrow man in a tuxedo opens the huge ominous doors to usher you inside. “Thank you for attending this evening...” The Host says in a deep, ominous voice. “The entertainment will be… to die for!” The Host bursts into a sinister echoing laugh. Behind you, the door slams shut and the sound of a heavy deadbolt clicks into place. You and your fellow guests are trapped at the mercy and whims of The Host.  “Shall we play a little game?”

Grind House is a narrative horror game for 2-6 players where you would be considered lucky if survival only costs an arm and a leg. While survival is the ultimate goal, each player has a classic archetype with a secret motive. Some characters like the Doctor may try to keep everyone alive, while the psychopath with surely attempt to split everyone apart.  Others, like the Pianist, just want to keep their hands intact.

For those unfortunate souls who do perish in the house, the game is not over.  Players may return as ghosts to haunt the remaining survivors as they try to make it through the Grind House unscathed.  After exploring all 5 randomized rooms in the house, any survivors left total up their score to determine the winner.

Name: The Space Game
Description:
A game of interstellar trade and conquest. Players explore new worlds, make deals with resources, build fleets and do battle with their fleets, with agents or on the market.  Each turn you may: 
1.Place a piece 
2.Move your ships and/or place agents
3.Bribe stars (to conquer them), battle over stars or build ships.
The object of the game is to be the last surviving player or the player with the most stars and resources wins.

Name: Monopoly Gamer: Mario Kart Power Pack – Donkey Kong
Description:
The Monopoly brand has joined forces with Mario Kart in the Monopoly Gamer Mario Kart Board Game! With Monopoly Gamer Mario Kart Power Packs, character tokens grant unique abilities to optimize players' gameplay experience.

For use with the Monopoly Gamer Mario Kart Board Game.

Donkey Kong's Super Star ability is: You may place a Banana on 2 of your Properties.
Donkey Kong's Power-Up (activated by rolling a Banana) is: You may remove any number of Bananas from the board. Collect 3 Coins from the Bank for each Banana you remove.
Mechanics: ['Roll / Spin and Move', 'Set Collection', 'Stock Holding', 'Take That', 'Variable Player Powers']

Name: Spiel mit Lukas: Torjäger
Description:
This game is part of the "Lukas Podolski game series

There are green and white circles on the board which are connected with white lines with numbers on it.
Each player gets a deck in one color (black or red) and draws four cards. The player that wins the toss begins the game. To pass the ball the player has to play a card with the number equal or higher than the number on the white lines. If a player plays the ball to a white circle he/she can play another card. Otherwise there is a duel between the two players.
Duel:
Each player has four cards (if a player doesn't have four cards, complete the cards, till you have four) Then both player place a card on the table, face down. When both players have chosen a crad, turn around the cards. The player with the highest number on the card, has ball control. That player can pass the ball along the board.

To score points, the player plays the number (or a higher number) indicated on the board in front of the goal. To keep track of the points, a player receives a goal-chip each time a goal is made. If a player runs out of cards, the player with the most points wins the game.

Name: Across the Wide Missouri
Description:
Across the Wide Missouri is a collection of three Civil War battles in Missouri and Arkansas - Wilson's Creek, Pea Ridge and Prairie Grove. Prairie Grove and Wilson's Creek can be played in three to four hours. Pea Ridge is a two day battle with hidden initial deployments, and can take up to 8 hours. Various alternative history options are included.

Wilson's Creek and Prairie Grove are solitaire friendly.  Pea Ridge requires hidden units and maneuver, so some sort of randomized battle plan is needed. Multiple personality disorder or a cooperative friend a plus.

Components:
One 11"x17" Map (Wilson's Creek); One 12"x18" Map (Prairie Grove), One 17"x22" Map (Pea Ridge) 
432 9/16" pieces, representing historical combat units and unit or formation status markers. 
One Game Reference card for each player with Terrain Effects and Combat Results Charts 
28 page color booklet of rules, play illustrations and detailed historical commentary. 
1 Six-sided Die

Currently Shipping (15 September 2007)

Name: World of Lazarus
Description:
Publisher's blurb:

In the near future, time has rendered death obsolete, and life infinitely cheap.  In the wake of governments' failure and global upheaval, the Families stepped in and divvied up the world.  Now peace and order reign in a world of technological marvels and neo-feudalism.

Name: Pingwiny z Madagaskaru: Roy
Description: Bonus card added to second issue of Kurier Planszowy.
Categories: ['Animals', "Children's Game", 'Expansion for Base-game', 'Miniatures', 'Movies / TV / Radio theme']

Name: Legacy: Time Surge
Description:
A lightweight, 2-player game of Time Travel and Technology.

Players draft technology cards each round to keep them to use as influence, or to bid on later in the round.

Players then travel back in time, bidding their influence on establishing technologies to buildup the timeline.

Players return to the present day to draft new techs, and build off the old ones, carefully selecting technologies that benefit them the most.

At the end of the third round players gain victory points for techs they influenced, and dependency bonuses are paid out to the owner of supporting technologies. The player with the highest victory point total is the winner.

Name: Flailing in the Dark
Description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Bissel Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

They have long chiseled away at the stone of Bissel’s foundation... but to what end? Finally, the key is in their grasp, and their plan is beginning to take shape. Soon, that which lurks in shadow will be brought to light... but will it be too late?

A Bissel regional adventure for [character levels] 2-16, and Part 2 of That’s Rhomstaff! II, the Bissel finale.

Name: Witch Spells II (PRD)
Description:
From publisher blurb:

Echelon Reference Series: Witch Spells is a simple document that collects the witch spell list, and all spells in it, for easy use. The spell lists are broken up by level and school, and the spells of each level are grouped together and organized by name.

This is a subset of the entire book, containing only the 2nd-level witch spells.

This is the PRD-Only version, containing information from the PRD.

Name: The Great Dinosaur Hunt
Description:
Travel along the great Dinosaur Hunter. In this game you have to answer questions to move forward. Answer more questions correctly than your opponent and win.
The questions are about Dinosaur and on the board there are lots of facts of paleontology

Name: GEA2703
Description:
From the foreword:

Welcome to GEA2703, a post-apocalyptic role-play setting.  There is no space-travel whatsoever, no aliens, no spaceships, no planet terraforming or colonisation, no hyperspace jumps.

User summary:

GEA2703 was developed as a setting to playtest the Rules of Thumb game.  The setting is somewhat uneven though it is not tightly coupled with the game system (it could be used with almost any system, with minor alterations).

Name: Fantasy Franchise
Description:
Fantasy Franchise is "a real estate game where players purchase franchises, lease space in central Florida malls, and eventually purchase the malls themselves!"
