The malls feature "everything from movie theatres to Mall Security. Nearly all the names are tongue in cheek." The names of the stores and movie posters feature puns and parodies of popular brands such as "Taxi Driver II: My Fare, Lady!" and "While You Were Sleeping... the Movie Ended"

All quotes are taken from the designer's website.

Name: Realms of Adventure
Description:
From the introduction:

Realms of Adventure...is set in the medieval era, with castles, magic, and fantastic creatures.  You can play a knight, a wizard, a rogue, a crusading priest, or any other character you chose.

Realms of Adventure is designed to be compatible with the Advanced Dungeons & Dragons game.  Dungeons & Dragons was the 1st RPG with is origins dating back to 1974.  As a result over the many years a great amount of useful supporting material has been published for it: adventure settings, world settings, monsters, spells, and magic items.  So Realms of Adventure has been designed to take advantage of them and is fully compatible with those supplements.

Name: Shoot First
Description:
From developer's design diary:
Shoot First is an Action Roguelike.

It features 2 player co-op, procedurally generated levels, 5 environments, and online high scores.

Name: Hunter Book: Avenger
Description:
The sourcebook "Hunter Book: Avenger" starts with several pages from hunter.net and a short story.


     Introduction: How to use the book.
     Chapter 1: Explores the nature of monsters, the Messengers and hunters from Avenger perspective.
     Chapter 2: Covers Avengers' unique tactics.
     Chapter 3: Describes the relations of Avengers with other hunters.
     Chapter 4: Presents the creed's attempts to define their purpose.
     Chapter 5: Special rules and edges.
     Chapter 6: Example characters.

Name: 100 Oddities for a Thieves' Guild
Description:
From publisher blurb:

Welcome to Skirmisher Publishing’s Oddities for a Thieves’ Guild, second entry in an ever-expanding series of curiosities for places absurd, bizarre, creepy, devastated, enervated, and frustrated (we can go on and come up with an entire alphabet of abject adjectives, but we have already calibrated our cogitation contraptions to alliterative mode).

Oddities are the details that can transform a 10’x10’ room into a memorable encounter and can be mundane or magical, trivial, obtuse, unusual, unsettling, and even horrifying. You provide the big items like critters, adversaries, mustachioed villains, history, treasure, and context, and we give you embellishments that can enhance any encounter — or hijack it for a hard left turn or even an about face.

Oddities are intended to aid GM creativity and turn possibly bland areas or gaming episodes into something more. The goal of this publication and the others in this series is to make things more fun and to take your imagination in directions it might not otherwise have gone.

Name: Dragon (Issue 321 - Jul 2004)
Description:
Planar Adventure!

Vol. XXIX, No. 2
Cover art by Arnie Swekel

Name: The Door to Saturn (fan expansion for Arkham Horror)
Description:
The struggle against the Ancient One takes the investigators out of Arkham and into the darkest corners of the globe. But the aeons-worn ruins of pre-human civilizations hold nameless horrors against which even the miracles of modern science offer little protection...

The Door to Saturn is a fan-made expansion for the Fantasy Flight Games board game Arkham Horror. It's a fan expansion, so players need to print the components themselves. The expansion doesn't really have anything to do with the planet Saturn; it's just a good name.

The expansion adds new Ancient Ones, items, spells, allies and monsters, as well as a new item type - Scientific items. The expansion also introduces the 'Expedition variant', in which Arkham's supply of Clue tokens depletes as Clues are spent, and the players have to venture on to an Expedition mini-board to replenish the supply. The four Expeditions included are "Antarctica", "Arabia", "Oceania", and "Mars"; taking inspiration from Lovecraft's At The Mountains of Madness and The Nameless City, Abraham Merritt's The Moon Pool and Clark Ashton Smith's The Dweller in the Gulf and The Vaults of Yoh-Vombis - among many others.
Mechanics: ['Dice Rolling', 'Modular Board', 'Point to Point Movement', 'Variable Player Powers']

Name: Weapons and Armour Catalogue
Description:
From the back cover:

This catalogue for Stellar Adventures showcases the finest weapons, armour, clothing and equipment in the Galaxy. Fully illustrated and with sales commentaries from our experienced staff, this book is a must have for any spacefarer!

     46 Energy Weapons
     44 Projectile Weapons
     18 Melee Weapons
     22 Items of Equipment
     42 Armours and Clothing


Requires the Stellar Adventures core rulebook

Name: The Victory System Character Quick Reference
Description:
From publisher blurb:

"I'm Waiting For The Book"

When you're trying to get a game together, the last thing you want to hear from everyone at the table is "I'm waiting for the book."  With all of the options available for special abilities and equipment in the Victory System, that time can really add up!  So, here's a Quick Reference guide to help out.

The Victory System Character Quick Reference contains all of the charts and tables from the Victory System Core Rulebook necessary for putting a character together, from the generation of statistics through buying equipment and getting your Magic Spells, Martial Arts, Mechanica, Powers, and Psionic Disciplines (if any).  Also included is a back page full of handy charts and rules to help the players out once the game has started.

This book has been produced to be printer friendly; a minimum of graphics, and none of the text descriptions or rules behind the charts.  This will supplement the Victory System Core Rulebook, but you'll still want one of those for clarification and description.

Speed things up... grab a Quick Reference and go!

Name: XQuest
Description:
User Summary

XQuest is a free web-published game in which the player controls a small spacecraft through a series of progressively more difficult levels. On each level the player must collect all of the blue crystals inn order to proceed to the next level while avoiding a wide selection of enemies and other obstacles.

Name: Cube Digger
Description:
A three-dimensional seek-and-find game for two players.

Object: To find your opponent's treasure chest and return to your home base without getting blown up.

The game is played on game sheets that represent a three-dimensional playing area. Each player has his own sheet, while a third sheet is placed face-up on the table. This is the common map. You have one treasure chest and eight bombs to place on the playing field. Secretly choose an unoccupied square that that is on the same level as your home base for your treasure chest. Once you've placed your treasure chest, secretly place eight bombs by marking their locations on your private map.

On your turn, you have three choices of what you can do: step, scan, or defuse. Using these actions, you attempt to find your opponent's home base (where his treasure chest is.)

If you end your turn in your home square while carrying your opponent's treasure chest, then you win the game.

Rules and the game sheets are available here:
http://www.invisible-city.com/play/306/Cube%20Digger

Name: NEKOPARA Vol. 1
Description:
What’s NEKOPARA? Why, it’s a cat paradise!

Kashou Minazuki, the son of a long line of Japanese confection makers moved out to open his own shop “La Soleil” as a patisserie.

But upon moving out, hidden amongst his things were two of the nekos, Chocola and Vanilla, that the family had been raising. When he tried to send them back, they begged and pleaded until he gave in and now they’ve opened La Soleil together.

With two nekos who really, REALLY love their master trying their very best and occasionally failing — a heartful comedy opens for business!

See the Sayori NEKO WORKs’ mascots Chocola and Vanilla like never before, moving, and in full voice on screen. And now with the E-mote System, the characters smoothly move on screen changing expression and poses in countless ways.

Source: The Publisher Website.

Name: The Centaur Kurgan
Description:
From publisher blurb:

This is the first expansion for our popular Exodus System.

There's something here for everyone. Players get a brand new flavor that they can use to play powerful and fast centaurs (or even bisontaurs, cameltaurs, donkeytaurs and zebrataurs).

GMs get an adventure that requires very little prep to run. You can customize the climax and some elements of the main story to suit your taste, as well as player decisions over the course of play.

What you'll need to play is a copy of the Exodus System rules, character sheets for everyone, some pencils, dice and blank hex maps to fill in your world as you travel.

Name: Mörderische Dinnerparty: Galopp in den Tod
Description: Murder Mystery game themed around the famous Gold Cup in the Ascot racecourse in the year 1972

Name: Monopoly: RIM 25th Anniversary Edition
Description:
(From back)

Celebrate 25 years of Innovation!

The MONOPOLY Brand is proud to present the 25th Anniversary Edition of the world's most famous board game. In the past 25 years RIM has become a leading designer, manufacturer and marketer of innovative wireless solutions for the worldwide mobile communications market.

Move around the game board with customized tokens like the Blackberry Storm, Flip or Curve.

Name: Dungeonfinder Game Master's Guide
Description:
From Introduction:

The Game Master’s Guide will expand somewhat on the [Player’s Guide] covering a few areas in more detail. It will also provide you with Combat rules, Monsters, Adventuring information and more so you can run your own games and create your own adventures and campaigns.

For Treasure it is recommended that you use the Treasure and Magic Items sections from the SRD.

Name: Then Place My Parboiled Head Upon A Stake
Description: An interesting set of tactical miniatures rules ralting to the Montrose Rebellion. Yes, the title is correct!

Name: Okko: Era of the Asagiri – Windreaper
Description: Miniature figurine for Okko: Era of the Asagiri

Name: Escape from Tentacle City
Description:
[From the back cover] 
It’s overrun with giant tentacles bent on destruction! In this game of survival horror and dark comedy, you’ll take on the role of an unlikely hero, scraped off the bottom of society.

Create and play a host of survivors!
See the sights and sounds of historic Tentacle City!
Boldly sacrifice yourself to save your loved ones... or throw your grandma to the tentacles so you can save your own skin!
Loot whatever’s hand to fight against the tentacle menace... kitchen knives, chainsaws, squirt guns full of lighter fluid... whatever you can get your hands on.
Pimp Out your items to make them extra effective!
Pimped Out chainsaws, Pimped Out grandmas... these are your tools for survival.
Stare deep into the abyss.

Name: My Time at Portia
Description:
My Time at Portia is a simulation RPG game. The world is set in a post-apocalypse setting. Humans are few and relics from the past are everywhere. The player will need to start a new life in a town on the edge of civilization called Portia. The player will start a workshop and build things with relics from the past for the betterment of society. The goal of the game is to make the workshop as big as possible.

We want to enrich the world with other NPCs that have their unique behaviors. Characters will go to school, do their jobs, workout, and have fun. They also have unique stories for the player to experience. The player will be able to get into relationships with other characters, be them friendships or romances. Romances can end in marriages.

Players can gather materials from an open world. Cut down tree, pick up herbs, mine in ruins, even plant your own garden. There are vast areas for the player to explore around Portia. Deserts, islands, reefs, highlands, marshlands, and more! Each area bringing their own unique items and monsters. There are two different types of dungeons in this game. Players can gather relics and ores from the abandoned dungeons, and fight off monsters to gain look in the hazardous dungeons.

We hope to give the player a truly memorable time in this game, of a warm and welcoming little town full of experiences.

Source: The Game Website.


Microbadge:

Name: Supercross 3D
Description:
Back of Box

Smell the Dirt!

Five...four...three...two...one... Go for it! Jump off the start and go freight training into the first corner with seven other riders. Try to do nac nacs and one handers off the jumps to grab the crowd's attention. If you're up for shooting the curves and hitting the whoops full speed ahead, you could be championship material. Practice hard enough, and you could find yourself leading the pack on the Supercross tournament circuit.

Name: Critical Hits & Fumbles: An Alternate System
Description:
From publisher blurb:

An alternate crit & fumble system and it's a bit more elegant that my other system. This one calls for a percentile roll in addition to the roll to hit, percentage chance of critting or fumbling is dependent on the difference between the to hit number and the to hit die result. Any hit can be a crit and any miss a fumble. In addition, first level puds have a chance of critting without rolling multiple 20's.

Name: Riesenflugzeugabteilungen
Description:
Expansion module to Luftschiff introduces the great multi-engined bombers of the Italian, Russian, and German air forces during WWI and the Russian Civil War. Title means "Giant Aircraft Section".   Ownership of Luftschiff (Airships at War 1914-1941 is required to use this expansion.

The first printing in 1993 contains only 4 aircraft: Caproni CA 4, Sikorskii LL'ya Mourometz G.3, Zeppelin Staaken R.5 and the Junkers R.1.   The first edition can be identified by the picture of the Caproni CA 4 on the front cover.   The 2nd edition of the expansion is the 12th Anniversary Edition.   The 2nd edition is dated 2005 on the front cover and contains images of two aircraft.   Four additional aircraft are included: B-25B Mitchell (Doolittle Raid), Fokker D.71, Hansa-Brandenburg CC, DFW C.5. The second edition has a greatly expanded scenario sheet as well.

Expands:

    Luftschiff

Name: XenoShyft: Onslaught
Description:
In XenoShyft: Onslaught, a strategic base defense deck-builder, players take on the role of the NorTec Military, charged with defending their base against the onslaught of the alien "Hive".

XenoShyft: Onslaught combines classic deck-building and resource management with fast-paced combat and unique "base defense" elements. As the game progresses, each player builds up their deck of Troop, Equipment, and Item cards, which they will in turn use to defend the base against incoming enemies in deadly combat.

It is up to the players to work together in order to outlast the horrors awaiting them by coordinating strategy, utilizing the strengths of their unique divisions (Med Bay, Weapons Research, Science Lab, and Armory), and organizing defense tactics to ensure no player is caught off-guard by surprise attacks.

XenoShyft: Onslaught is a game of tactical decisions and survival horror — and survival is never guaranteed.
Mechanics: ['Cooperative Game', 'Deck, Bag, and Pool Building', 'Open Drafting', 'Variable Player Powers']

Name: Sectors Thirty-Three - Thirty-Five
Description:
From publisher blurb:

The exploration of “Unexplored Space” continues with Sectors 33-35.

You'll find more new colonies for your group to explore, and lots of places that have not been explored by any of the current eleven species.  The remnants of the Glikth-machine wars litter two of these sectors, and there's a new species that has not reached interstellar space.  Will they survive, or will someone like the Culthan come along and exploit them?

Name: Adventures in Monster Hunting
Description:
From publisher blurb:

Adventures In Monster Hunting features six scenarios for the MHI RPG. Each of them is relatively simple and straightforward, perfect for new GMs and players to cut their teeth on but still plenty of fun for experienced GMs and players. They are:

    The New Kids In Town, in which the PCs go into the field for the first time and find themselves taking on a nest of wererats
    Gimme That Old One Religion, which pits the PCs against a cult that worships the Old Ones and is secretly controlled by a powerful necromancer named Vincent Scarlatti;
    Bewitched, Bothered, And Bewildered, in which Scarlatti lures the PCs into a trap to try to get rid of them, while simultaneously attacking a local MCB facility to “recruit” monsters held captive there;
    The Devil And The Deep Blue Sea, which puts the PCs in the middle of an occult war between Scarlatti and Lucinda Hood;
    Soul Man, in which a grieving daughter asks the PCs to rescue her father’s soul from an oni, but who in truth has far more sinister motivations; and
    Journey Of The Sorcerer, in which Vincent Scarlatti uses a powerful new body to try to complete a major summoning ritual before the PCs can stop him.

Name: Domani nella Battaglia pensa a Me
Description:
User description:
Larp based on a mix of the most important William Shakespeare's pieces

Name: The Black Well
Description:
Publisher's blurb:

This full color battlemap is the 474th of a series featuring various terrains. This installment of the battlemap series features a well on a hill not containing water, but something else alltogether.

The map is 28 x 30 squares in size, with each 1 inch square scaled to represent 5 feet. It is provided in 12 segments, which need to be assembled, in a single PDF using the letter format.

The product has been updated to include a large gridless JPG image of the map, intended for use with VTT software. It is 2016x2160 pixels in size at 72dpi.

Name: Unter Wölfen
Description:
[User summary:]
Anthology with three adventures for Splittermond:
- "Gejagt!", set in Mertalia. The characters have to find a gnome who went missing - and stumble upon a dark cult while doing so.
- "Ein Funke Mut", set in Midstad. The characters find themselves between the factions of the Midstad civil war and have to decide whether they want to help the freedom fighters against the tyrant Finn von Harreburg.
- "Das Heulen des Windes", set in Wintholt. The characters have to help a remote village that is being attacked by Vargs - and find out, what the wolfpeople want from the villagers.

Name: Trenches
Description:
Trenches is a fast-paced card game for two players, set in the trenches of late WWI.

The players will fight off for the best of 3 conflicts in order to win the campaign. Each conflict is decided using victory points, that are awarded by breaking a stand-still between two sides of trenched foes.

Each conflict represents a battle to hold 5 different objectives. To win the objectives, each player drafts a hand of 6 cards that will be played by turn (face down) on a chosen objective, until all players pass or finish their hand.

Then the players reveal the cards and start activating the special actions, in ascending order. Each side tallies the objectives they have obtained to determine if they broke the tie and won the conflict!

The game features a unique intense experience of drafting, deploying, deceiving and triumph!

Name: AiaGaia
Description:
AiaGaia is an hilarious, fast paced party game, appropriate and enjoying for children, and funny for adults and gamers. The game is entirely language independent.

Players try to score points by putting in play the animals of a farm, or special characters like the Farmer and his family, playing Foxes and Moles against other players, and trying to avoid the terrible black Wolf...

Every card in play has a value in points, as every card in hand entail a penalty... 
In addition, many animals (and all the characters), have special "effects" based on the other cards on the play field...
But beware! When you put a card in play, you have to simulate the "voice" of the animal (or character) on the card: if you forget, or if you mistake, the card jumps back in your hand, and you lose your turn!

High interaction, many laughs and a bit of tactics are the recipe of this game, designed by Marco Valtriani and illustrated by Angelo Porazzi.

THE GAME IS OUT OF STOCK and will not be reprinted. It has been restyled (rules, graphics, illustrations) and published by Red Glove.
New page here: http://boardgamegeek.com/boardgame/165651/merry-yard

Name: DarkBase: Alien RTS
Description:
User Summary

A twist in the Darkbase series, this time you are the aliens attempting to destroy the humans. You must collect crystals, build multiple units, control and coordinate your attacks, and don't forget to defend your buildings. Some units collect crystals, and some are more suited to engaging the humans.

Name: Walker in the Wastes Player Aid Kit
Description:
All the maps and handouts from the Walker in the Wastes campaign reproduced at a higher quality.

From the designer's notes:
"A campaign the size of Walker in the Wastes deserves special treatment from both the publisher and the Keeper, as it will reward the effort put into it with lots of entertainment and excitement. The player and Keeper aids in this pack are more extensive and elaborate than were possible in the campaign book itself, and so we have tried to do them justice here instead. We believe they will add realism and flavor to your campaign, and enhance your experience greatly. We hope you feel the same."

Name: Wars Across The World
Description:
WAW is a unique game concept which aims at simulating in one single system ALL conflicts throughout the world (and beyond) from Prehistoric times to nowadays, from grand massive wars to asymmetrical conflicts.

Source: The Game Website.

Existing Scenarios:

Hamilkar 264 BC *
Carrhae 53
Hastings 1066  (3-player)*
Bizantium 1116
Morat 1476
Fornovo 1495
Mexico 1519 (Based in Vae Victis #137 game)
Armada 1588
Saratoga 1777 *
Bull Run 1861 *
Missouri 1861 *
Kentucky 1861
West Virginia 1861
Kavkaz 1804
Austerlitz 1805
Waterloo 1815 *
Gandamak 1842
Persia 1856
Tannennerg 1914
Finland 1918
Estonia 1918 (3-player)
InnsMouth 1928  (fictional - Lovecraft) - Free download
Spain 1936 (Spanish civil war - large scenario)
Switzerland 1937 (fictional steampunk)
Malaya 1941
Sicily 1943
Normandie 1944 (iPad Initial scenario) *
Bulge 1944 *
Berlin 1945 *
Koenigsberg 1945
Korea 1950
Congo 1964
Six days war 1967 *
Rhodesia 1972
Gulf 1990
Mali 2012


     - scenarios included Steam base pack

Name: Cakambi
Description:
Game comes with a folding board, 47 black wood balls, 3 red wood balls and 1 die.
The balls are either + (positive) or - (negative). The balls are placed randomly on the board-roll the die and if the number on the ball you pick can be divided evenly by the number on the die, you keep the ball and add it to your score. The first player to get a total of -7 or +17 wins. For 2-4 players.

Published by Quiggs & Co. Keene, NH

Name: Lightning Strike Virtuoso
Description:
Publisher's description:

"With a single shot, the entire course of history can change. This is the precept of the Lightning Strike Virtuoso, the newest psionic prestige class from Dreamscarred Press. Where a bowman will seek to overcome enemies with quantity of arrows fired, the Lightning Strike Virtuoso will wait until the precise moment when a single bolt from his crossbow will take his target at the weakest point.

Within the pages of Untapped Classes: Lightning Strike Virtuoso you will find 6 pages of new material, including the full write-up of the Lightning Strike Virtuoso, as well as a fully-documented iconic NPC. In addition, a new psionic armor enhancement, psychoportive, is detailed.

This prestige class requires the use of the marksman class found in Untapped Potential: New Horizons in Psionics. This download includes a coupon for a discount on Untapped Potential: New Horizons in Psionics for those who do not already own it."

Name: Pictures
Description:
Pictures is a quick-playing family game with very simple rules. Form the image on your secret picture card with one set of components, either shoelaces, color cubes, icon cards, sticks and stones or building blocks in such a way that the other players guess what image you have pictured:


     Pull out a marker from the bag that determines your secret picture card.
     Then form that image with your components in such a way that it is recognizable.
     And finally guess what image each other player has pictured.


The players get points for correctly guessing other players images and for other players guessing their image. The most points wins!

—description from the publisher

Name: Guess-a-Doodle!
Description:
Each player takes some paper and a pencil (four are provided). Chose any player to be the first Instructor. All other players are Doodlers for the first round and rotate for later rounds.

The Instructor takes the top card from the Doodle deck and tries to describe as best they can the object on the card using only "technical" terms. The Doodlers follow the directions of the Instructor, trying to recreate the object on their Doodle Sheet. No one can look at another's drawing. Once the Instructor announces the description is complete, each Doodler secretly writes down what they think the object on their sheet is.

Each correct identification is worth one point to the Instructor. Each correct Doodler gets one point. So, if 3 Doodlers guess correctly, they each get one point and the Instructor gets 3 points. The player with the most points at the end is the winner.

Name: Ultimate Commander (5E)
Description:
From publisher blurb:

Take Command!

Ultimate Commander bridges the gap between hero-level small-group adventuring in 5th Edition and large-scale battlefield action, bringing you a brand-new character class, the general! These great leaders are capable of wielding a squad of soldiers like a living weapon, trained in complex tactics and with extraordinary acumen on the battlefield.  If you've ever wanted to adventure with your own personal army at your back, this is the class for you!  At the same time, the rules for this class are fully compatible with the kingdom-building and mass combat rules introduced in Pathfinder Roleplaying Game Ultimate Campaign and expanded and enriched in Ultimate Rulership, Ultimate Battle, and Ultimate War from Legendary Games!

Ultimate Commander includes an amazing array of class abilities and specialized stratagems, feats of command and leadership, and alternate favored class bonuses. It also brings you over a dozen archetypes for the general, from the criminal kingpin to radical revolutionary and the righteous redeemer to the marauding warbringer! It also presents the general's evil opposite, the hordelord, commanding a relentless zombie horde on their path of depravity! Whether your characters lead the armies of heaven or stand in the vanguard of villains, Ultimate Commander opens up a whole new route to victory and conquest!  Check out this 26-page 5E supplement and Make Your Game Legendary!

Name: Using Space Marines
Description:
From the Introduction:

This is one of those 'Does exactly what it says on the tin' articles. Gav's been thinking a lot about Space Marines lately (perhaps too much), and here's what he has to say.

Space Marines are the Imperium's most deadly warriors, and are feared by human and alien alike. Accordingly, they are possibly the toughest, strongest and deadliest characters in games of Inquisitor. There has been much debate in the gaming community concerning the battle brothers of the Adeptus Astartes, and I'm here to contribute to that discussion and hopefully provide some answers.

Name: Das Geheimnis der Abtei
Description:
Each player gets four monks in one color. The player looks at the monks and places them on the starting field, so thta the other players can't see the monks. In play the players aren't allowed to look at the monks.
At the player's turn, he/she throws with both dice and chooses one monk. It's not allowed to devide the points of the dice along the monks. The player can choose to add or the deduct the numbers of the roll. Monks can move in any direction except for walls and bushes.

In order to find out, which of the strange monks is the intruder, the players have to question them. The questioning can take place only in the garden and only if a player with one of its figures comes exactly on the field of a fellow player figure. If this succeeds, then the active player picks up carefully the figure and looks at the figure secretly. Afterwards the monk is placed to its starting position.
If two monks are occuing a space, other monks cannot question them, until one of the monks leave. When both the dice display the same amount a questioning can be broken by another player.

The player who knows which monk is the intruder, can start the    persecution. The player has to throw the same amount with both dice.From this moment the player can only move with one monk, until he reached the intruder. The monk has to land on the same space has the persected monk and the player shows the monk. If the monk is the intruder, the intruding party is out of the game. Otherwise the persecuting party is out of the game.

The last order of monks standing win the game.

Name: Paladin in Hell
Description:
“You made a wrong turn & fell into the Abyss. Now you must fight your way out. Solo card game.”

The game uses two card decks – the Holy Deck and the Demon Deck. The Holy Deck contains the attack and defense cards that will be used by the player. The Demon Deck contains cards representing the demons that are attacking the player and the locations in Hell that the player is traveling through.

“Victory: You win if you defeat all the Demons in the Demon Deck. You lose if you are ever reduced to zero or less Life Points. Your final score is the number of Life points you have left.” The player starts the game with twenty Life Points.

Name: Temple of the Snake God: A Heroic Rescue
Description:
A Heroic Rescue

From the introduction:

Explore a temple dedicated to a god of snakes in this short micro dungeon.

User summary:

For 10th - 12th level characters

Name: Trilbert
Description: Players take alternate turns placing double-colored H-shaped jigsaw tiles. The winner is the first one to form a loop with his color.

Name: Fated North America
Description:
From publisher blurb:

Endless opportunity and hunger await in North America. Transcend the boundaries between magic and technology, and combat ravenous monsters.

Fated North America is a gaming supplement for WITCH: Fated Souls. Combat ancient monsters who stalk the land, and navigate the schism between North America’s Fated. Find a cure for the dreaded Shambles, repair the Emitters which keep monsters under control but slowly leak Quiet, and negotiate deals with ruthless crime bosses.

This 21 page, beautifully illustrated PDF includes:

    Information about North America and its inhabitants
    Interesting locations to visit and NPCs to meet
    New magic
    Strange creatures
    Plot and recent event hooks

Name: In The Company of Genies
Description:
From publisher blurb:

Born of the Elements!

Genies are not merely creatures able to wield the elemental powers of reality, they are the children of those elements personified!

This new race and racial class is designed for use by player characters at every level of play, with custom special abilities and feats based on elemental powers and subrace paths such as djinn and efreeti. They are designed to allow you to play a classic genie, or something completely new! Presented with this is a plug and play 1st person point of view descriptive text that allows for an easy introduction of this new race and class into any existing campaign.

    Jann race, with favored class bonuses and archetypes!
    Jann Paragon Racial Class 1st-20th level
    Abilities broken into 5 paths, one for each classic element plus the all-encompassing Path of the true Jann
    Class- and race-specific feats to round out any Jann character.

Name: EONS #122 - The Free-Founders Society
Description:
E.O.N.S.
Issue 122
The Free-Founders Society

Rumors and Myths About a Group that Doesn't Exist

Name: Mobile Video Poker
Description:
Can't wait until your next trip to Vegas? Try your luck with this realistic Casino Video Poker machine. Place your bet and pick your cards. Turn on the sound effects, or turn them off so the boss doesn't hear. If your luck runs out, the house will gladly lend you some extra video "cash". This Video Poker game feels just like the Casino versions, complete down to the payouts. Practice before you hit the Casinos for real!

Features
Turn automatic hand evaluation on or off
Bet features
Hold or Draw cards
Lend cash from the house
Sound effects which can be turned off
Realistic Casino Video Poker!

Source: The Developer Website.

Name: The Folio #18
Description:
From the back of the book:

The ship makes its way into the Corsair Mists, a region of the Halo Ocean said to devour ships and drive sailors mad.  Somewhere in the oppressive fog, the White Ship awaits, but before the Adventurers can make it to their final destination, they must overcome the challenges of the mist.

Name: One Piece: Pirate Warriors
Description:
Pirate Warriors follows the adventures of Monkey D. Luffy, a young boy who accidentally eats the Gum-Gum Fruit and organizes a diverse crew of pirates called the Straw Hats to search for the titular treasure. On his journey, Luffy makes several of friends, and battles a wide variety of villains.

Source: Wikipedia, "One Piece: Pirate Warriors", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

Name: POWER: Air|Sea Expansion
Description: This long awaited expansion to P.O.W.E.R. will now incorporate US Air Force and US Navy units. Yes, that's right, jet fighters and submarines. As you may know the BattleMats were made with an Air/Sea Lane and many have been eager to see it used. (Air and Sea units have their own dedicated "field of play" and will affect the 4x8 Battlefield by Row.)
Mechanics: ['Area Majority / Influence', 'Deck, Bag, and Pool Building', 'Open Drafting', 'Push Your Luck', 'Rock-Paper-Scissors']

Name: American Trivia: Family Edition
Description:
Description from the Publisher's Website

Have you ever wanted to just play games rather than study for your history or geography test? Well now you can do both at the same time!

Outset Media is proud to introduce the Junior Edition of the best-selling All American Trivia Board Game. Designed specifically for younger players, the Junior Edition allows youth to have a blast, challenging each other’s knowledge on 100% American content in a fun, social atmosphere.

The game is easy to learn, with three categories -- geography, history, and general. It’s a race around the game board. With over 1,080 questions, the game includes questions such as "Who is famous for his ‘I have a dream’ speech?" And "What is the largest state in America?"

Name: EN5ider (Issue 156 - Jul 2017)
Description:
EN5ider
Issue 156
July 2017

Allies & Adversaries: Goldenscale Host

Name: Crossword Domino
Description:
From the instructions:

This interesting new game besides combining dominoes with crossword puzzles adds a joker feature.

Besides being entertaining this fascinating new game will improve your vocabulary and spelling.

'Crossword Domino like dominoes requires the players to take a group of units thrown together by chance and transform them into order and context. Crossword Domino requires that we link together letters and words as is done in a crossword puzzle.

This game allows the players many possibilities of devising problems to be solved and making rules to suit the particular group of players.

Name: Casualties of the Cursed Wood
Description:
user summary

An adventure module made exclusively for the Haunted Highlands Kickstarter that funded July 24th, 2013.

It was released as an exclusive release for the campaign for a stretch reward ($10,000 stretch goal).

Adventure Designed for 2 - 6 characters of 6 ~ 9 level with a challenge rating of 7. It can easily be scaled up or down as needed.

 from page 2 of the module

"The characters experience a longish adventure where they are introduced to many different types of gunpowder weapons. The characters are hired to lead a wagon train blessed by Tevnut the goddess of nature, the earth and fresh waters. The trip begins in Mantua, proceeds down through the Northern Steppes and into Mafurrow, and over to Lake Ugashtan. While the group thinks their last stop is the Crater of Umeshti, they are wrong. One of the primary sources of evil in the lad is the Tower of the Necromancer in the Cursed Woods. The characters are urged by the priestesses to take on the challenge of the Necromancer's Tower."

Name: Raupenrallye
Description:
In Raupenrallye, you want to be the first to get your seven caterpillars from one side of the apple to the other. On the apple game board are two lines of holes, with the lines crossing at the core and with each line having three holes on either side of the apple.

On a turn, you roll the four-sided die, and (if you don't roll a 4), you move one of your caterpillars that many spaces, either from the start area next to the game board or from wherever it is on the game board. If you land a caterpillar on the core, you move it immediately to the goal space off the game board. If you do roll a 4, roll the dice again; if you once again roll a 4, you must return one of your caterpillars on the board to the starting space; if you roll anything else, then you can move a caterpillar from the starting space to the core, then an additional 1-3 spaces depending on what you rolled.

If you manage to fill all three spaces on one half of a line with your pieces, you immediately move all three pieces to the goal.

Name: Satat
Description:
Introduction
Satat is the most popular card game in Mauritius. Its name comes from the from the Hindi "saat hant" meaning "seven hands" and it is related to the Indian game of Seven Hands (also known as Court Piece). The objective is to win at least seven of the 13 tricks, or even better to win the first 7 tricks, or better still all 13 tricks.

Players and Cards
The game plays with four players in fixed partnerships using a standard 52-card pack. What distinguish Satat from other Whist-like trick tacking games are the fact that the 2 of heart is the highest trump card of the game and the ways trump is decided.

Making Trumps
The dealer shuffles, the player to dealer's right cuts, and the dealer deals a batch of five cards to each player. The trump maker, to dealer's left, looks at these five cards and announces the trump suit. Alternatively, if unwilling to decide trumps on the basis of these first five cards, the trump maker may elect to use the last four cards to determine the trump suit.

End Game and Scoring
Normally the play ends when one team wins by taking seven tricks. However, if a team wins the first seven tricks (a 7-0 win) they may continue the play and try to win all the tricks (13-0 win). The winning team then gets to pass cards to the losing team in exchange for trump cards in a way similar to Sergeant Major.

There is no formal system of scoring and no fixed length to the game, but the players may like to keep track of how many games each team has won or lost.

Variations

Trup kasiet
In this "hidden trump" variation, instead of announcing the trump suit, the trump maker places one card of the trump suit face down. If the trump card is selected unseen from the last four, the trump maker looks at it before placing it face down.

In this variation 7-0 and 13-0 wins are more frequent, but no cards are exchanged after a 7-0 or 13-0 win.

Name: Banjooli Xeet (Second Edition)
Description:
The wizard of the tribe has died. As it has been recorded by our ancestors, for thousands of years wizard-wannabes made their predictions for the ostrich race in the Holy Cave, with the one making the more accurate predictions becoming the new wizard. Which ostrich will win the race? Who will become the new wizard? The answers are not easy since it is an open secret that candidates are not limited just to making predictions...

In Banjooli Xeet, players become wizards who must predict the order of arrival of racing ostriches in order to gain points, while dodging obstacles, collecting berries, avoiding the dreaded lion, and not waking the sleeping crocodiles.

This second edition of Banjooli Xeet incorporates the Kanasu expansion, a single ostrich that sometimes joins the race, that cannot be scared, and that no one can gain points for if it wins. In addition, some minor rules were changed, rules for the lion tile were added, and some tiles from the first edition were replaced with new tiles that are intended to make the game faster and more fun.

Name: Auf dem Weg ohne Gnade
Description:
Translated from the back:
It is rare occasion that a mage gets a quasi lucrative and honorable mission. That's why you immediately accepted. But now you are standing under the merciless sun of the Khom desert and wish yourself back into your cosy study. Suddenly a promising image appears on the horizon: Salvation or just a Fata Morgana?

Name: Job the Leprechaun
Description:
User Summary

This platformer has you as a leprechaun collecting clovers from one of 35 platform levels to open the exit door.  You can kill enemies (or bust up certain walls) by tipping your hat.   Retro-graphics and retro-music backgrounds a plotline to find your lost friend Eri.

Name: Robot Odyssey
Description:
"Robot Odyssey is an adventure game, published by The Learning Company in 1984. It was released for the Apple II, TRS-80 Color Computer, and DOS.

The player is readying himself for bed when, suddenly, he falls through the floor into an underground city of robots, Robotropolis. The player begins in the sewers of the city with three programmable robots, and must make his way to the top of the city to try to find his way home again."

Source: Wikipedia, "Robot_Odyssey," available under the CC-BY-SA License.

Name: Box Quiz: Sverige
Description:
One of the over 50 implementations of the Box Quiz series, this one with the theme 'Sweden'.

The game consists of a tin box with 50 questions and answers within a category, here about Sweden. It is a small and simple quiz game, where players simply answer the different questions.

Name: Glyph
Description:
Glyph is a dice-building combat strategy game for 2-6 players. Players are tasked with forming a team of three champions and defeat their opponent. These Champions are broken up into three distinct classes--Strikers, Guardians, and Adherents--with each Champion having his or her own strengths, weaknesses, and unique abilities which you will use by harnessing the power of mystical glyphs. As the game progresses, your Champions will have the opportunity to acquire new items which will enhance their capabilities as well as perhaps give them even more skills to use to defeat your enemy.

Glyph utilizes an intriguing dice-building and card-drafting mechanic, which rewards tactical thought as well as provides exciting gameplay. The dice in the game represent ancient powers, which each color of dice having a unique face structure tailored to specific Glyphs. Each Glyph serves a specific purpose and, through rolling and manipulating the dice, your Champions will be able to perform actions ranging from devastating attacks, to fortified defensive stances, to supportive aid. Each Champion also has various item slots available and you will be able to acquire unique weapons and armor to aid you in combat. Some items are rather simple and provide minor boosts to your champion's dice pool, while others have their own unique abilities that only the wearer of the item can perform.

These items come at a cost, however: you may be required to spend [read: trash] dice from your own champion's pool in order to acquire these powerful items. This makes item acquisition much more than merely taking an available card--you will need to weigh the costs and benefits of these items and determine if sacrificing the requisite dice is worth it.

The decisions you make each round will have a lasting influence on the tide of battle. Do you take advantage of a weakened Champion and attack or try to accumulate wealth to purchase a suit of armor to protect you in subsequent rounds? Battle will rage until there is but one side left standing. Will you bring honor or disgrace to your tribe?
Mechanics: ['Deck, Bag, and Pool Building', 'Dice Rolling', 'Variable Player Powers']

Name: Par Terre et Par Mer
Description: Roll and move game with a travel theme published in France (1880 - 1900). Players visit exotic locations and world Capitals. Starting and ending in France.

Name: GURPS Klingons (4E)
Description:
From the back of the book: "The most dangerous enemy faced by the Federation is the Klingon Empire, and yet the Klingons don't regard the Federation as their primary threat! There is much more to them.


     History of the Klingons: How Kahless conquered the planet. The Old Kings who took the Klingons into space, then stranded them back on their homeworld. How the Klingons returned to the stars and conquered their mighty empire!



     Complete Racial Profile: Everything there is to know about the Klingons! Biology, culture, military, government, emperors, religions, economics, legal system, Imperial Paladins, military nobility, intelligence agencies, Secret Police and more!



     Planet Survey: Complete data on 23 Star Systems and over 100 planets. Klinshai, warrior colonies, subject races, industrial worlds, more!



     Starships: Complete data files for more than 100 types, classes and special mission variants ranging from the mighty B10 battleship to D7 Battlecruiser to the tiny G2 police corvette.



     Technology Files: Disruptors, agonizers, two-handed swords, six different daggers, complete deck plans for the G1 fast patrol ship, medals, rank insignia and the dangerous but effective Mindshifter!



     Adventure! Make a deal on Verlix Station or risk your career on Lieutenant Thirek's experiment."

Name: Texas Hold'em King 2
Description:
THK2 was Magmic’s first foray into multiplayer poker, offering tournaments and head to head play right from the user’s device. Using servers hosted by Magmic, players were able to play games of Poker with up to 5 other people live, at the same time. Like the previous version it was available on a variety of devices and is still being played due to it being pre-loaded on a variety of BlackBerry handsets.

Magmic also hosted a tournament in late March 2007 which the winner received an all-expenses paid trip to Orlando in May of the same year.

Features

Ring game, Tournament and World Series modes
    Standalone and Multiplayer modes
    Online Buddy Lists and Friend Finder
    4 Color Deck for suit visibility
    Customize with dozens of avatars and 7 different designed decks
    In game chat and chat macros
    Tournaments for real prizes.

Source: Wikipedia, "Texas Hold'em King", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

Name: Judges Guild Journal (Issue 11 - Aug/Sep 1978)
Description:
Inside this Issue:
Some Notes on Ye Old Process of Learning
Magical Spices
Religion & Justification of Magic
Robots
Other Judges Guild Fantasy Features

Name: EN World Player's Journal (Issue 1 - Mar 2003)
Description:
Publisher Blurb:

Table of Contents:

Drinking Rules
Consequence of Vice, The
Disgusting Little Buggers
Cave Elves
Kezmarin
Ambience Events
No Wood? No Metal? No Problem!
Extended Alchemy
Skyships and Airmen
Adventurer's Guide to Surviving Anything, The
Two of Blades
Trader's Den, The
Targ Ak'ala Beng

Name: Zelenhgorm: Episode I: Land of the Blue Moon
Description:
From the game box:

Zelenhgorm

In this first episode of the dazzling cinematic fantasy game, you will encounter the supersticious world of Zelenhgorm in the shape of Arrikk Vaheirr. Zelenhgorm - Land of the Blue Moon is the name of a continent on an alien world with wild nature, strange creatures, ancient cities and dark, mystical secrets. As this epic story begins you, as Arrikk, awaken after having bizarre dreams and discovers that a gigantic ship has run aground in the bay thta borders on your garder. From where does this strange ship come from?

To find clues, you must seek answers from among your owm people, who wish to have nothing to do with you. When you succeed a magnificent adventure awaits you - the experience of the mystical continent of Zelenhgorm...

Name: Shenmue I & II
Description:
User Summary

An re-release of the 1999 and 2001 games Shenmue and Shenmue II, originally for Dreamcast (in the west also released on Xbox), this compilation is not so much a remaster as a regular emulation of the original games. However, some features, such as modern camera controls and such are added.

Released in the west on 2018-08-21 and in Japan on 2018-11-22.

Name: The Siren's Lament (5E)
Description:
From publisher blurb:

A 5th Edition Mini-Dungeon for 4-5 PCs of Level 4

Sirens rarely find true love, but the one haunting this watery memorial managed the trick. Unfortunately her father, a powerful spirit called the Sea King, disapproved of the match. He conjured a storm to sink her lover’s ship, not realizing the depths of his daughter’s attachment. The siren’s suicide drove the Sea King build these winding passages in a fit of remorse. They are a monument to the love that he destroyed, and a home for his daughter’s anguished spirit.

Name: City Condemned
Description:
User Summary

A title available for the XBL Indie Marketplace. You are a sniper on the roof of a building, protect other survivors on other buildings or on the ground by shooting zombies before they reach them, while fending off bats attacking you. Upgrade your weapon and choose between different modes of play before each round, such as headshots only count and turn off and on the attacking bats.

Name: Redemption at Talos Sound
Description:
Publisher's blurb:

A sound is usually a safe harbor on a large sea Talos Sound, on the other hand, is known as a graveyard for ships and sailors entering it. Now adventurers must brave this wild place if they hope to bring a peaceful resolution to their current troubles. This is the third and final adventure in the Pilgrim’s Progress trilogy.

A Four-Hour D&D Adventurers League Convention Created Content Adventures for 5th- 10th level characters (optimized for 8th level).

Name: Haunts and More
Description:
From back of book:

Avoid Blind Man’s Alley! Don’t get caught in Gladiator's Coliseum!

Need more Haunts? Frustrated by limited examples? Haunts and More is a twelve-page supplement providing eleven haunts for your PCs to encounter. It also introduces the idea of a stacked haunt. Why should one haunt have only one effect? Bonus Materials includes a pre-made undead hunting ranger with a new feat.

Made for the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game. Get Haunts and More Today!

Name: Medal of Honor: Infiltrator
Description:
Medal of Honor: Infiltrator is the sixth installment in the Medal of Honor video game series.

In it, the player takes the role of Corporal Jake Murphy, completing five missions to defeat the Axis in some of WWII's most famous battles. The game was made exclusively for the Game Boy Advance and was released on November 17, 2003. The game features 15 missions spread across three theaters including 5 missions behind enemy lines.

Source: Wikipedia, Medal of Honor: Infiltrator, available under the CC-BY-SA License.

Name: Hippodrome
Description: This game from from Milton Bradley dates back to 1890 and features a lithograph map of an around the world race for two players. Each player in turn spins the spinner and moves the indicated number of spaces paying penalties for landing on an opponents playing piece. First player to circumnavigate the globe wins the game. There are safe areas where no penalty is called for if your opponent lands on your square.

Name: Infestation
Description:
From publisher blurb:

As a Hell Storm wracks the city of Zhov, an abandoned vault in the pits of city seven seems a last recourse from the flesh cutting winds, acidic, bloody rain and marauding demons.

Infestation is a short nightmare for the Godchild RPG.

Name: Narvik 1940
Description:
"Narvik 1940" simulates the battle fought in april/may 1940 between German forces that inavded Norway and Norwegian army supported by ally expeditionary corps, formed with polish, english and french units.

Game was attachted to the 3rd issue of "Dragon Strateg" magazine and published in 1997.

"Narvik 1940" uses "Bitwy Drugiej Wojny Åšwiatowej" system rules.

Name: NBA  Ballers
Description:
NBA Ballers is a streetball game which is similar to AND 1 Streetball and gameplay similar to the NBA Jam series. The game features fictional NBA analyst Bob Benson (voiced and depicted by Terry Abler) and MC Supernatural doing the commentary. Supernatural makes many references to the Mortal Kombat series and NFL Blitz two games published by Midway. The game also maintains the "player on fire" feature that is in many, if not all sports games published by Midway. Most of the moves that were in the game were from real street ballers who provided some of their moves for the game. The game is powered by Gamespy game technology.

Source: Wikipedia, "Nba ballers", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

Name: Bürgermeisterspiel: Werde Bürgermeister in Dresden
Description:
Objective: be the first to get the permanent majority of votes for the coming election of the mayor - learn more about the city of Dresden
- moving/acting by turns.

Each player rolls the die, moves according the number, follows instructions of space landed on; buys, if possible and/or (preferable) votes.

"Chance" cards are created with circumstances out of the history of Dresden. Correct answers give economic advantages.

Voting process about the next mayor: Each owned company corresponds to a number of votes. The results of each voting are kept and the final winner is the first player who reaches the target.

Name: Heroes in Time
Description:
Publisher Blurb:
Heroes in Time is a generic system that nevertheless comes with a huge range of settings, all tied together by a time traveling/ alternate histories theme.

The conceit of the game is that characters will be recruited from across the timeline of the game world. They will range from primeval barbarians, through fantasy elves, swashbuckling pirates, steampunk adventurers, modern investigators, super spies, and cyberpunk operatives, to the psionic knights of space opera.

All these different types of warriors will be recruited by an enigmatic group of Temporal Guardians and all working together on the same team, ready to be deployed to any point in history.

So get Heroes in Time and start adventuring through the whole of history

From the introduction:
Philosophy
The idea of this game is to provide everything needed to play any genre in one place – with the same setting so characters can travel backwards and forwards through time.

Introduction 
This RPG is the core system for the ‘Heroes in Time’ or ‘HiT’ role-playing game. The system uses percentile dice for most rolls, but it also uses six-sided dice here and there too.

Name: 100 Items to Find in a School Biology Lab
Description:
Publisher Blurb:

This is a list of 100 different items, with some variations, that could be found in a school biology lab. They cover such things as plants, dissection and the human body. These could be found by players looting a school, or during a normal investigation.

Some of the items are potentially useful, especially those that are more medicinal in nature, whilst others are simply clutter.

An example result:

55. Microscope (This may have its own light source, be monocular or binocular and some types may project the image or transfer it to a computer via a USB cable)

Name: Mordenkainen's Tome of Marvelous Magic
Description:
From the back cover:

Mordenkainen has spent his career researching magic items. In this book, he describes 200 of the most interesting and useful wondrous items ever devised! The perfect way to liven up any treasure hoard and an essential resource for every Dungeon Master.

Name: Micro Siege
Description:
User Summary

Build a tower to defend yourself from the attacking minions. Build up to three story walls, mine nearby rocks for building materials and employ archers to kill the minions.

Name: Mesopotamians
Description:
From publisher blurb:

A game about undead warrior kings trying to make it as a rock and roll band, inspired by a song by They Might Be Giants.

Through some terrible black magic, the evil sorceress Azita has resurrected several ancient Mesopotamian warlords to serve as generals of her undead army, leading her conquest of the modern world.

Instead, you started a rock band.

Now you’re driving across the United States (or wherever) trying to break into showbiz, one gig at a time.  You wander from town to town, having adventures and hoping that they bring you closer to success.  You do not understand this strange new world, with its technological wonders and modern customs. But you have a set of used musical instruments, an Econoline van and a desire to rock your way to music stardom.

A complete roleplaying game in 15 cards.  To play, you'll need 3-5 players, 1-3 hours of time and a variety of funny shaped dice.

Originally published in the Indie Mixtape Anthology, now revised and expanded.

Name: Solar Senate
Description:
Humanity is about to join galactic society. You are an alien trying to convince the Solar Senate to ally with your civilization. Influencing from interstellar distances, you must rely on sympathetic Senators to convert their comrades. Through cunning manipulation and the occasional political sacrifice, you can win the Solar Senate!

Solar Senate is a 2-player abstract game of spatial strategy and conversion. Each player has their own deck of Senators, whose influence is ranked from 1 to 5 with 1s being most common and 5s most rare.

On your turn, you play one of the two Senators from your hand onto the play area. This represents your Senator entering the Senate chambers. If you flank a line with one or more of your opponent's senators with two of your senators, those opposing senators might be converted to you under two conditions:

PRESSURE: Your flanking senators' total influence is greater than the opposing senators' total influence.
CONSPIRE: Your flanking senators each have identical influence, regardless of the opposing senators total influence. If conspiring, the most recently played senator is removed from the game. (He or she has resigned in disgrace.)

The game continues until all but one Senator from each deck has entered the chambers. Earn 1 point for each senator aligned to you. You also earn bonus points if you achieve certain endgame agendas.

Name: Donutosaur 2
Description:
Help Donutosaur get his donut! Collect candies by changing the shape of Donutosaur and switching the direction of gravity. Donutosaur’s friends will be of great help – they can push, pull and destroy objects.

Source: The Game Website.

Name: Zen: Intergalactic Ninja (GB)
Description:
User Summary

Based off of a comic book series, Zen is an intergalactic ninja that must make his way through levels in order to stop Lord Contaminous from destroying the Earth with pollution.  Run, jump, and fight your way through the different stages using power ups to help you.

Name: The Nightmare
Description:
Publisher's blurb

Dreaming?  Or is it real?  Lost in a maze of haunted chambers... pursued by fearsome creatures, you're trapped in an old castle.

Don't listen to those screams... seek the key to your escape... reach the iron door.  Pay no attention to the footsteps behind you - it's not the psychopathic killer!  Concentrate - think!

The Nightmare, designed by Marc Russell Benioff, offers both puzzle-solving and role-playing intrigue.

Name: Slender: The Arrival
Description:
The majority of the game takes place in abandoned areas (house, defunct mine, etc.), each with different objectives. Slender: The Arrival uses similar mechanics to its predecessor, The Eight Pages. The character is armed only with a flashlight. This limited defense forces a sense of helplessness, as the best way to survive in the game is to run whenever in danger.

Source: Wikipedia, "Slender: The Arrival," available under the CC-BY-SA License.

Name: Terrasauria
Description: In this educative game, the objective is to conquer the most continents on the game board by using your collection of dinosaur tiles. The dinosaurs compete using five characteristics: weight, size, agility, ferocity and the period of their appearance on Earth. This game is not only a trivia about 120 dinosaurs, but players also need to demonstrate a keen tactical sense.

Name: Kalarsys Accessories
Description:
User summary:

Two versions of the basic character sheet for Kalarsys were provided.  One, the most basic, was offered in a GIF graphic format for full-page printing.  The second was offered as a more-traditional PDF file; this version featured more options for the evolving system.

A non-player character generator was provided for Kalarsys.  This software would randomly generate statistics.  It was released as "Version 3" for Unix or DOS; "Version 4" for DOS; and "Version 5" for DOS, with source code.  A "Version 6" was developed but (apparently) not released.  The generator offered several methods of customization though, reportedly, most did not function as anticipated.

A Kalarsys Dice Roller, or KDice, program was released as a "Version 0.1" for DOS and a "Version 2" for DOS, with source code.  For some time the dice roller was also available via a web browser.  It was functional, but basic.

Name: Cosmonos
Description:
This is an undated space travel game from Belgium that combines roll-and-move with resource management. The board covers the solar system, and the goal is to accumulate the most money primarily by being the first to land on planets. Landing bonuses range from 100 million for the moon to 1,000 million for Pluto, and there are game end bonuses for last planet, each planet card and most planet cards.

The standard red interplanetary track includes hazards that can bump players onto a useless green track. The red track leads to yellow orbital tracks around each planet, which in turn link to white landing tracks. Players must try to hit cross-over and landing points precisely, and can be damaged or even killed if they land too fast.

On each turn, players declare their acceleration and pay the appropriate amount of fuel, from 1 tonne for 1D6 to 32 tonnes for 6D6. Players may instead spend 5 tonnes for a retro thrust (1D6-3) or 20 tonnes for a super-retro (1D6 in reverse). Players may also spend money for help from an "electronic brain" that allows movement of exactly 1 in either direction for 50 million up to 4 for 400 million.

Players can buy fuel cheaply while on a planet or at double price at any time. It also can be had for free by landing on a space station (25t) and by giving up a turn while on a planet or station (10t). Players can borrow money from the bank if necessary to buy fuel.

The rules are in Flemish and French, and while the game is undated, the box graphic looks a lot like the space ship from the Tintin graphic novels.

Name: JED
Description: JED = Just Employed Dimwit.  Card game of climbing the corporate ladder.  Cards are business card-sized of fictional companies.  Players take on different roles, and income denotes which role you play.  Your income can change based on how well you do each round, so you can be CEO one turn and eventually fall to JED if you're not careful.

Name: A Jumping Frog Game
Description:
Object: To be the first frog to jump a total of 100 feet.
A "Cosmic Wimpout" type dice rolling game. The "1" on the dice is replaced by a frog. To determine the distance jumped on each roll, multiply the number of frogs rolled by the total feet (points) rolled on the remaining dice.

Name: PC Collection
Description:
User Summary
Collection of various programs include a few games. The games include a crane game and a jigsaw puzzle, but else is mainly graphical programs (for making stickers), paint program, an interactive word processor, a music maker, a fortune teller, and more.

But of games, mainly two are real games:
Jigsaw puzzle and crane game.

The PC Collection was sold both as an individual issue and as a bundled software with the Casio Loopy Mouse

Name: StarStreamers: A Science Fantasy Game of Social Media Fame
Description:
From publisher blurb:

Bursts onto the Scene!
In a far flung galaxy filled with magic and incredible technology, influencers and clout reigns supreme. Holo-Net streamers do whatever it takes to bring in viewers while broadcasting their adventures for all to see. The mundane is surreal and the fantastic is bland as the tastes of the people flicker from streamer to streamer, subject to subject.

StarStreamers is a mini-setting by BPB Games, the creators of Savage Tokusatsu. This Pay-What-You-Want mini-setting is designed from the ground up for use with Savage Worlds Adventure Edition. With a bevy of new ideas and a fresh take on science fantasy, StarStreamers is perfect for groups looking for something out of the ordinary.

What's Inside?

    2 New Species
    A Random Species Generator
    The Cosmos Drive, a New Arcane Background
    3 New Edges
    3 New Powers
    2 New Power Modifiers
    Over 24 New and Bizarre Pieces of Gear
    A Simple Gear Modification System
    Several StarStreamers Plot Hooks

Name: People of the Eternal - Races of the Astral Plane
Description:
Publisher's blurb:

WE ARE NOT ALONE

In the space beyond this world, beyond the forests of elves and the delves of dwarves and the shires of the halflings, lies a dimension of dream and thought, where one can move simply by thinking, and where a desire is all it takes to pass through to heaven or hell. There are people that call this vast, silvery void home, and this document starts the telling of their story.

Within these pages, you will find the vast armadas of the githyanki, bristling with armaments and arrogance, and you will meet their rebels and their refugees who may become your fast friends.

You will also find the eternal devattas, celestial beings that reincarnate after each death, who retain faint memories of each of their thousands of past lives. Today, they continue their quests at your side.

Among the astral ships and port towns in the gray void you will meet and share a drink with the boisterous hadozee, who will join you on a journey beyond the edge of infinity, singing shanties the whole way.

If you are lucky, you will stumble on the quiet monasteries of the isolated buomman, the "singing monks of the Astral Sea," who fear the imperfect world outside their structures...and who seek to perfect it by raising dead gods.

You may also find the crystalline redoubts of the shardminds, entities of distilled knowledge, who only exist because of a tear in reality that they hope to repair by melding with others of their kind. Perhaps you can help them complete their seal...or perhaps you can stop them from negating all that makes them individuals in pursuit of this divine quest.

Whatever allies you choose for this journey, whether you delve into dungeons deep within the earth, travel the Sword Coast and beyond, or plumb the infinite gray eternity just beyond the reach of most mortal minds, travel safe, and try not to go mad...

Name: The Alaskan Gold Rush
Description:
From the Box (all spellings and grammar are identical to the box text):

The Alaskan Gold Rush

A Game of High Adventure

Is the rousing new board game that combines the excitement of poker with the incredible adventures of the Alaskan Frontier.

In the 1890's thousands of greenhorns flooded the Port of Skagway looking for riches beyond their wildest dreams. However, charging bull moose, ferocious Grizzly bear, raging rivers, ice flows and frost bite (sic) await all those who quest for gold. Only the most experienced gold-panners emerged from the wilderness unscathed with gold in their pockets. These SOURDOUGHS were the toughest of the tough, and would literally risk an entire year's earnings on the flip of a card in a poker hand.

Would you be willing to bet everything you have on a bluff, or will you play it safe. This is a game of strategy, luck and skill, where the game dramatically changes with the personality of the players.

The easy to play game includes:

1 Board of Alaska (the game track is superimposed on a satellite picture)
1 Deck of standard playing cards
100 Silver and Gold coins (Poker Chips)
100 $1 Dollar Bills
6 Playing pieces
1 Die (d6)
27 Adventure cards (15 gold, 12 silver)
6 I.O.U. Cards (4 gold, 2 silver)
Rules

The game begins as a simple roll-and-move mechanic with various spaces giving rewards or penalties. There are also spaces that can trigger a round of poker between the players - winner take all monies bet. The players must accumulate wealth enough to buy transportation to the gold fields and then find the motherlode (Big Vein). Once there, a final hand of poker is played and the person at the mine must have $500,000 remaining after the hand.

The components are of high quality and it presents an interesting twist on a mundane night of poker.

Name: Harvest 28: The Ultimate Bowhunting Board Game
Description:
Harvest 28 was designed by bow hunters for bow hunters in an attempt to give hunters, families and friends the opportunity to learn more about the ultimate bow hunting achievement.

The game is based on the ultimate challenge for bow hunters worldwide, which is to harvest 28 of North America's big game species.

This fun and educational game can be enjoyed by people of all ages and is best played with two – six players.

The compact size of the game enables people to take the game away on hunting trips to help fill in those quiet times when unpredictable weather sets in.

The game comes complete with Board, Dice, Miniature Bow Hunter Figurines, Tally Sheets, Pencils, Money, Risky Shot and Park Ranger Cards, and instructions on how the game is played.

Name: GURPS Space Adventures
Description:
"Voyages to Interstellar Danger"

User summary:

Three separate adventures:

Rebirth
Beware the Health Police
Raid on Sterling

Includes adventure seeds to continue on where these adventure leave off.

Include full statistics for one new alien race and suggestions for fitting the adventures within the Space Atlas series.

Name: Concert Hall
Description:
Players will be asked to either perform, recite, or use their aural skills in a variety of practice sessions in order to get to Concert Hall, their big debut! Accuracy of responses will advance one the quickest.

Contents:
- Equipment Electronic capacities; four keyboards (2 octaves) on four sides. Mini tape recorder to play supplied tapes.
- Ancillary Materials Dice
- Pieces - clef, base, staff, note, piano
- Cards

Name: Seeing Red
Description:
From publisher blurb:

Of the four racing team, the Reds and the Blues are the eldest. Yet, despite their long pedigree, both have fallen upon hard times. The Reds have had an even worse time of it than the Blues, though, and the Reds have become the dregs of the coliseum: penniless, hopeless,  a laughingstock. In the end, they have come so far down that they will do anything to get back up. Anything – including bribery, cheating, and foul play.

Name: Paws 'N Claws
Description:
In Paws 'N Claws, your goal is to work your way from the outermost track of the playing board to the inner areas, eventually entering the judging and placing first in the show. Along the way you must demonstrate your breeding and training by correctly answering questions about dogs and cats.

There are three categories and two levels of questions, which are determined by the roll of the dog and cat dice.

There is also the possibility you will have to bark or meow or make some other noise or gesture by drawing Claw or Paw cards.

The board is a bit tricky but careful observation and maneuvering will solve it.

Name: Dungeons & Dragons Nautical Adventures
Description:
From the introduction:

A suppliment providing ship to ship combat rules.  Requires the use of the fifth edition Player's Handbook, Dungeon Master's Guide and Monster Manual.

Nautical adventures for D&D.

Name: Wargame
Description:
Wargame is a strategy game for 2 players.  Playing time is roughly 20 minutes.

Each player has 13 cards ranked from 13 (Bazooka) down to 1 (Spy).  Cards of a higher rank typically take cards of a lower rank, though there are some exceptions (Spies, for example, take both the Bazooka and the Mortar, while Shooters can sometimes be "turned").

A player first deploys his cards by placing them, 1 and 2 at a time, into the 13 spaces on his line.  Once all cards have been deployed, players take turns advancing their cards into the combat zone.

What makes the game interesting is the ability for players to switch two cards before advancing one into battle.  Each player can do this exactly 5 times.

The goal is to win 7 of the 13 battles in the combat zone, or win 4 adjacent battles.  The winner will almost always be the player who most skillfully utilizes his troops, as there is very little luck involved.

Name: Back to Baghdad
Description:
Back of Box

WHAT MAKES A "SH*T HOT" PILOT?

Matching wits with the deadliest opponents in the world - and winning.

Now, you can hone your skills with the same accuracy as the military. "Back to Baghdad" is created directly from "Red Flag" and "Top Gun" flight simulators used in Air Force Pilot training. "Back to Baghdad" is the most realistic and accurate flight model on the market, complete with satellite photos from the U.S. Department of Defense, precise geographic data and 40 missions packed with Air to Ground attacks. "Back to Baghdad" will provide you with the most advanced combat simulation you have ever experienced...

Are you ready for the challenge?

Name: Imaskar - the Amethyst Empire
Description:
User summary:

This sourcebook presents compiled "official" information about Imaskar into one accessible location.  Some additional fan-created ("unofficial") materials are included.

Name: 6 day Bike Race
Description: This game is unique because it's a self destructing game! The game was published with six paper boards that self destruct after you play the game! It has a cycling theme, the mechanic is that you have to touch with a burning cigarette the starting line of the cyclist, the line of the rider that's burned up first is the rider that wins the game.

Name: Bellum: of Mutants and Men
Description:
Welcome to the world of Bellum! A world born from the ashes of the old; a world for you to command. Will you take sides with the enduring Sapien Kingdoms in their quest to reclaim the lands promised? Perhaps you will ally with the Gobalos Colonies as they seek new territory to support the ever multiplying brood. You might even fill your Barracks with some impious alliance of the two. Construct your Barracks and wage war across the world of Bellum.

With tactical game play and an industrial fantasy theme "Bellum: Of Mutants and Men" is an exciting strategy card game experience for two players. Each player assumes the role of a commander constructing their own Barracks of Units and Stratagems then battling it out to destroy each other's Keep

*Battle it out in a industrial fantasy world where positioning is just as important as card synergy.
 *Play right out of the box with pre-constructed decks or construct your own from the 260 cards available in the box. 
 *Utilize the unique hand-size resource system which assures that no card is ever a dead card. 
 *Command your Units and deploy Stratagems across a 5x5 board.
 *Destroy your opponents Keep and win the game!

Name: Timeshift (M&M3)
Description:
From publisher blurb:

New and improved! Now contains stats to instantly use in your M&M game, all at the same old price!

Power Pics are intended to be used in roleplaying games for either PC and NPC portraits or generic stock art in personal or professional products. They also contain 1" scale foldup paper miniatures for use on the tabletop, allowing GMs and Players to picture the action in their games. Each Power Pics collection contains a color, greyscale and black and white version so you can choose how to use them without unnecessarily using up your printer ink.

Name: Ender's Game: Battle School
Description:
Game description from the publisher:

Ender's Game Battle School pits two players against each other in the zero gravity arena of the International Fleet's Battle School, with one player commanding Ender Wiggin's Dragon Team and other player commanding Bonzo Madrid and the Salamander Team. Commander cards for Wiggin and Bonzo come with special abilities, some that help the whole team, and some that help only the commander. Each player moves his team around a zero gravity arena in an attempt to capture the other team's gates or to freeze members of the opposing team with their laser-light guns. The player who first captures all of his opponent's gates or freezes the opposing commander wins.

Name: Creatures & Treasures III
Description:
Back Cover:
Creatures & Treasures III, in the tradition of the immensely popular C&T and C&T II is an invaluable supplement offering information and stats for three key elements of fantasy role playing: creatures, treasures, and encounters. Although designed for use with the Rolemaster system, it is easily adaptable to most other major role playing systems.

This bestiary presents a host of new animals and monsters, including: Stone Dragons, Vampire Lords, Undead Elementals, gigantic Skeleton Constructs, etc. Also detailed inside are a myriad of magic items, including: new magical weapons, potions, runestones, and artifacts such as the dreaded Hourglass of the Slayer (an item which can be a threat to whole cities). Each creature and treasure description includes extensive background information to provide ideas for adventures and to enhance fitting the beast or item into a campaign.

Creatures & Treasures III includes:

     Game stats, descriptions and illustrations for dozens of new fantasy animals, monsters, constructs and Undead.
     Descriptions for a plethora of new herbs, magical items, and artifacts.
     Comprehensive random treasure and encounter generator tables, including the items and creatures from all three C&T books, the Elemental Companion, and the Rolemaster Companions through RMC VII.

Name: Wasteland 36" x 24" RPG Encounter Map
Description:
From publisher blurb:

Wasteland - RPG Encounter Map

36" x 24" image of a barren and broken wasteland with optional square or hex grids.

Files included:

For Large Format Printing

Zip file containing 300 DPI JPEGs for 1" and 1.5" square grid variations

Zip file containing 300 DPI JPEGs for 1" and 1.5" hex grid variations

Zip file containing 300 DPI JPEG with no grid variation

Name: Best of Greyhawk #05
Description:
The City of Hardby
Joramy
The City of Dyvers
Oerth's Dwarves
Instant Greyhawk Campaigns
Starting in Saltmarsh

User summary:
