Best of Greyhawk is a series of items containing materials derived from the long-defunct "AOL/TSR Greyhawk Message Board", an electronic bulletin board system.  Selections were made by long-time forum administrators.

Name: Dark Horizons Universe Campaign Setting
Description:
Welcome to the Dark Horizons universe. The year is 2610, and the universe as you know it has changed. Mankind has conquered the galaxy; technological breakthroughs such as the Core Implant, the quantum electrino drive, and cybernetics have altered his way of life forever; and commerce with other species including Nomads, Cy-Gens, and the Valence -- has forever changed the way humanity defines itself. However, none of these changes has prepared mankind for the sudden appearance of the Irritus. Whether you participate in a Dark Horizons campaign as a player or as a Gamemaster (GM), your actions during the game will help shape mankind’s future. Whether for better or for worse is up to you.

This is a d20 Modern/Future campaign supplement based on SRD 1.0

Name: Mean Streets
Description:
Explore the best and bleakest aspects of film noir, presenting a concept with which to portray detectives, femmes fatale, desperate district attorneys, grifters and con artists, government agents, and reporters during the Classic Age of 1940's film noir.

FEATURES

* Optimized System & File
      Mean Streets includes the revised genreDiversion i rules (1.1), which provides flexible and consistent mechanics for a variety of character roles, chases, and investigations utilizing 2 six-sided dice. The design of the PDF file has also been optimized, so you can download and print it more quickly than similarly-sized products.

* Ready-to-use templates to get into the action quickly
      Fifteen templates that can be used as antagonist or protagonist characters.

* A ready-to-play scenario
      A full-length scenario to help jump right into the mystery and action.

* Story ideas
      Numerous goals and story ideas to help create your own film noir stories.

* Compatible
      Use with Active Exploits Diceless or Impresa. Combine with Ghostories to add horror and the supernatural to your film noir stories.

* 8.5x11" blank sheets and Disposable Dice™
      Print a single page for easy-to-assemble paper dice when none are available

Name: Cobblestones
Description:
Publisher's blurb:

A construction kit including various roads, paths, and bridges for the creation of cobblestone routes through cities or countryside. Not to be confused with peach cobbler, which is delicious but not a suitable pathway construction kit (despite my efforts). Intended for use with virtual table tops.

Name: Dragon (Issue 216 - Apr 1995)
Description:
Dragon Magazine
Vol. XIX, No. 11
Issue #216
April 1995

Cover by Larry Smith.

"Hey - What the... !!!"

The table of contents is detailed in the Article list below.

Name: Taoex
Description:
Taoex is an abstract strategy game where players use mono-directional tiles to navigate a hexagonal grid to capture opponents’ tiles to create multi-directional towers for greater mobility. Using the 6-pointed compass, that control all direction of play, located in the center of the board, players take turns placing their 12 tiles (2 for each compass direction) in the optimum starting hexes. Once all the 36 starting hexes have been filled the game begins with the players taking turns advancing at least 1 tile into play per turn. Within the board there is a 6-pointed star called The Way where tiles are forced to roll the 10-sided Taoex die to charge the path a tile/tower moves across the board. Regardless of whether the roll is beneficial to the rolling player, the tile must move the roll along the Way if it can. Tiles/towers that traverse board to the far side of the board, if the tile/tower manages to line up with a starting hex, the tile/tower can wrap around the board to come out on the other side once again. An excellent tactic when hunting new directions.

As players begin collecting enemy tiles, by landing on them, they form towers of up to 6 tiles tall, maximum. Anything over 6 tiles the tower’s owner either removes enemy tiles from play or in the case of his own, liberates them and returns them to an open starting hex of the appropriate direction of the tile. The game is won by a player collecting 6 of one enemy’s tiles into a single tower or, if 1 player captures/eliminates all opponent tiles.

Taoex is a challenging and unique abstract strategy game that is very simple to learn and yet offers the players a mental workout as they master their play. Naturally, the rules that govern the game are more complex than the description written above, but it is the nuances in the rules that makes all games more interesting and Taoex offers its fair share. If you are the kind of gamer that enjoys using your mind to defeat opponents rather than just relying upon some lucky dice roll or random chance, then Taoex is a game for you.

—description from the publisher

Name: Havenshield: The Complete Players Handbook
Description:
From the introduction:

Is This A New Edition? No. It’s just a reworking of the rules into a cleaner format, but does include several Optional Rules for things like Alignment, Point Buy Attributes, etc.

User summary:

Includes everything players need to create, equip, and play their characters.

Name: Bleeding Edge
Description:
Official servers remain in maintenance mode.

From the studio behind DmC: Devil May Cry and Hellblade: Senua’s Sacrifice comes Bleeding Edge, a fast and frenetic 4v4 team brawler where every fighter comes mechanically enhanced for mayhem!

4v4 Team Fighter
Experience one of a kind multiplayer that fuses combo mechanics with dynamic 3rd person action. Freeze foes in time, control minds, ride missiles and unleash electrifying guitar solos in a fast-paced yet strategic combat system that rewards technique, timing, and teamwork.

Mod Your Combat, Show Your Style
Give yourself an edge by creating unique load-outs for every fighter. Choose from hundreds of cybernetic mods to fully tailor your build to suit your personal play style, all earnable through gameplay.

Treacherous Terrain
Use your environment to your advantage with deadly arena hazards and gain the upper hand in moments of chaos. Yank opponents into a high voltage electric fence with Buttercup’s buzzsaw, or charge enemy aggressors into the path of an oncoming train with Makutu’s shoulder barge.

Name: Ultimate Music Trivia Quiz
Description: Trivia quiz game with four categories - pop, rock, movie soundtracks & hits of the 80’s.

Name: The Edge: Dawnfall – Prime Shadow
Description: Squad add-on for the Darkness faction. Contains cards for solo, cooperative, and PvP.

Name: Bushido: Fujitaka
Description: When the tide of the battle is changing and the will of the Prefecture’s soldiers is waning, Fujitaka is there waving his banner and rallying the troops. His bravery in the face of impossible odds is well known and his fellow Ashigaru find their own inner strength in his presence. Fujitaka also shares his own strength to enable others to continue the good fight.

Name: Fantasy Wargaming: Games with Magic & Monsters
Description:
From the dust jacket:

"Welcome to the wonderful world of fantasy wargaming! Whether you're a beginner who wants to try the hobby, a seasoned campaigner looking for a realistic system, or an outsider who simply wants to know what fantasy gaming is all about, Martin Hackett has produced an indispensable reference guide.

He has devised a complete fantasy gaming system which makes use of a special scheme of tables to produce accurate, realistic yet surprising results and a fast, easy to learn game which gets away from the tedious and over-elaborate procedures used in other systems.

Know what a kobold is, or a ratatole? As well as a full list of spells specifically designed for mass battles, there is a quick-reference bestiary which sets out the properties of these and all the other creatures that may be encountered. An entire fantasy battle scenario has been created - in effect an imaginary world which sets the scene straight away for all sorts of adventures, as weird as your imagination can devise. Also described in a fantasy realm, the setting for astonishing campaigns that will take you on quests for gold and virtue an much more besides.

All this is supported by useful notes on how to enhance the game with models and sculptured scenery, plus a list of figure manufacturers and advice and guidance on getting the most from this absorbing hobby."

Hardcover, 232 pages
ISBN# 1-85260-213-9

Name: Corteo
Description:
"Corteo" is a simulation of a demonstration in a city. A huge mass of people goes across it trying to occupy the most important spots: from embassies to the TV Station, from the government palace to the court, from the prison to the most fashionable shops.

Counters have traditional movement and combat scores. The Demonstration player has a lot of slow units plus some quicker and deadlier ones (from anarchists to marxist-leninists); the Power player has policemen and "Carabinieri" with heavy vehicles (some of them shooting gas) plus a few lousy city council policemen.

The huge city is finely depicted (graphics by Piergiorgio Maoloni, that later became one of the best well-known art directors of Italian newspapers and magazines) and it has funny names on streets and squares. A hex grid is of course impressed on it to rule movement and combat. A humorous "Yellow Pages" booklet is included to help finding the best places to score points around.

There are several scenarios, including a totally different "Black Out" scenario inspired by a New York black-out: up to 6 players go around sacking the city, while up to two players try to stop them with policemen and Carabinieri. Those two can fight each other to get the goods they seized to the pillagers, but only if it is a "dark" turn so they can pretend not to recognize each other.

This is the first boardgame published by C.UnS.A. when they were still "Comitato Un Sacco Alternativo", before becoming a company and a successful team of game designer (for boardgames, radio and TV games, advertising games, training games, magazine games and so on). At that time, C.UnS.A. was composed by Massimo Casa, Giulio De Petra, Alvaro Lojacono, Piergiorgio Maoloni and Sergio Zoffoli.

In 1980 Mondadori Giochi made a second edition with a heavier map and counters, but without the "Black Out" variant: there was rumor that it could become a separate game, but this never happened.
Mechanics: ['Dice Rolling', 'Grid Movement', 'Hexagon Grid', 'Movement Points', 'Ratio / Combat Results Table', 'Simulation']

Name: Naramel: Jadepunk Martial Supplement
Description:
From publisher blurb:

The Tournament of Four Winds is upon us.

The Naramel have perfected the art of one-on-one combat, having the longest dueling tradition of all the great nations. With the Tournament of Four Winds coming to Kausao City, Arnold P. Windsworth III helps you learn about the competition, starting with a journey of Naramel warrior culture.

This 21 page supplement contains:

    An introduction to the Tournament of Four Winds, and guidelines for using it in your game.
    Asset write-ups that detail the various levels of mastery for the prominent martial arts of the Naramel Desert.
    New weapon assets used by Naramel warriors.
    Tactics and assets for mounted combat, including a new companion animal: the lightning-fast Ayuno horse.
    How to properly conduct a duel.
    A history of warfare in the Naramel Desert.

Name: Dinosaur Battlegrounds
Description:
UNRELEASED GAME – VAPORWARE

    
    
        
This game is stuck in the development limbo known as Vaporware. Few to no details have been released about its gameplay, plot, or release date since its announcement many years ago. It may or may not be in active development, but neither has it been cancelled officially.

    


Experience Prehistoric Earth as a Dinosaur in an accurately recreated 3D world, Fight, Survive and reach the top of the food Chain.

Source: The Game Website.

Name: Attack of the Plant People
Description:
A two to four player abstract tactical game published in Warhawks magazine #6.

Players take the roles of up to four terrible 'Plant People', each with a different special power.  Players alternate placing their vines on the board.  When a square is surrounded on three sides it forms a pod (worth 3 points in combat).  Players have either 8 or 12 pods depending on their special power.

When opponent's vines touch, there is combat... loser must remove all of the vines being attacked.

The object of the game is to completely choke out all other player's vines and pods, forcing them off the board.

Name: Immortal Eyes: Shadows on the Hill
Description:
Second volume of the Immortal Eyes chronicles for Changeling: The Dreaming.

Back Cover: 
The Magical Islands
Welcome to Hawaii, one of the world's natural splendors. From its glittering waterfalls to its firey volcanoes and black sand beaches, Hawaii is considered to be one of the most beautiful places in the world. Hawaii has long been a haven for Kithain seeking to flee the ravages of Banality. Here can also be found the native Menehune changelings intent upon keeping their islands free from the encroaching Banality.

Dark Secrets
The second installment of the Immortal Eyes trilogy, Shadows on the Hill picks up where The Toybox left off. The Immortal Eyes chronicle combines a trilogy of novels with a series of game sourcebooks. Shadows on the Hill takes the characters to Hawaii where they begin to learn the full scope of the Unseelie conspiracy.


     Descriptions of the main freeholds and inhabitants of the islands.
     Features three main stories designed to mesh with the Immortal Eyes chronicle.
     Complete information on the native fae of Hawaii, the Menehune.

Name: Fargerally
Description:
'Fargerally' (Color Rally) is a children's game consisting of two phases:

Phase 1: Collect six meeples of different colors and place in your racing car.
Phase 2: Race your car to the finish line.

The dice are used both to collect meeples and to advance the cars to the next square of matching colors.

Contents:

- Game board
- Four wooden racing cars
- 24 meeples in six colors
- Two colored dice

Name: AZ Kviz
Description:
An original competiton broadcasted for 15 years in Czech Republic. Competitors have to connect all three sides of the board. 
Board is made of hexagonal pieces with numbers or letters on it and behind every piece there hides a question. When contestant answers correctly, the piece is his.
Normally its a game for 4 players with three 2 on 2 battles (semifinals and final).

Name: Combat 3001 (or A Fist Full of Credits): A Combat 3000 Supplement
Description:
Combat 3001 (or A Fist Full of Credits) is a rules supplment for the SF wargames rules; Combat 3000: Infantry Combat in the Year 3000.

It adds the following rules to Combat 3000.

    Advanced Rules on;
        Weapon Profiles
        Close Combat
        Movement
        Visibility - Awareness
        Fire Modes
        Gravity
        Close Combat Training
        Vehicles
    
    New Lists on;
        Creatures
        More Weapons
        Equipment
    


Additional Credits; 
Richard Prieastly, Anthony Epworth, Steve Tiffin, Paul Elsey, Pete Harris, Gavin Denton, Andy Szazepankiewicz (Pank), Martin Parker (Perce), Andrew Phillips and Simon Elliot.

Name: Dungeon (Issue 189 - Apr 2011)
Description:
Table of contents:

April Adventure Hooks
Backdrop: Diyun
Killing Ground
Chaos Scar: Scarblade
Mihajla's Tent
Save My Game
Eye on the Realms
Eye on Dark Sun

Name: K3 en het IJsprinsesje
Description:
User Summary

K3 en het Ijsprinsesje (K3 and the Ice Princess) is based on the movie with the same name.  In this game you and K3 have to help out the Ice Princess.

Name: Watermark
Description:
Publisher's blurb:

Watermark is a founding member of GUARD team Alpha. Watermark is a alien shapeshifter that crash landed on Earth.   The being has no memory of life before the crash, but he was running from a powerful force.   Landing in California, he turned into a blue skinned surfer he had seen near the beach.   At first he terrorized the locals, but was found by the government and sent to GUARD for further evaluation.  While at GUARD he honed his skills and can shapeshift to any creature he has seen and learned about.   Though he still suffers from amnesia, he has proven his worth many times over.

Name: San Guo Sha: Kingdom Wars
Description:
Another variant of the ever popular game by YOKA games. This takes San Guo Sha to the next level with each player choosing 2 heroes. Double the abilities, the chaos and the excitement!

Instead of 'copying' bang, with sheriffs, outlaws etc, like the original San Guo Sha does, now players team and ally against each other based on the different factions that they had from their heroes, all taken directly from the famous Romance of the Three Kingdoms.

The goal is simply, survive till the end, by killing off all your opponents.
Mechanics: ['Hand Management', 'Hidden Roles', 'Player Elimination', 'Take That', 'Team-Based Game', 'Variable Player Powers']

Name: Armapalabras
Description:
Armapalabras is the most dynamic and entertaining word game for all ages.

It includes 2 games with different levels of difficulty: Basket and Word.

For the kids: Educational and fun, exercise and expand vocabulary.

For the big ones: A challenge of agility and creativity.

CONTENT
Two decks of 40 cards each, instructions of the game "basket", instructions of the game "word" and a version of practice ..

---

Armapalabras es el más dinámico y entretenido juego de armar palabras para todas las edades.

Incluye 2 juegos con distintos niveles de dificultad: Canasta y Palabra.

Para los chicos: Educativo y divertido, ejercita y amplía el vocabulario.

Para los grandes: Un desafío de agilidad y creatividad.

CONTENIDO
Dos mazos de 40 cartas cada uno, instrucciones del juego “canasta”, instrucciones del juego “palabra” y una versión de práctica..

Name: The Siege of Arkamsul
Description:
From publisher blurb:

The World of Tele'Thala is a 5E compatible world full of engrossing history, vibrant lands, unique peoples and mysterious and dangerous creatures.

In this PDF you will find the "The Siege of Arkamsul" Mini-Adventure.

Help the Dwarves of the fabled kingdom of Arkamsul defend their homeland against the army of the evil Red Dragon, Char!

Name: Mass Effect Trilogy
Description:
Experience all three award winning Mass Effect titles at an amazing value with Mass Effect Trilogy.

Become the galaxy's most elite soldier and lead an all-out war to stop an ancient and ruthless enemy. With over 75 hours of content and more than 300 awards, one of gaming’s most acclaimed franchises is available for the first time in a premium foiled box set.

Heart-pounding action meets gripping interactive storytelling as you decide how your story unfolds. Assemble and lead your team aboard the most advanced ship in the galaxy, and travel to distant and unexplored star systems. Meet a cast of intriguing characters, each with their own story to tell. Wield devastating weapons and customize them with upgrades. Your actions and decisions culminate into a heroic battle against the greatest threat ever known.

The fate of the galaxy lies in your hands—how will you choose to fight for it?

Source: The Developer Website.

Mass Effect Legendary Edition will update the textures, shaders, models, effects, and technical features of three enormous games. There will be a sharper resolution, faster framerates, beautiful visual enhancements, all remastered and optimized for 4k Ultra HD. The goal was to modernize the experience so that fans and new players can experience the original work in its best possible form.


Microbadges:

Name: The Maztican Ball Game
Description:
Publisher's blurb:

The Maztican Ball Game is a game within a game!

A team of four or more players can play a sport within the Forgotten Realms.  The challenges are real, the rewards are great - but you can leave your swords and spells at home!

The Maztican Ball Game contains rules for the sport, the mechanics behind them and an adventure set up in the style of a tournament in which the players can become underdog champions in a long established cultural phenomenon.

Name: AGL: Starlight Sacrifice
Description:
This huge fantasy adventure game features a sprawling, richly detailed world of intrigue, magic, danger, and diabolical puzzles. An innovative glossary system helps you keep track of the exciting worlds you explore.

Source: The Game Website.

Name: Character Quest: Heroes The Card Game – Game Pack #2: Savage Beasts
Description:
In CQ:Heroes, up to 4 players take turns collecting heroes and sending them out to gain victory points for your tavern.  From the mighty Paladins and Wardens of the King's Guard from Game Pack #1 to the powerful Great Wolves and Berserkers from Game Pack #2, Savage Beasts, each player will try to create a powerful combo of heroes to defeat even the toughest locations.

The heroes from Game Pack #2 - Savage Beasts feature Pet heroes that can be controlled by the Beastmaster skill.

Game Pack #2 - Savage Beasts includes the Adventure Deck: Desert Temple which features all new cards including a new card type: Raid Boss.  These encounters are much tougher than normal encounters and are placed in the location area when revealed.
The new objective in Desert Temple is to defeat 3 of these Raid Bosses to open up the Throne Room.  This triggers the final battle where all players make last party of heroes to battle each other for the room's treasures.

GAME FEATURES:

Simple and engaging: Although it's simple to learn and play, turns can become quite involved with all of the hero abilities and how you combo them during your turn.

Everyone plays to the end: No one is eliminated during the game and all players count their victory points at the end.

Quick flow of play: Because you draw up your hand at the end of your turn, you are then able to plan your next turn while others are taking theirs.

Accessible: Only 1 deck is needed for up to 4 players.  Extra decks can be used separately by each player or shuffled together for everyone to share.

Easy to collect: No mystery packs.  Each deck has all the cards you need to play.

Fast: The game sets up in less than a minute and plays in about 10-20 minutes.

HOW TO PLAY:

Starting with the first player, each player performs the following 4 actions in order:

ATTACK: Attack 1 encounter OR skip your attack to add one additional Hero to your Tavern on the next step
TAVERN: Place 1 hero in your Tavern (2 if you skipped your attack)
DRAW: Draw your hand back up to 5 cards
REFRESH: Draw and add 1 new Adventure card to the dungeon hall
Mechanics: ['Campaign / Battle Card Driven', 'Deck, Bag, and Pool Building', 'Hand Management', 'Set Collection']

Name: Big Time Charlie
Description:
The game can be crudely described as Monopoly meets Scrabble. The premise is based on property development, but tile placement and scoring is similar to Scrabble.

Each player has a hand of tiles, set up on a tile stand. Each player in turn has the opportunity of placing tiles on the board alongside and tiles already on the board. Each tile placed on the board automatically makes a row (or "street") longer. At the very least a new street consisting of two tiles is formed when a new tile is laid.

Whenever a player so manages to lengthen a street by placing a new tile on the board, he scores the new total arithmetical value of the street, for as far as it extends in a straight unbroken line. Each successive tile added on to a given street will score more and more as the street increases in length and value.

Tiles must be matched to the board by color and number as a general rule, but there are a number of "joker" tiles that do not conform to this.

The game ends when the first player achieves 1000 (2 player), 800 (3 player) or 650 points (4 player).

Name: X Factor Board Game
Description:
Manufacturer's Description
Experience the journey that X Factor contestants go through on their way to the Final. Select your character from the 6 'would-be' X Factor champions and make your way around the board passing through Auditions, Boot Camp, the Judges Houses and all the way to the Final. Collect votes, get voice comments from the electronic judges and be challenged on your X Factor knowledge.

Name: Euclio Tricky!
Description:
The second expansion to Euclio, Euclio Tricky! adds five new scoring boards and accompanying suit cards to make your games even more varied and interesting.

These new boards are a bit more... tricky, and therefore recommended for Euclio veterans, but all retain the general simplicity of play Euclio has always had.

Euclio Tricky! adds a risky new chip type, more calls to have points on hand, and a surprise behind door number 2! Get ready to sweat bullets staring down these tricky new suits. Simply add to your Euclio box and experience a new mixture of gameplay possibilities!

—description from the designer
Mechanics: ['Area Majority / Influence', 'Dice Rolling', 'Hand Management', 'Open Drafting', 'Worker Placement']

Name: Full Throttle!
Description:
Full Throttle! is an expansion kit for any of the three "Legend" games covering the Mille Miglia road races across Italy – Legend: The History of 1000 Miglia, Legend: Winds of War, and Legend: The 1000 Miglia Action Game. Full Throttle! adds more player interaction, competition and fun to all three games.

Full Throttle! includes two decks of cards: the 72 full-sized card Main deck (used in game play) and the 40 mini card Locales deck (used as reminder markers).

There are 12 different card types in the Main deck, consisting of 7 obstacles which can negatively affect a player, and 5 situations that can negatively or positively affect the chance of the obstacle's effect. The obstacles are: Pothole, Landslide, Spectators, Animal, Intersection, Fog, and Railroad Crossing Gate Down. The situations are Fatigue, Hangover, Sober Up, Fog Lifts, and Railroad Crossing Gate Up.

The Main deck cards are organized into 6 suits: Mountains, Forest, Farmlands, Towns, Bad Roads, and Night. The Locales deck consists of 6 card types corresponding to the suits in the Main deck.

Name: Frostburn
Description:
From the Back Cover of the Book

Survival at Sub-Zero

Marrow-chilling conditions, deadly hazards, and other dangers threaten explorers of frostfell environments.  A Wintry grave awaits those who venture forth unprepared, whether traveling through polar regions, frozen mountains, ice-glazed dungeons, or the Ice Wastes of the Abyss.

This supplement for the D&D game explores the impact of arctic conditions and extreme cold-weather environments on every aspect of game play.  Along with rules for adapting to, navigating through, and surviving hazardous cold-weather conditions and terrain, Frostburn also includes new spells, feats, magic items, prestige classes, and monsters associated with icy realms.

Expanded by;
Curse of the Rusty Walrus

Name: Eylau 1807
Description:
EYLAU 1807 is a study and simulation of the Battle of Eylau (or Battle of Preußisch-Eylau), 7 and 8 February 1807, between Napoleon's Grande Armée and a Russian Empire army under Levin August, Count von Bennigsen near the town of Preußisch Eylau in East Prussia.

Turn sequence :
-Russian player receives reinforcements troops and moves troops
-Russian player's Combat Phase
-Russian player's Reorganization phase
-French player receives reinforcements troops and moves troops
-French player's Combat Phase
-French player's Reorganization phase

Each counter represents either a unit or a general. Each counter describes 3 factors : corps (french) or division (russian) name, movement points, combat points.

-game components :
1 map (59X76cm)
122 counters
one rule booklet (includes historical study of the battle)

Name: Secrets of Sarlona Character Backgrounds
Description:
From the PDF introduction

A Web Enhancement for Secrets of Sarlona

Introduced in Player's Handbook II, backgrounds are a way to customize your character's history to give depth to your mechanical choices and your roleplaying. In playing a Sarlonan character, you must consider the culture your character comes from when choosing a background. This section provides some helpful information to flesh out a background into something truly Sarlonan.

Name: Simple Settings: Savage Lands
Description:
(publisher blurb)

Savage Lands is a guide to 5th edition pre-historic role playing! Play in a world before time, where you can fight and tame ancient creatures, traverse a primordial landscape, and fight for survival against the dangers and depredations of early civilization.

Included are archetypes for character classes, new and relevant pre-historic themed races, thematically appropriate equipment, and a lot of advice and optional material that can help you make the most of your savage lands!

Most exciting of all is that there is a bestiary full of amazing primordial monsters, as well and quick and easy swap outs to represent primordial beasts. Nearly all of the work has already been done for you, so pick up this book and see how exciting it could be to adventure and thrive in a bygone era!

Name: Under the Influence
Description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Principality of Ulek Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

What is it that stalks the halls of power? A shadow? A secret lover? A spider spinning it's webs? What will you do when you find out... can you keep a secret?

A Principality of Ulek regional adventure for APLs 6-16.

User summary:

This document is noted as "Edited for use at premieres".

Name: Act of Aggression
Description:
Set in the near-future, Act Of Aggression is a techno-thriller real-time strategy game hailing from the Golden Era of RTS: the nineties and noughties. Across three distinct factions each armed with the greatest modern and prototyped military weaponry, head into some of the world's most volatile conflict zones, building bases for mass production, establishing resource supply lines, and waging war with increasing veterancy in Eugen Systems' - creators of the million selling Wargame series - explosive new RTS.

Throughout large, authentic maps, players will harvest resources, build bases strategically, defend them, and produce all kinds of units to match the wit of their opponent. Extend your base network with off-base refineries for harvesting resources, and protect supply networks ensuring a stable income of cash and minerals. You'll even fight other players for occupied banks as a supplementary income, and capture soldiers surviving crews ejected from destroyed tanks and planes or wounded soldiers on the battlefield to take as prisoners of war.


     Three technologically varied and powerful factions each with their own skills and strengths Weapons, vehicles and armaments based on real life or near-future prototype equipment 
     Huge life-like maps across a war-torn political landscape
     Fight for natural resources and cash to keep the wheels of war turning 
     Capture prisoners of war and ransom them back to your enemy
     Occupy banks as supplementary income 
     Set up supply lines and strategically build your base to match your strategy 
     Thwart nuclear attacks tactical weapons with missile defenses, or bomb your enemy out of the fight! 
     A classical RTS experience paying homage to the Golden Era of RTS, the 90's and early 00's. 


Source: The Game Website.

Name: Scripta
Description:
Immerse yourself in the era of scribes and engraved stones. Write words together, collect laurel wreaths and get rid of your cards as soon as possible. Only one will win...It's up to you to make history.
The goal of the game is to find a letter to ask to continue the word in progress.
The first player must think of a word that begins with the letter drawn and put the second letter of that word down by choosing from the cards in his hand. The next player must think of a word starting with the two letters on the table and put the third letter on the table, and so on.

—description from the publisher

Name: Auto Club Revolution
Description:
Auto Club Revolution (ACR) is a Free2Play racing game built for the players.

Drivers are invited to start their personal racing career and take on the world in exciting multiplayer events. Players can create and customise races and events to meet their needs and challenge friends in fast, thrilling, action.

Racing across licensed and fictional tracks in some of the world’s most luxurious and desired cars, drivers can purchase, research and customise their journey to become unbeatable on the road.
ACR is an ever evolving experience, adding new content and features in tandem with real world events.

The team has drawn heavily on their experience creating racing games to expand the racing genre and has worked very closely with many major motor brands to deliver unrivaled access to players’ favourite car marques.

Source: The Game Website.

Name: Into the Grey
Description:
promo text from publisher:
Into The Grey is a story about a future world. Technology has outrun most of the people, and everyone has to take care of themselves. You live from job to job, you meet creatures so upgraded with machinery that they are only vaguely human anymore. You come places you usually wouldnÕt think of setting foot in. You are forced to defend your life. And yet &mdash this is your world, here you and your skills are still of some value at least. Here, if you are lucky enough, you could make it.
Sometimes, you share a drink wih other lost souls, and together you look to the stars. Dream of joining those heading off to the stars one day. That is where the answer lies, they say, if the future still has a future.

Tracklist:

Interface (3:46) Essential In This Day And Age — powerful, rhythmic, driving
    Mega City (4:16) Our Chance To Survive Is Somewhere In There — gigantic, mighty, menacing
    Cyber Club (2:36) Shake That... Thing! — rhythmic, melodic, strange
    What Is Left To Live For (4:05) Is There Still A Point To That? — sad, lonely, hopeless
    Another Mission (4:21) Preparation Is Everything — expectant, moving, focused
    Into The Grey (4:28) Out On Our Own Now — vigorous, determined, powerful
    Downtown Blues (3:07) And Another One For My Friend Here — lonely, cold, flowing
    Mercenary (3:15) Doing The Job In Style — cool, vibrant, driving
    Pursuit Race (3:22) My Foot Is Already Down To The Floor! — fast, frantic, reckless
    The Zone (3:58) Shortcut To The Other Side— vast, empty, menacing
    Mothership (4:32) The First To Go There — confident, hopeful, solemn
    Capsule (2:40) In A Tight Spot — onerous, tight, lonely
    Leaving Space Dock (3:33) Gaining Momentum For An Important Journey— expectant, huge, mighty
    Weightless (3:34) A Feeling Beyond Imagination — floating, dreamlike, clear
    Cyborg Confrontation (3:21) Quite Attached To Their Weapons — fast, rhythmic, merciless
    The Nebulae (3:31) Sheer Magnitude — grand, beautiful, lonely
    Red Alert (3:29) In Case Of An Emergency, Please Stay Calm — loud, hectic, dangerous
    Alien Encounter (3:42) Take Us To Your Leader — menacing, insecure, impressive
    Orbit (3:49) A Magnificent View From Here — calm, floating, arcane
    Stellar Battle (4:03) More Power To The Shields! — gigantic, dangerous, dramatic
    The Future Is Not Yet Written (5:36) A Moment That Will Be Lost In Time — grave, grand, gloomy

Total playing time: 79:48 min.

Name: Tales of Entropy: Awakening
Description:
From the introduction:

Teenage girl develops dangerous powers.

In 1983 Americans are scared to death of Soviet attack and nuclear war. To combat the Soviet threat a joint team of CIA and military personnel has been developing a new kind of weapon in a secret test lab. This weapon is Iris Lindstrom, a teenage girl with newfound psionic abilities. The team, headed by brilliant psychologist Dr. Sands, is trying to research, magnify, control and ultimately duplicate Iris’ power. In practice, this means endless tests in a sterile environment. The lab complex itself is hidden under a remote farm in Iowa, surrounded by an endless plateau of cornfields.

Name: DAK: The Campaign in North Africa, 1940-1942
Description:
The 5th entry in The Gamer's popular Operational Combat System, and the grandest in scope, DAK covers the entire North African campaign at the regimental level, from Compass to El Alemain and beyond.

This is the most specialized of the OCS titles, with rules for the Commonwealth brigades & unusual organizations, minefields, the Greek campaign, and a variety of others (including the humorous poke at Richard H. Berg with the Italian Pasta rule: there is no rule for the Italians' preference for pasta).

Name: Advanced Melee
Description:
This 32-page rulebook expands Melee, providing rules for movement, facing, initiative, surprise, lots of information about weapons and combat including peculiar weapons, left-hand weapons, thrown weapons, missile weapons, shield-rush attacks, hand-to-hand combat, trampling, sweeping blows, ambush, berserking, dropped and broken weapons, fire, poison, gunpowder, and mounted combat.

Advanced Melee is part of The Fantasy Trip system, which also includes Melee, Wizard, Advanced Wizard, and In The Labyrinth.


            
        
    


Note that Steve Jackson has regained rights to TFT and is publishing a new version. The new Advanced Melee will be part of the ItL book, and more information can be found here...

https://rpggeek.com/rpgitem/256884/fantasy-trip-legacy-edition

Name: The Bull
Description:
From the blurb:

The Bull was an entry in the Fiasco Playset Contest 2010. And it ended up winning first prize.


        The Bull is your typical Stockport boozer. The sun doesn't shine a whole lot in Stockport. There sure is a lot of rain though. The locals that sup a pint of a night in The Bull have lives like rainy days. They take their sunshine as and when they can. Which isn't all that often.


The playset takes inspiration from British telly shows such as Early Doors and Shameless.

Name: Ni Hao Kai-Lan Dragon Boat Race Game
Description: A spin and move race game for 2 to 4 players ages 3 and up. Be the first to win 3 races. Winner gets to wear the dragon mask and lead the Dragon Boat Festival Parade.

Name: Web of Lies
Description:
Publisher Blurb:

In Richmond, Virginia an old florist is found murdered.  There are witnesses and plenty of evidence to convict the accused.  So, why does the police chief want the case dropped?  Why does the family want the investigation halted?  This event is intended for detective and reporter style characters.
A module designed to introduce players and characters to the Fellowship of the White Star campaign of Earth, 02/19/1905.

Name: Yabba-Dabba-Doo
Description:
You move around the board by throwing a die, trying to collect all of the different character cards: Betty, Barney, Pebbles, Bamm-Bamm and Dino. For example, if you end up on a Barney square you take a Barney card. Immediately after you've picked up the card the player to the left of you gets a chance to steal your new card by guessing which one of all Fred's (because this game is about Fred no matter what card you pick up) favorite hobbies is on the back. There are 5 different hobbies represented on each and one of all the character cards (fishing rod, grammophone, grilled meat, golf and TV). So the chance to immediately steal the card is 1 to 5. Once you've collected one of every character card you need to get back home as quickly as possible in order to win.

When you're picking up cards you might get a specialty card. If the back of the card has a picture of Wilma you must move your piece to the beginning. A picture of a happy Fred lets you take one card from an opponent, and an angry Fred makes you give one of your cards to an opponent.

Name: Combat Team: The Captains' War
Description:
"Combat Team: The Captains' War" is "an interactive exercise in company level command in battle written by John F. Antal, a lieutenant colonel in the U.S. Army. The book includes a foreword by Lieutenant General Tommy Franks.

A pair of six-sided dice are required to play this solitaire game which is a variation on the Choose Your Own Adventure game book genre.

In Combat Team, you take on the role of a U.S. Army captain commanding a company-size tank-infantry team in combat. "Combat Team hurls you into the turret of a main battle tank as you command a balanced company team (two M1A2 Abrams tank platoons and two Bradley mechanized infantry platoons) in battle."

Includes several maps and appendices with weapons data and data on the M1A2 Abrams.

John Antal wrote three books which used this system: Armor Attacks, Infantry Combat, and Combat Team.

Name: 5 COLORS
Description:
5 COLORS is a game to win the majority of five colors! Don't get fooled by your opponents!

This game has cards 1-6 in five colors, and each player has five cards in hand. Players play two cards from hand simultaneously, then reveal them. They refill their hand, then repeated this process two more times, revealing only one card each of these time. The cards of the majority color will score — unless too many are present, in which case the color busts and the secondmost color scores. In case of a tie for majority, the tied colors are also out. This is repeated until the deck runs out, and the player with the most points wins.

5 COLORS is a simple game featuring a lot of outsmarting the opponent and counting the cards — yet simple enough for the whole family, making it a great beginner's game.

—description from the publisher

Name: Mists of Akuma: Tsukumogami
Description:
From publisher blurb:

Mists of Akuma is an eastern fantasy noir steampunk campaign setting for D&D 5th Edition

Throughout the realms of Soburin are mystical creatures known as tsukumogami. On the 100th birthday of an inanimate object there’s a chance an item’s spirit manifests physically, turning into a monster that treats those around it in accordance with how well it was tended to in its century of use. Sometimes these are benign entities, but the War of Kaiyo and Kengen Occupation have left many mistreated pieces of technology—few seek anything but bloodshed.

In this FREE PDF sample for Mists of Akuma, you’ll find:

    Information about the important role that tsukumogami play in Mists of Akuma
    Akunomfu: a worn blanket turned into a deadly challenge rating 5 monster
    Chchin-Obake: paper lanterns animated into mysterious challenge rating 1 creatures that haunt Soburin
    Kaiyo Horror: an intelligent monstrous artillery cannon (and challenge rating 10 enemy)
    Kasa-Obake: one of the only tsukumogami that aren’t usually predicated to evil (a challenge rating 2 curiosity)
    A full page map of the continent of Soburin by cartographer Michael McCarthy

Name: Golfette
Description: Board game based on Golf. Nine hole course on the board is played twice. The course has all the usual hazards, bunkers, water hazards, out of bounds, and rough.  Recovery from hazards is achieved using two packs of cards, distance and direction of shots from a chosen club determined by two different size dice. The game can be played by up to 8 players in pairs or two to four singles.

Name: Ice Rage
Description:
User Summary

Ice Rage is a hockey themed game. Your goal Is to beat your opponent in a 2 on 2 hockey match. The game feature 2 player game on the same device, lots of characters and 3 different levels of difficulty.

Name: Operation BP: Bullshit Plug
Description:
A free download-and-print board game released in response to the Deepwater Horizon oil spill.

From the game board: "Times are getting desperate at the Deepwater Horizon. The lies show no sign of running dry and the flow of bullshit appears unstoppable.  Now you and a friend can play out the greatest ecological disaster in recent history and the goliath battle of BP vs. Public Opinion.  Everyone knows that appearing to do something is far better (and a whole lot cheaper) than actually doing something.  So,  as BP, you’re going to do your best to spin your way to a healthier share price.  As the public, you can bring a certain amount of pressure to bear upon the monolithic oil company -  but maybe that’s exactly what sends their PR machine into overdrive? Can BP can be relied upon to do the right thing by themselves and fix the leak?"

Name: The Tinker Mage
Description:
From publisher blurb:

Introducing the Tinker Mage - a new 5th edition base class

Looking for a new class to spice up your tabletop game?  Meet the Tinker Mage, a stand-alone 5th Edition base class inspired by various gun wielders but with a magical twist.  Fueled by raw magic, the Tinker Mage relies on its intelligence in order to channel the forces of the elements into convenient storage crystals, using them to power tools and weapons to unleash them upon their foes in combat.

Designed with a variety of play styles in mind - play as a long ranged sniper, an in-your-face swordsman, a dual-wielding gunslinger, or even a mobility focused magic user.

Features:

    A new character class for 5th Edition
    5 Character Subclasses:  The Constructor, the Duelist, the Gunslinger, the Marsman, and the Spell Striker
    4 New Character Backgrounds

Name: AT-43 Hero Box: Lieutenant Dragomira O-3
Description:
"Right away, Sir!" "But...I haven't given you any orders yet?!?" "No need. I know." - Lieutenant Dragomira O-3, before her first engagement.

Dragomira O-3 is an officer and a hero for the Red Blok army. She can become the officer of any Dragomirov kolossus unit. Lieutenant Dragomira O-3 is a monster of endurance that not only allows to increase the maximum number of fighters in her unit, but she also provides it with an excellent officer. Her "Gestalt" ability increases the leadership point pool of her company. The special rules for Dragomira O-3 are detailed in AT-43 Campaign: Frostbite. T

Contains:
    1 miniature
    1 card

Name: The Caves of Valesh Kanos
Description:
From the introduction:

The Caves of Valesh Kanos is a one-shot story session designed to be played with the Tales of Arcana Roleplaying Card Game, though it could be adapted for play with other RPG systems. It is designed for one Story Master (SM) to narrate and three Players, with the overall session lasting 1.5–2.5 hours.  Players will randomly generate their characters. Only the SM should view this Story Guide and should read through it before the session begins.  Occasionally, [characters] will receive tips from two natives of Arcana: Manitous, the god of reality and Glytch, a fablead (story nymph). Glytch is very helpful, but it might be best to just ignore Manitous.

Name: The 3 Rocketeers
Description:
From publisher blurb:

Journey through the Holy Roman Stellar Empire and the worlds of Britannica Solaria in this Fate World of Adventure by PK Sullivan! The Queen’s enemies may have disbanded the Rocketeers, but duty cannot be set aside so easily.

A deadly cabal of nobles and clergy threaten to usurp Her Majesty Queen Marie-Hélène’s throne and hand Gallia over to Pope Regulus IV, and the Rocketeers now work from the shadows to protect the queen from threats both foreign and domestic. Foreign spies and papal agents lurk in every shadow as the trap draws ever closer.

A laser-sharp blade and even sharper wits will serve you well as interstellar powers play the game of puppets and shadows. The fate of the crown is in your hands.

The Three Rocketeers requires Fate Core to play. This 40-page supplement includes:

    Rules for no-skill Fate, where aspects provide roll bonuses without invocation
    Categorized aspect creation to help players create their characters quickly and get the most out of their invocations
    A simple system to build flashy customized swordplay stunts
    Conspiracy creation guidelines that integrate aspects and approaches to help direct the story
    Ready-made characters based on the characters of Alexandre Dumas
    A sample adventure: Battle for the Gallian Throne


The Three Rocketeers: All for one and one for all!

Name: EN5ider (Issue 144 - Apr 2017)
Description:
EN5ider
Issue 144
April 2017

The ZEITGEIST Adventure Path Player's Guide Part 4

Name: Turandot
Description:
The opera 'Turandot' is about to go on stage, but who will sing the aria 'Nessun dorma' is still a mystery! Can you recruit the best and most talented cast of singers to perform this masterpiece of the maestro Giacomo Puccini? Choosing a brilliant director may be your most important choice!

A quick card-game for 3-5 players (with a 2 player variant). Based on the Nessun Dorma lyrical aria by Giacomo Puccini, Turandot requires the players to gather a team of six singers in order to enact that very piece of the Turandot. Players recruit singers and a director using a simultaneous selection mechanic, with an original twist.

Artwork by professional illustrator Martino Palladini.

Name: More Mythic Places
Description:
From back cover:

Places you've only dreamt of...

Beyond the peasant's reckoning, nay beyond the mundane world entirely, lie mystic realms that none but the learned, innocent, and blessed may perceive. These realms are the resting places of great beings of potence, and if properly approached they may grant great gifts. But lo, to enter the realms is to risk all, for after entering, one may never again find the path back to the mundane world. Proceed with caution...

MORE MYTHIC PLACES(TM) is an ARS MAGICA(TM) supplement that presents 5 magical locales of Faerie, Magic, Dominion and Infernal might, sites designed to be the foci of many different stories. These locales are unique because they are composed of regio, levels of magical potence. Each level characterizes a single mythic place in a new way so that each place really has several natures, not just that apparent to the mortal world. Numerous story hooks also provide you with a wealth of applications for each locale. Thus, More Mythic Places(TM) offers a multitude of storytelling possibilities, presenting adventure locales that may be used again and again because they are rarely the same twice.

Name: Pikmin RPG (Beta Versions)
Description:
from the designer's blog on 1KM1KT

Explore with the help of pikmin, small plant creatures. You should be familiar with the Pikmin series of videogames or you won’t understand this game.

This is my first shot at writing a full rpg.

I do not own Pikmin or any of it’s trademarks.
 Pikmin and all of it’s trademarks are property of nintendo.

The Planet of the Pikmin…

Ever since Captain Olimar discovered this plant-filled planet, explorers from Hocotate have come by the dozens in search of treasure, creatures, and knowledge. Some suceed; Others are killed by the indigenous wildlife. All of them, however, are aided by the Pikmin, the small plant creatures that first helped Captain Olimar. Since Olimar left the planet for the second time, several new species of Pikmin have been discovered. Red, Blue, Yellow, Purple, White, Green, Orange, and the elusive Bulbmin will all help you on your adventure. So strap yourself into your ship, cross your fingers, and blast off!

Pikmin Rpg is a role playing game based off of the popular Pikmin videogame series.

To play this game you need:

At least one 1d4, 1d6, 1d8, 1d10, 1d12, 1d20.

Paper

Pencil

Imagination! =)

Name: R.E.A.C.T. Campaign Worldbook v1.1 (Polysystem Edition)
Description:
From publisher blurb:

New Edition! Now supported by 4 more systems.

Enter the world of R.E.A.C.T., the Research, Engineering, And Crisis Team! Psychics and cyborgs battle mutants to defend mankind from extra-dimensional destruction in this sci-fi espionage themed action-adventure game world. Forget games with nebulous morality where the characters are reprobates, monsters or anti-heroes; R.E.A.C.T. is absolutely the good guys and are out to save the world... with Science!

     98 pages (12 more than before)
     4 different divisions
     Character archetypes and advancement (6 more than before)
     92 original illustrations (48 more than before)

Name: The Hardy Boys Mystery Game: The Secret of Thunder Mountain
Description:
Family game (Ages 7 - 14) for 2-4 players.  Players race to solve their part of the mystery (Who? What? When? or Where?).

From the box:

In search of stolen gems, the Hardy Boys traveled to Thunder Mountain on their motorcycles. There they found pieces of evidence that helped them solve the robbery. Now you must gather your own pieces of evidence in order to win this game.

It's exciting. Which player will be the first to discover WHO?, WHAT?, WHERE?, or WHEN?

It's fast. Your playing piece is a motorcycle.  With it you travel around the board trying to gather the pieces of evidence that you need.

It's a game that involves some strategy. Being a detective tests your concentration and memory.

Join the Hardy Boys in a new adventure. See if you, too, are able to solve the MYSTERY OF THUNDER MOUNTAIN.

Name: Master Break
Description:
From the inlay (Play It Again Sam 17 compilation re-release):

Snooker-style trivia quiz game for 1-4 players. Over 1500 questions on Science & Nature, Sport, Pop Music, Geography, etc. All the fun of a trivia quiz and snooker match rolled into one enthralling game.

Credits:

Game Author: Walter Mansell

Name: Genpei War
Description:
Issue game of Wargame Japanese History #10.

Covering the campaign between Taira and Minamoto clans during the Genpei war (1180–1185) - (http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Genpei_War).

The game engine is a card-driven and the map is divided into areas.
This game covers the period from battle of Ujigawa to the end of the campaign. Due to the period and the map, the battles are fought around Seto and the inside sea.

Components:

    1 map
    80 counters
    4 pages rulebook
    30 cards

Name: Election USA
Description:
Why not run for President in this first boardgame from Mongoose Publishing?

Remember, though, you have to be a Republican! To succeed you will need to spend your money wisely , while sincerely holding policies that others might question, (for example borderline psychotic!). Be careful to avoid the prying eyes of journalists attempting to shake the skeletons from your closet, or the phone call asking for $5 million to stay quiet about past improprieties. If you can tread this political tight-rope then you will win the Republican nomination, and therefore the Presidency of the United States of America!

Election USA is a simple satirical game designed for Ages 12 and up. You can play with between 3 and 5 players and games run between 30 minutes to an hour.

(from publisher's website)

Name: Always/Never/Now Scenario File
Description:
This is the core book for a GM in a game of Always/Never/Now

From the Introduction:

Always/Never/Now (aka A/N/N) is an action-packed roleplaying game adventure with built-in rules.

A/N/N is a descendant of an RPG campaign I ran back in the mid-to-late 1990s, inspired by everything from William Gibson to James Bond, with doses of Quentin Tarantino, Robert Rodriguez, John Woo, Die Hard, Mission: Impossible, Strange Days, and whatever other action or espionage movie I had seen that week. Things like The Matrix and Ghost in the Shell and the Bourne films made me want to play in this universe again…

Name: Septikon: Uranium Wars
Description:
From publisher:

What is it?

In Septikon we have tried to re-create a retro-futuristic atmosphere which was popular in games like Fallout and BioShock. The players take role of the owners and leaders of orbital mining battle stations, which are hunting for rich uranium deposits in an asteroid belt.

Since there is not enough uranium for everyone, the players have to fight with other space explorers for every asteroid. By using a rich armory of defensive and offensive measures and a loyal crew of their own clones, the player will have to survive a terrible battle and do everything to be first to put the other player out of action.

This game is completely unique. Imagine a turn-based game in the Tower Defence genre, where you must not only protect your own prosperity, but also send waves of attackers in your opponent's direction!

How do you play?

The station is not automated, which makes it much more reliable but at the same time requires a crew for manual operation. The player rolls a die, which determines the distance that one of his obedient clones can travel to the required section, to activate a piece of equipment or a weapon which is installed there. The choice of clones and the goal will depend on the current situation and the player's long-term strategy.

The station is completely autonomous. The player can mine and process resources, carry out repairs, defrost new clones to increase the size of his crew — but it's not that easy when you are being attacked by your opponent's entire battle force, and you want to teach them a lesson...

The player wins when he puts the other player's station completely out of action.

Why should I play Septikon?


    It's original. Are you looking for something new? We can guarantee that you have never seen a game like this one!
    It's well developed. Like a good brandy, our game was in development for 12 years — that's 12 years of constant testing and thousands of matches played.
    It's dynamic. Sid Meier said, "A game is a series of interesting choices." Septikon will not overload or bore you into a stupor. Of course, the player has something to think about every turn, but he has only a limited number of optimal choices. That means that you won't spend too much time waiting your turn.
    It’s multi-faceted: Consider a whole range of strategies that all deserve to be tried out:
        Burning. Burn through the opponent’s battle station with your lasers, cutting him off his supplies, ammunition and oxygen.
        Suppression. Destroy his battle sections and maintenance modules, block his shooters and stop him from recovering.
        Landing. Attack your enemy with a squad of fully armored and equipped BioDrones. Let them rip through his defenses.
        Exhaustion. Destroy your opponent’s strategic resources with quick targeted attacks and sneaky diversions, and while he is trying to recover, create an invincible army.
        Massacre. Focus your entire production on creating nuclear charges. Suppress the opponent’s defenses and drown him in a nuclear fog.
    


What's in the box?


    24 clone figures (in two different colors). Each one of them will obediently carry out all your orders and activate different station modules.
    160 wooden cubes, representing resources which will be needed to run the station and keep it safe: Oxygen, Metal, Rockets, BioMass, Energy, BioDrones and — obviously — Uranium;
    4 nuclear Rockets for those who like it hot;
    8 satellite tokens and 8 Energy Shield tokens — efficient measures for launching your own space-to-space grid;
    80 damage tokens — during the space battles stations will take a lot of damage, and many sections will be competely put out of action;
    1 huge game board with two stations and some space between them;
    2 six-sided dice, which in this game are called Random Number Generators. A single roll at the beginning of the turn will determine the "time period" which the player can use this turn.
    2 books — One, consisting of just 2 pages, contains the Intro Game Rules, the other, the full rules (8 pages).


How did the game come to life?

Igrology is one of most successful Russian board game developers. We have created 18 products, many of which are constantly being re-published. In 2011, we have sold over 100,000 copies in total in Russia.

Now we are facing a new task, to bring unique ideas to the international games' market. Septikon is the first and very important step for us in that direction.

Septikon was created by the Russian game designer Konstantin Seleznev and polished by 12 years of work and thousands of matches. In 2011, Igrology noticed this original game at the Moscow Games Convention "Igroteka Avtorov", where all other publishers did not pay a lot of attention to it due to its very unusual concept and seemingly complicated game board.

The Igrology team, together with the game author, spent almost a year creating a setting, fine-tuning game rules, and polishing the design. Now, we have the pleasure of bringing it to all board game fans.

During the next year we will be releasing the first expansion, as well as an iPad version of Septikon.

Name: Virgins
Description:
In Virgins you play the Lord of two villages, and as Lord you choose which villagers stay and which villagers travel to other player's villages. Adding fuel to the fire, a Dragon has taken up residence near by!

The Dragon has agreed not to burn down your villages if you sacrifice Virgins to it (bit of a stereo-type, that). For the good of your villages you've got to keep your Virgins uh, virgins.

So send any Strapping Youths, the Bad Boy, and that smooth singing Musician off to another player's village! Don't forget to keep the Sheriff in a friendly village to keep the peace and if you can, make sure the Bartender only gets the Blacksmith drunk!

If there are no virgins to sacrifice at the end of a round the dragon does what dragons do best. Burning down your villages and gobbling everyone up even you Lords!

Name: 1 vs. 100 DVD Board Game
Description: In this DVD game, host Bob Saget asks players multiple-choice trivia questions, as they compete against 100 Mob members. The object of the game is to eliminate the entire Mob and win up to $1,000,000 in pretend money. The host asks the player and the Mob the same multiple-choice trivia question. If the player gets it right, they win money for each Mob member that answered incorrectly, plus eliminates those Mob members from the game. If the player gets the question wrong, the Mob splits the winnings and the game is over. At certain points, the player will have opportunities to stop the game and leave with their winnings or risk all of their winnings and play for more money.  This DVD Board Game includes the DVD game and player cards.

Name: The Bugbear No. 1: Class-as-Race
Description:
From publisher blurb:

The Bugbear is a publication dedicated to stripping away the fluff from mechanics and re- skinning them so that Players and Referees have the kind of freedom that allows a bugbear to be a pumpkin-headed giant, a cross between a bug and a bear, or a giant hairy goblin.

Variant rules for use with Ba5ic, a fantasy role-playing game that encourages players to explore worlds of magic, monsters, and whatever else they can imagine. The game is designed to be rules-light, making improvisational, pick-up, and long-term play a breeze for beginner and veteran players alike.

Name: X-Men
Description:
From back of game case;

Magneto Makes His Move!

The Evil mutant magneto has devised the world's deadliest computer virus. its sole purpose: to destroy the Uncanny X-Men.

Now Wolverine, Gambit, Cyclops, and Nightcrawler join Storm, iceman, Archangel, Jean Grey, and rogue to stop Magneto from carrying out his diabolicial plan.

Their target is Magneto's secret base on Asteroid M. But lying in ambush are the murderous arch villains Juggernaut, Sabertooth, Mojo, and Deathbird.

Will Wolverine's adamantium claws and Gambit's energy charged playing cards be enough to defeat the forces of Magneto? That's up to you.

Name: Hunter Sheets Issue One
Description:
From the back of the book:

Hunter Sheets. A quick opportunity for wealth and fame. Or an even quicker death...

This first collection of Sheets gives info on 20 subversives that SLA Industries wants terminated with extreme prejudice. From DarkNight Contract Killer Brad 'Bar' Sinister to rogue Vevaphon Seraph, these are targets that will test operatives' skills (and LAD accounts) to their limits. Also included are some more details on Chi'en blood magic and the Krell. This ancient alien race was believed to be long dead, until they returned to reclaim their home world of Xaime. SLA Industries is a game of urban horror with a dedicated and expanding fanbase.

Name: Edition Troll: Welt der Spiele Sammelband
Description:
User summaryThe Edition Troll - Welt der Spiele Sammelband is a compilation of three randomized generic fantasy adventures that have been glued together in a single cover.

The adventures are randomly selected from the following items, which have also been available separately:

     Elfenbanner
     Sternenhöh
     Ruinen des Schreckens
     Merlins Lieder
     Gralfsee
     Zeit des Nebels
     Geister der Vergangenheit
     Im Auftrag des Königs
     Beowulfs Saga
     Zauberspiegel - Im Banne Zaccatas
     Tod einer Priesterin


This was an attempt to make some money of excess stock. The adventures that were glued together included the cardstock covers, which makes browsing difficult and tends to break the binding.

The page count depends on the adventures that were included.

Name: Ruins of Ne ork
Description:
From publisher blurb:

Amidst the burning ruins of the past, a new future awaits! A six-page, quick-play Parsely adventure set in a post-apocalyptic wasteland. It’s recommended that you know the rules of Parsely games before playing.

Name: The Vagrant: Optional Character Class
Description:
From publisher blurb:

Vagrants are not technically thieves although often they do have some thieving abilities that they have picked up living on the streets of large cities.  What they do possess is an unnatural ability to stay alive.  Whether it be thru trickery, gambling, outright stealing, and on occasion murder.  They always manage to make their way in the world.  More often than not Vagrants are neutral or evil aligned.  Rarely will you find a good aligned vagrant who is just down on his luck.  As far as Weapons & Armour go, Vagrants will only have what they manage to scrape together from various sources: looting dead bodies, stealing from smiths.  Vagrants start with little to no GP's as starting wealth.

Name: Fantasy! Old School Gaming: Startregler
Description:
From publisher blurb:

Sätt på dig rustning och hjälm, dra svärdet, tänd din fackla och bege dig in bland de olycksbådande, mörka ruinerna! I Fantasy! - Old School Gaming reser du tillbaka till rollspelens barndom, när allt var enklare, farligare och roligare. Här finns alla regler du behöver, flera monster, ett kortäventyr.


Translation courtesy of Google:

Put on your armor and helmet, drawing the sword, lit your torch and go in among the ominous, dark ruins! In Fantasy! - Old School Gaming traveling back to the role of games childhood, when everything was simpler, more dangerous and more fun. Here are all the rules you need, more monsters, a short adventure.

Name: Beyond Atlantis II
Description:
Atlantis III: The New World (Known as Beyond Atlantis II in USA) is a fantasy adventure computer game developed by Cryo Interactive and published by Dreamcatcher Interactive, and released in 2001. It's the third in the Atlantis series by Cryo, as well as the last one made before Cryo's downfall. Similar to the second game, not much of the game is based around Atlantis. It was followed by Atlantis Evolution in 2004.

Source: Wikipedia, "Atlantis III: The New World", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

Name: Together
Description:
From the box:

Children work together to solve world and human problems presented in a simplified way. Good for a small or large group. Children are divided into simulated social groups (tribes, nations, etc). Each group gets Problem Cards and a share of Solution Cards. Through discussion, trade agreements, world councils... the players try to solve all the problems facing them. The debriefing session at the end allows for everyone to learn from each other. Our most popular group game! Good for repeated uses.

Name: Villains
Description:
You are the leader of a fiendish organization bent on dominating "The City", but you are are not alone in the quest to become its undisputed master. Your enemies are lurking in the shadows, watching your every move. If you desire any chance of completing your devilish plans then secrecy must be your watchword. Keep your enemies guessing with bluffs, misdirection, and cunning strategy.

Villains is a 3-5 player game where each player represents a different faction of archetypal villains (players can choose from the invading aliens, an organized crime family, the robot uprisings, invading soviets and more).

Each turn the players secretly set their evil plans in motion by placing face down action tokens in different areas of the city. These tokens allow players to deploy troops, play action cards, initiate battles and use special faction specific abilities.

There are two paths to victory in a game of Villains: be the first player to complete four of your faction's plans or alternatively be the first player to achieve ten victory points by controlling important locations in The City.
Mechanics: ['Action Points', 'Area Majority / Influence', 'Area Movement', 'Dice Rolling', 'Secret Unit Deployment', 'Variable Player Powers']

Name: Icy Foreshadowing
Description:
From publisher blurb:

Legend holds that once dragons ruled.  They carved out kingdoms and reigned unchallenged for uncounted millennia.  Only speculation explains why the time of dragons came to an end, but it is doubtful the young races could have arisen if they still ruled.  For several years, it has been an open secret that the dragon cults have been strategizing to bring dragons back.  Signs seem to indicate that at least one cult has succeeded.  Heroes are needed to quash the threat lest it fester into something that could bring disaster to the entire region.  A Dungeons and Dragons 5th Edition Adventure for 1-8 4th level characters.  This is the first episode in the Wyrmling Saga.

Name: Frigid Reflections
Description:
From publisher blurb:

The stunning conclusion to the Beyond the Glittering Fane adventure arc, Frigid Reflections takes the PCs north to the mining town of Utivkle to look in on an aging, Stone Touched dwarf. After arriving, they discover that the troubles plaguing Utvikle are far from singular, and if not dealt with, they could spread throughout all of Midgard. After saving Utvikle, the PCs are called on for a greater task, one that will take them into the heart of Niflæheim – the Realm of All Winter itself.

With hope fading and the nights freezing, the PCs must brave the dangers of the icy realm, facing some of its toughest denizens while working to free their new allies, the ælven clades of Niflæheim. After facing waves of foes and some of the harshest weather any of them have ever seen, the PCs must descend deep into the Temple of Isa – the Great Temple of the Ice Rune – to stop two of Mhamnoch’s own before they unleash their ancient agendas on the ice ælves, and after them, anyone else in their path.

Frigid Reflections is an adventure for 4-5 9th level characters set in the world of Rhune: Dawn of Twilight. Although this adventure is designed exclusively for this setting, it can easily be adapted for any of your favorite Pathfinder Roleplaying Game compatible campaign settings.

Name: Pingu Acts Up
Description:
A Pingu-themed gamed combining Roll & Move with Charades.
Players play as Pingu, Pinga, Bajoo or Robby the Seal & race to reach the start of the 'I See Slide'.
Along the way, there are 'Act Up' spaces where a player may draw a card & then perform the charade listed. these range from 'Brushing your teeth' & 'Flying a toy plane' to 'Pingu Boogaloo'. If the other players guess your charade, you keep the card & get the points listed on it.
Once a player has reached the start of the Slide, all players move there. Once someone crosses the finish line, the game is over.
The winner is the one who has scored the most points from their charades.

Name: Bowling Dice
Description:
from the box: "All the fun of lane bowling without the gutter balls" and "The bowling game you can play anywhere, anytime!"

Roll the dice, score the points as in bowling, pass the dice to the next player.

Comes with 10 dice and scoring pad.

Similar games:

    Spare Time Bowling
    Bowl and Score
    Bowl-A-Strike
Mechanics: ['Dice Rolling', 'Die Icon Resolution', 'Set Collection', 'Solo / Solitaire Game']

Name: Tolentino 1815
Description:
When Napoleon escaped from Elba in 1815, his former cavalry commander Murat was still King of Naples. He had switched sides the year before in an attempt to retain his throne, but he soon found that neither Austria nor Britain were willing to keep their promises. When Napoleon marched on Paris, Murat attacked the Austrians in Central Italy. He was defeated in the battle of Tolentino on 2 May. He escaped to France, but Napoleon did not want his services. After Napoleon´s defeat at Waterloo, Murat returned to Italy, where he was executed in October 1815.

The not so well known battle of Tolentino is the subject of "Tolentino 1815" a Napoleonic wargame from Italian wargames magazine "Alea Iacta Est". It includes one unmounted 42 x 58 cm map and 216 thin cardboard counters, all in full colour. One game turn represents 2 hours of real time, and one hex is 250 meters.

The magazine is in Italian, but the rules in English are also included.

Name: Luther: Das Spiel
Description: For the 500th anniversary of Martin Luther's Ninety-five Theses of 1517, players in Luther: Das Spiel can now live as Luther's contemporaries, following in his footsteps, traveling the cities where he worked, and encountering important companions of the Reformer.

Name: Job Creator(?)
Description:
Job Creator(?) is an economic strategy game.  Players are members of the "1%" in a small town.  They own means of production and shops in the town, employ the citizens and produce and sell goods back to the population.  In the beginning of the game, a small percentage of the town is employed, however the population has all of the money they need to buy goods and keep the economy moving. As play progresses, franchises (and later Big Boxes) move into the town, both of these change the purchasing dynamic of the town and makes doing business much harder.

The game combines "rondel" and "worker placement" gaming, along with economic strategy.  Victory is determined by Victory Points, which are primarily earned by paying workers (although there are other ways to gain and lose points).

Name: Hideous Creatures: Serpent Folk
Description:
From publisher blurb:

In this series, Kenneth Hite looks at the creatures, species, and monsters of the Cthulhu Mythos from every non-Euclidean angle. Alternate versions and new explanations provide the same jolt of mythic bisociation that the gods and titans receive in the TRAIL OF CTHULHU corebook. Hite traces these foul things through their legendary history, and provides further clues for any Investigator to follow. Horrific scenario seeds burst and bloom, story spines protrude and deform, in a blasphemous garden any Keeper can harvest.

“The features mingled and merged in a seemingly impossible manner. Then, like a fading mask of fog, the face suddenly vanished and in its stead gaped and leered a monstrous serpent’s head!” They built Valusia before the dinosaurs, and lurk behind half mankind’s darkest cults. Are they extra-dimensional, extra-terrestrial, or just extra venomous? You won’t fool the Children of Yig, in any skin they wear.

Hideous Creatures: Serpent Folk is the fourth installment of the Ken Writes About Stuff #2 subscription, or it’s available as a stand-alone product.

Name: Twisted Tales
Description:
From the back cover:
There Are A Thousand Stories In The Weird West(tm)... This Is Yours.

Sure, we've got some pretty darn good tales about the Weird West(tm) (you can read some of them in our dandy Dime Novels(tm), which come in this very same size), but theones you'll remember the best are your very own.  This here book's got space in it for you to record your posse's wanderings in the Weird West(tm), plus there's a deluxe character record, and rules for giving faithful writers a bonus for their efforts.  Go ahead: Make this book your own!

Name: Ghost Cartels
Description:
Publisher blurb:

The shadows are abuzz about the new drug in the sprawl: tempo. It takes the user on a unique trip, better than anything experienced before. Druggies can’t get enough of the stuff, and even beetleheads are giving it a shot. Tempo’s popularity shifts the balance of power between the syndicates and soon the blood and bullets are flowing.

Ghost Cartels drops the runners into the action, involving them in the drug deals and power plays shaking up Seattle, Los Angeles, and Hong Kong - even taking them all the way to the jungles of South America.

Name: Ecstasy: A Game for Lovers
Description:
Ecstasy is a game for lovers who have forgotten the excitement of their mate. The path around the board is meant to get bring partners closer together both emotionally and physically.

Each player must pass the Preparation space and write down exactly what they want done. The game is completed when one player crosses the finish line. The winner must then have what they wrote down for the preparation space completed.

Name: Wrecked (2012)
Description:
USer summary:

A non-split screen scrolling top-view multiplayer racing game with weapons. Essentially a multiplayer game though there are single player possibilities. Players race side by side through the stage, trying to push each other off or strike the opponents with missiles, machine guns, mines and the likes.

Similar to "Micromachines", when playing multiplayer, players are crushed if too far behind the leader. On 3–4 players, crushed players can attack the remaining players with air strikes.

Name: Ta & Ge
Description: For two players or more. The goal is to receive as many white pieces as possible. One player selects something on the wheel. The other player doesn't know what the other has selected and has to guess. Among the alternatives are "take two pieces", "give two pieces" and so on. Correct guesses are rewarded and wrong ones punished.

Name: Pixeline Skolehjælp: Learning English - Money or nothing
Description:
User Summary

This is a school aid programme that helps kids learn English in the form of numbers 1-20, the alphabet and understanding individual words - all through mini-games and puzzles.

You help Pixeline sort out who inherits Guldbergh before the money falls to the greedy lawyer Naerrig (Stingy).

LEARNING ENGLISH: Money or nothing

Pixeline har brug for hjælp til at løse gåden, om hvem der arver de mange millioner som Guldbergh har efterladt til en hemmelig arving. Hvis du ikke finder arvingen, gåralle pengene til den griske Advokat Næhrrig.

I spillet lærer du på en sjov måde at forstå engelske ord, alfabetet og tallene fra 1-20. Der er i alt hele 11 minispil, der giver en god introduktion af de engelske for begyndere.

Back of the box

Name: Tom Clancy's Rainbow Six: Take-Down – Missions in Korea
Description:
Tom Clancy's Rainbow Six: Take-Down – Missions in Korea is a South Korean-made PC game release on July, 2001. The game is not based on the Rainbow Six game timeline since the game was not released outside of South Korea and was only made by Kama Digital Entertainment for the South Korean gaming market with major content difference and the game's events on South Korean soil.
