In the game, RAINBOW gets deployed to South Korea and battles seemingly armed terrorists and criminals that have committed various acts, mostly against South Korean nationals.

Source: Wikipedia, "https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tom_Clancy%27s_Rainbow_Six," available under the [ http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/3.0/  CC-BY-SA License].

Name: This Hallowed Ground
Description:
"This Hallowed Ground" is a set of rules for American Civil War 15mm military figures. These rules are designed for grand tactical play. The scale is set at six turns per hour and one inch for twenty-five yards. Movement, fire, and morale are based upon the brigade (consisting of one to six regiments for infantry and cavalry.) Artillery is structured around a battery of four to six guns (represented by a single unit.) Included is a sample (and partial) Order of Battle for Gettysburg and a supplement for adapting the rules to fictious battles against forces loyal to the Emperor Maxmillian I of Mexico.

 
These rules are quite comprehensive, including command control, weather and other random events (such as pre-battle disease), artillery crew casualties, the effects of unit training/experience, close action procedures, morale, sighting and line-of-fire, and much more. 
 Three appendices are included: A graphic description of formations; a brief description for conversion to 25mm figures; and a glossary.

Name: Disney Handy Manny: Fleißige Handwerker
Description:
The game contains a tool box, six chips which show two different tools on their two sides (each tool appears twice) and 16 repair cards which show things that have to be repaired and the three tools needed for that.

One card is flipped open and all chips are put into the tool box. The active player shakes the tool box well, then flips it over and checks whether the chips (which fell out) show the three necessary tool symbols. If yes, then the player gets the card. If not, the chips are returned to the tool box and the box is passed on to the next player. The player with most cards at the end of the game is the winner.

Name: Horrors of the Lifechain Volume II
Description:
From publisher blurb:

The Multiverse is more dangerous than you thought.                      

Horrors of the Lifechain Volume II introduces more than forty new threats for space-faring heroes and Lifespawn post humans. Bestial xeno-predators, militant alien warlords, cunning cosmic manipulators and ghoulish, star-flying undead all menace the galaxy. Some creatures are Lifespawn and feed exclusively on their own kind, while other new monsters are built specifically to menace Anthro or Battlechanger heroes.

Name: The Battle for Sector 219
Description:
The Battle for Sector 219 is an abstract strategy card game where two players field a sci-fi army battling a rival race for control of a world's capital city. The game is easy to learn and quick to play but has a depth of strategy usually found only in games that takes much longer to play.

Source: The Game Website.

Name: Fireball Island: The Curse of Vul-Kar – Treasure Trove
Description:
Treasure Trove includes more souvenir cards to shuffle into the souvenir deck, legendary artifact cards for you to discover, and injury cards which give you a choice to take a random disadvantage rather than give up a treasure when hit by a fireball.

These cards won't be in the retail game which is what is being shipped to backers so they will come as an extra package. The publisher has said that they will be selling it only through their web store, conventions, and maybe the BGG store.

This expansion to Fireball Island: The Curse of Vul-Kar is a collection of cards unlocked via stretch goals during the Kickstarter campaign.

Contents:
Hangry (12 souvenirs that ramp up the meanness to 11!)
Injuries (12 cards you can take instead of losing a treasure)
Legendary Artifacts (6 super-powerful souvenirs)
Bonus Souvenirs (18 new souvenirs to add to your regular deck)
3 Blank souvenir and 2 blank injury cards so you can make your own designs
Mechanics: ['Action Points', 'Action Queue', 'Area Movement', 'Pick-up and Deliver', 'Push Your Luck', 'Set Collection', 'Take That']

Name: Kampfgruppe
Description: Micro Scale 20mm scale Table top Wargames for fast play. Emphasis on Tank Battles

Name: Gulf Strike
Description: Gulf Strike was designed to be the state of the art in Land, Air, and Sea modern simulation. Since its original release, Gulf Strike has shown its ability to simulate the changing character of the Gulf Wars from the Iran-Iraq war to the Iraqi invasion of Kuwait and its potential aftermath. In fact the original 1983 edition correctly anticipated the type and character of units the United States would send to the region in the event of a crisis. Seven complete scenarios cover the recent history of the region, plus the current Desert Shield operation, and portray the multitude of alliances possible to counter threats arising in numerous quarters. Complete air, land, and sea orders of battle for several dozen nations allow you to fight each conflict to its unpredictable and often startling conclusion.
Mechanics: ['Dice Rolling', 'Grid Movement', 'Hexagon Grid', 'Ratio / Combat Results Table', 'Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game', 'Simulation']

Name: Et pour quelques coupes de plus
Description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Ekbir Introductory Adventure

From the introduction:

Le grand championnat de Kura se produit dans la capitale. L’occasion d’attirer encore plus de monde que d’habitude. La fête bat son plein. Mais un homme vient de découvrir l’impensable, et veut en tirer partie.

Une aventure d’introduction pour personnages de niveau 1 seulement.

Name: Equivalent TRIOs
Description:
Enhance understanding of equivalents in a fun and new way!

Students will gain practice with solving and finding equivalents of percents, decimals, fractions, reduced fractions, and pictures in this domino like game.

Name: Rúna (Season 2, Issue 3 - 1995)
Description:
A kráni fejvadász (M.A.G.U.S.)
Ynevi naptár (M.A.G.U.S.)
Ifin - egy kiegészítÅ‘ beharangozása (M.A.G.U.S.)
Bestiárium - hat új bestia (M.A.G.U.S.)
Az ismeretség esélye (M.A.G.U.S.)
Konverzió: M.A.G.U.S. - AD&D (M.A.G.U.S.)
Mutatványok (AD&D)
A halálcsillag (Star Wars)
EszelÅ‘s száguldás 2. (Star Wars)
Mítosz - az új kártyajáték
A Rúna I. évfolyam tartalomjegyzéke
Képregény - Boldogságban...
Armageddon kritika
Nephilim ismertetés
Lovecraft esszé - 3. rész
Észak lángjai
Levelezés
Kitekintés

Name: Shark Cards
Description:
From the back of the box:
Take a deep breath and dive into fascinating shark-themed card games like Shark's Tooth Rummy, Sink or Swim, and Wild Wobbegong. Want to know which sharks are nocturnal? Which can leap out of the water? Which is known as "white death"? This fact-filled deck turns the world of sharks into games for your brain.

User Summary:
Shark cards are similar to a standard set of playing cards except each of the 4 suits contains 12 cards (rather than 13). Each of the 12 cards contains a picture of a shark and a description.

There are also 12 Challenge Cards that ask players to look for Sharks with particular characteristics.

The game has rules for 5 different games:
Deep Dive (Similar to Go Fish)
Sink or Swim (Similar to Concentration)
Shark's Tooth Rummy (Similar to Gin Rummy)
Wild Wobbegong (Similar to Crazy Eights)
Food Chain (Similar to Solitaire)

Name: Woodson Pond
Description:
From the introduction:

This adventure brings the investigators to the American South to help debunk the claim that a tract of land is haunted. Unfortunately, the real estate agent who hires the investigators will vanish while showing a client the land in question.

The action is set in Florida in modern times. With some slight modifications it can be set in a different place and/or time. The adventure itself is fairly short and straightforward, but is still fairly dangerous.

Name: Heroes Weekly (Vol 3, Issue 22 - Absinthe)
Description:
From publisher blurb:

Absinthe

A new demon to bring home to mom.

Name: Goobles & Goblins
Description:
An RPG for Kids and Adults

Publisher's blurb:

Goobles & Goblins is a pen-and-paper role-playing game for parents to play with their children, or for any adult to play with the kids in their life.

Young players will take on the role of courageous heroes as they embark on fantastic quests in a fantasy world filled with danger (and just a bit of silliness). The adult running the game becomes the Storyteller, guiding the creation of the game world and populating it with strange creatures, legendary treasures, and all manner of challenges for the players.

Young heroes will need all of their Strength, Speed, and Smarts (as well as a healthy dose of imagination) in order to achieve their legendary destinies.

Name: The Exodus of Wolfbane
Description:
From publisher blurb:

A 64-page 0 to 2nd-Level Epic Adventure from Gaming Honors

Yesterday the village of Wolfbane was razed to the ground by a jealous king determined to find Shadowforde, the mysterious spellcaster who has aided the citizens for generations. Now you and a few dozen survivors are on the run, desperately trying to protect Shadowforde and reach his mythical homeland, Stonewater — your only hope of a safe haven.

The journey will take weeks, and the way is full of danger.

Shadowforde is weak and ill. The king’s men are hunting you. And you are searching for a legend.

The Exodus of Wolfbane is an epic 0- to 2nd-level adventure fully compatible with the Dungeon Crawl Classics roleplaying game. Your peasants will become hardened heroes as they battle strange monsters, harsh elements, and the king’s cruel soldiers. You will grapple with mysteries, hauntings, moral dilemmas, and death-defying chases.

And what will be waiting for you if you manage to reach Stonewater?

Take the journey and find out!

Name: Chibi-Robo! Zip Lash
Description:
"Chibi-Robo! Zip Lash, known in Japan as Nagenawa Akushon! Guruguru! Chibi-Robo! (ãªã’ãªã‚ã‚¢ã‚¯ã‚·ãƒ§ãƒ³ï¼ãã‚‹ãã‚‹ï¼ã¡ã³ãƒ­ãƒœï¼) is a Nintendo 3DS game released in Japan and North America in October 2015, and in Europe and Australia in November 2015. A Chibi-Robo amiibo was also produced to interact with the game."

Source: Wikipedia, "[en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chibi-Robo%21_%28series%29%23Chibi-Robo.21_Zip_Lash Chibi-Robo! (series)]", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

Name: Donning the Purple: Votes & Virtue expansion
Description:
Votes & Virtue is an expansion to Donning the purple and includes lots of new content that will create new headaches to the ruling emperor.


     A new role, called the General, with a unique player mat. If he becomes to popular among the legions they will proclaim him as the new emperor.
     A 4th player that starts the game as the General.
     A senate phase. Where all players uses their senators to vote over important things that affect the empire.
     An extra player mat for the heir with a unique action.
     Lots of new cards


—description from the publisher
Mechanics: ['Area Majority / Influence', 'Dice Rolling', 'Hand Management', 'Variable Player Powers', 'Voting', 'Worker Placement']

Name: Dust Tactics: Laser Sturmgrenadiere Squad – "Laser Grenadiers"
Description:
New expansion boxes for Dust Tactics will take your game to the next level! Featuring new tactical options for your Allied and Axis armies, these primed, unpainted miniatures will expand and enhance your existing forces.

The Axis’ Laser Grenadiers stand ready to reduce enemy armored units to piles of twisted metal. With their ability to hit from a distance with lasers that can cut through almost any type of armor, Laser Grenadiers can tear apart even the toughest foes.

These Grenadiers represent a brand new generation of Axis soldiers. Composed of veterans with invaluable experience, these units appear terrifying in their unique body armor. They are renowned for their advanced firearms training and solid engineering abilities, which make them an asset to any Axis army.

Bring these new troops to the battlefield and decide the fate of the world!

(Publisher's Website)

Name: A Quiver of Crows
Description:
A twin-stick shmup set in a grim world cursed by demons and ghouls.

Source: The Game Website.

Name: The Very Bad Game
Description:
The Very Bad Game is a board game based on the wacky characters and themes of the immensely popular Bad Book series by Andy Griffiths - one of Australia's most successful writers.

How to play:
"For ages 7 and up, the game is easy to play and always fun. Players race around Badtown trying to find the 4 missing pieces of their lost pet. But it's not easy! They have to get past the weird and wacky folk of Badtown - who will send them every which way around the board for all kinds of very bad reasons. And watch out - the whole town may even blow up! It's a lot of nonsense and riotous family fun!"

Three dice are used - The Bad Die, The Very Bad Die and The Highway Die (which is used to cross the highways).

The game is expected to be the must-have companion to the Bad Book Series and the perfect gift for the hundreds of thousands of Griffith's fans. Developed in partnership with Andy Griffiths, The Very Bad Game is a genuine extension to the books - including 200 hilarious Very Bad Cards.
 It is cetain to bring hours of family fun with excellent game play, laughter, the enjoyment of reading and a little strategy. It is also a visual treat! Just like the books, the game includes hundreds of illustrations and a stunning game board by Terry Denton that bring the world of Badtown to life as only Terry can.
(Source: Relatively Creative website)

Name: Wisdom from the Wastelands (Issue 51 - Sep 30, 2015)
Description:
From publisher blurb:

Issue #51: Mutated Animal/Plant Genotypes

When a player character wishes to play a mutated animal or plant, he has several choices to make. Animals alone represent a large category but can actually be mammal, reptile, amphibian, avian, or even  insect, and plants are no less diverse. Most animals have different types of advantages and disadvantages — some are very strong, while others are very agile, some can fly, some breathe water. Plant capabilities and drawbacks can be even more strange and profound.

What kind of animal do you want to play? How “human” do you want your animal character to be? Do you want to be able to use weapons and tools? Do you want to be able to talk? Walk like a human? This expanded issue of Wisdom from the Wastelands answers those questions and guides you through the process of playing a mutated animal or plant character!

Name: Great 1000 Miles Rally
Description:
User Summary

A driving game with a psuedo 3d view. Brilliant color and lots of background graphics help make this game more interesting. View vary from overhead and 3/4 angle.

Unlike many racing games of the time, this is hotseat instead of head to head.

Cars chosen are classics, roadsters and the like.

Name: J'apprends le calcul mental en jouant
Description:
An educational mathematical game for children and parents.

In this simple speed game, players are dealt cards with numbers. One after another, they reveal their current card: if colors match between 2 cards already placed face up on the table, the first player to say out loud the proper solution of the mathematical operation (addition, subtraction or multiplication) wins both cards. The last player to have cards remaining in their deck wins the game.

Name: Arcane - The Stone Circle: Episode 2
Description:
In the mid-1920's, three investigators track the strange actions of a secret society plotting the return to Earth of a powerful ancient occult extra-terrestrial entity. Will you dare to delve into the depths of darkness and forgotten realms where depraved humans perpetuate unspeakable pagan rites and worship mighty malevolent supernatural beings?

Source: Archived Developer Website.

Episode 2: Following her performance with the London Philharmonic, Ophelia retreats to her dressing room, troubled by psychic visions.

Source: Archived Publisher Website.

Name: Dark Side of the Moon
Description:
From the Back of the Box

"Prepare yourself for the most revolutionary adventure game ever created.

As the central figure in an epic science fiction story, you'll struggle to learn the ultimate secret behind your uncle's mysterious death. Your quest will take you to the depths of a dangerous mining colony on the far side of the galaxy. But be warned. Nothing is what it seems. And the stakes are much higher than you could ever dream.

Go beyond static screens, expressionless polygons, and randomly placed puzzles to the next generation of adventure gaming: Dark Side of the Moon - an experience so real and so suspenseful, you'll have to keep reminding yourself: It's only a game. It's only a game. Welcome to the Dark Side.

Dark Side of the Moon is a sci-fi adventure that will immerse you in 360° of completely seamless, incredibly realistic, motion-picture quality gaming."

Name: Speedy Gonzales
Description:
Takes Speedy Gonzales through 6 levels each with 3 zones and a boss fight.  Gameplay is reminiscent of older Sonic the Hedgehog titles.

- User Summary

Name: Rund um den Kalender
Description: A children's game (Ages 4 - 7) in which players move around the board collecting cards representing the cycle of nature (the seasons).  In the process they learn the days of the week and months of the year.  A dexterity element occurs when one player must drop the four-seasons card and another player must quickly catch it.

Name: Supply Train
Description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Perrenland Interactive Adventure

From the introduction:

You are to covertly ship out four crates of very valuable bless weapon vials (200 in all) back to the monastery.  They will be vital for the defense.

Name: NHL 14
Description:
NHL 14 is an ice hockey video game developed by EA Canada and published by EA Sports. It is the 23rd installment of the NHL series and was released on September 10, 2013 in North America, and September 13, 2013 in Europe as well as Australia and New Zealand.

NHL 14 has overhauls to two game engines, based on other sports titles developed by EA Canada. The collision physics are now powered by the same core technology behind the FIFA Player Impact Engine. For more realistic fights, the game employs the new Enforcer Engine based on the Fight Night series. In addition, the True Performance Skating engine got some more improvements, and the game has a new deking system. The game's Be a Pro career mode now has off-the-ice interactions to dictate the player's overall legacy. NHL 14 will also feature a modernized version of NHL '94, called NHL '94 Anniversary mode, featuring current rosters and updated graphics to commemorate the game's 20th anniversary.

Source: Wikipedia, "NHL 14", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

Name: Defenders of the Realm: Battlefields
Description:
Defenders of the Realm: Battlefields is set in the world of Richard Launius' Defenders of the Realm, but is a stand-alone, non-cooperative game in which players compete against one another either one-on-one, two-on-one, or two-on-two. One side represents the Dark Lord's invading army, while the other plays the heroes defending the realm.

Fourteen battlefield cards are included in the game, and three are laid out at random over which the sides will compete. Players take turns playing cards onto one of the battlefields in play in order to build up enough strength to claim that battlefield card. (Players hold seven cards with two players, five cards with four, and eight vs. four/four with three.)

Each battlefield card bears a special power that the winner of that card receives as a reward, such as "Remove all cards from one battlefield", "Choose the next battlefield to activate", and "Force the loser to give up one won battle".

The first team to claim any five battlefields or three battlefields of the same color wins, although rules are provided for shorter games.

Name: Bugged!
Description:
In Bugged! You can play one of the four main races that inhabit the galaxy in an attempt to wipe out any opposition. You could be anything from the mutant bugs with their limited intelligence but powerful weapons to the more resourceful but heavily outnumbered human marines.

It is a hex-based wargame that uses cards to add spice to what units can do. It is available free to print & play but the designer states that it has never been play tested and welcomes feedback.

Name: There Ain't Nobody Here But Us Chickens!
Description:
Author's blurb:

Chicken-like creatures seen near town of Huevo and an abandoned church. The church is a giant, chicken-shaped building. You can’t miss it.

Name: Dark Flow
Description:
Dark Flow takes place on a planet that is located in the confines of the universe. This planet is the door to the multiverse. Different factions have converged on this planet to fight to take control of its domain.

We are facing a competitive game, in which players must manage resources to win victory.

Gameplay
The game is divided into 5 Eras. Each Era consists of 3 phases:
MAINTENANCE, SETTING UP, and ACTIONS, being the ACTIONS phase where the main dynamics of the game are found. Starting with the initial player and following clockwise each player performs 1 action among the following:
Upgrade;
Extract Resources;
Recruit;
Move;
Attack;
Build.

Winning conditions
After finishing the 5th Age, players will check the game board to check majorities, constructions and to that they will add several points (unused power up tokens, constructions on the game board, monsters eliminated, final score cards,extra portal construction, recruitment of the faction leader, ...).

—description from the designer

Name: The Gobbling Box
Description:
Catalog Description

You want your GOBBLER to eat as many dots as possible, while trying to avoid the ZONKERS who won't stop chasing your GOBBLER until one of them eats it or until the GOBBLER eats all dots on the GameBox. The GOBBLER's reward is a new Box; there's 3 in all. The GOBBLER can tame the ZONKERS for a short while by eating one of the ENERGIZERS on the board. Then it's the GOBBLER's turn to chase, catch and eat the ZONKERS.

The game has two skill levels; the pace is fast; the sound is great; the action is continuous. You can't beat this bargain of a game. Even Stacey plays it!

This fast-paced action arcade-type game runs on the TRS-80 Model I, III, and 4/4P/4D. The game generates a variety of special sound effects and music which complement the action on the screen. The arrow keys or Alpha Products joystick control the movements of the GOBBLER in this game.

Name: Tom Clancy's The Division Underground
Description:
User Summary

Tom Clancy's The Division Underground is the first expansion with new areas and content.

Name: Eye of Pain
Description:
From the back cover:

Inside the woods near Burke's Crossing lurks a very real danger.  it began as a sense of unease, a feeling of being watched. But now people are disappearing. The lumberjacks who have stayed in the little village talk of ghosts and other superstitions. Or at least they did—until a mysterious statue appeared in a clearing near the logging camp.

As if matters weren't strange enough, two mages have arrived and begun hiring armed guards to escort them into these very same woods. Is there a connection, or is it just coincidence? Either way, be prepared! You never know what's out there waiting . . . and watching.

Eye of Pain is the first of three MONSTROUS ARCANA™ adventures featuring the cunning and deadly beholder. It can be played as an individual adventure or as part of the series which continues in Eye of Doom and concludes in Eye to Eye.

Name: Pyramid of the Sun: Promo Cards
Description:
Promo card pack delivered with Argentinian preorder of the game:
It includes 9 cards, of 2 types:

"What's Up" (6 cards)

When played together with another card with the same symbol, the player must choose between two options:
- Winning points according to the number of connected symbols (as with a common symbol card)
- Pick up 3 cards and then discard 3 cards (no matter how many equal symbols have been connected)

"Bureau de Juegos" (3 cards)

When played, the player must immediately choose one symbol. During this turn, this card counts as having that symbol.

At the beginning of the turn of the next player, this card's symbol loses its value, and stops giving any bonus when connecting with any symbol.

Name: Sir Bouncealot
Description:
Join the adventures of Sir Bouncealot, a jumpy knight with a giant sword. Ten levels of monster bashing awaits in your holy quest for a place in the highscore list.

Single player, highscore list.

Source: The Developer Website.

Name: War of the Races
Description:
War of the Races is a fast-paced card game that is fun, easy to learn and extremely strategic.

5 armies - Orcs, Humans, Elves, Dwarves and Demons - fight for supremacy in the ancient kingdom of Erathmor. Command your armies, send out troops, utilize heroes, sorcerers and more to eliminate opposing armies and leave your mark in history with the War of the Races.

Each race is sold as a separate deck of cards, each with unique abilities and advantages. Players send out infantry to attack opposing armies or the King, who start with 50 and 5 health, respectively. The infantry consist of soldiers, archers, rogues, guards and fighters. These cards can be enhanced with special spells. In addition, a guard can be used to prevent that card from being easily defended against. Next, players send out their sorcerers, who utilize water, earth and fire spells to attack the opposing armies. Other players must counter with other sorcerers, creating a simple but effective 'rock, paper, scissors' effect! Lastly, heroes are sent the field, each with unique abilities, such as healing the army, reflecting any opposing attack back to the dealer, calling for reinforcements and more. Strategy cards are also used to take opposing soldiers as enemies, revive your King, and more.

The last army to remain wins the War of the Races!

Name: Bulls 'N' Bears
Description:
Object of game - to accumulate money and stock.

Parts:
Money in $10, $50, $100, $500, $1,000, $5,000 and $10,000
Two wooden rectangle dice with Bulls and Bears on it
Stock Certificates for Autos, Bonds, Funds, Oils & Steels
"Chance" cards 
Playing Cards

Name: Abyss (Issue 25 - Jul 1983)
Description:
User Summary

Table of Contents

     Conjurings [Editorial] by David Nalle
     Illusion & Reality [Softening the role of mechanics at key story points] by David Nalle
     In the Speculum [Magazine and RPG reviews]
     Mission of Intemperance: Part 2 [Short Story] by Lew Bryson
     The Worlds of Thomas Burnett Swann [Looks at the fantasy books written by Thomas Burnett Swann] by John R. Davis
     Graphomancers [A new class: Calligraphers] by Joseph Teller
     Echoes From the Abyss [Letters to the Editor] by Various
     Berserkergang: The Death of Gaming [State of roleplaying...] by Jon Schuller
     Braving the Middle Passage [Boardgame review] by Eric Olson
     Convention Report [Eastcon and Origins report] by Eric Olson and Dave Nalle
     The Wicked-Weeds [Short story] by Ardath Mayhar

Name: Perfect Bowling Game
Description:
This bowling game comes with a bowling alley that measures 25” long by 6” wide.

It works by having a bowling figure that can be moved from side to side to aim your shot.  The ten pins are set in the location holes and when they are all in place you push the locater into the down position. This lifts the locater set up and gets the lane ready for a frame.  You then push your bowling figures' arm back to lock him in position and place your ball in the groove. When you are ready press the button to release the bowlers arm and bowl.

Afterwards the ball return dispenser will return the ball back to the bowler When the ball gets back to you, you press a button and the ball pops up ready to use again.

Game includes score sheets so you can keep score
The bowling alley measures 25” long and 6” wide
comes in a display box

Name: The Throne of Zeus
Description:
(User Summary)

Have you ever wanted to play a role in a Greek myth? You can in Deborah Lerme Goodman's debut gamebook, which takes the reader on a journey where myth and reality collide, with plenty of familiar characters making appearances.

This is the 40th title in the Choose Your Own Adventure series.

Name: Dilath's Hold
Description:
From publisher blurb:

The centre of the slave trade in the region, Dilath’s Hold is an aberration. Founded by a renegade drow nobleman, within its precincts drow and duergar live (relatively) peacefully. However, all is not well in Dilath’s Hold. Among its folk, racial tensions simmer, and the lust for wealth and power corrupt those already perverted by the flesh trade. For now, the ancient treaty binding the two races remains intact, but there are many living in Dilath’s Hold that dream of re-writing the compact…in blood.

Subterranean Enclaves are short, richly detailed supplements that each present a single subterranean settlement ready to insert into almost any home campaign. Perfect for use as a waystop on the road to adventure or as an adventure site themselves, Subterranean Enclaves present the details so the busy GM can focus on crafting exciting, compelling adventures.

Publisher's blurb:

The April 12, 2019 Friday Enhanced Map product contains a multi-layered PDF (allowing the options of white or black backgrounds, numbered or non-numbered areas, and secret doors on or off) and a zip file with all relevant map files as individual jpg images.

Name: Babar: The King of the Elephants
Description: Help Babar King of the elephants find his lost crown.  Spin the spinner and move your crown along the track.  Be careful, some people will help you on your journey and send you forward, others will hinder you and send you back or even make you lose a turn!  The winner is the first player to get their crown to the center of the spiraling board.

Name: Game of Uncle Sam's Mail
Description: Players move around the U.S. by horseback, stagecoach, steamboat, and railroad to deliver their randomly drawn pieces of mail. Each player takes one postman piece. The object of the game is to deliver 6 letters.  The letters are first sorted into piles according to postmarks. Players then take 1 letter from each pile so that 1 letter will have to be delivered to each section of the country. Players either start in New York or San Francisco. The object is to deliver the letters to the various cities to which they are addressed. The game claims to have the best and most practical general railroad map in use.

Name: Sucesos Argentinos
Description:
Description from the publisher (Translated):

Sucesos Argentinos (Argentinian Events) is a card game where Argentinian history knowledge is tested. Players must organize a chain of historical events chronologically ordered.

Each game can have from 2 to 6 players and lasts 15 to 20 minutes.

The game box contains 180 unique double-sided cards depicting notable events in Argentina's history. On the front of each card are the name by which the historical event is known and an image, and on the back a description of the event and the year in which it occurred.

Description from the publisher (Spanish):

Sucesos Argentinos es un juego de cartas donde se pone a prueba el conocimiento de historia argentina de los jugadores organizando una cadena de sucesos en orden cronológico.

Cada partida puede tener de 2 a 6 jugadores y tiene una duración de 15 a 20 minutos.

La caja del juego contiene 180 cartas únicas de doble cara que representan sucesos notables de la historia argentina. En el frente de cada carta encontramos el nombre por el cual se conoce al hecho histórico y una imagen orientativa, y al dorso una descripción del suceso y el año en que ocurrió.

Name: Star Wars: Imperial Assault – Jyn Odan Alternate Art
Description: This promo was given as a prize in the Seasonal Kit 2019 Season Three. This card can be used in place of the card supplied with the Imperial Assault base game.

Name: Barnyard Boogie Woogie
Description: Hilarious game of pantomime will keep players dancing and singing for hours! Roll the colored die, travel around the barnyard game board collecting farm animals along the way. In order to claim an animal card you must imitate the animal. Oink like a pig, Moo like a cow, waddle like a duck, lots of action for young kids and parents too.

Name: UrbanMayhem: Bits of Mayhem Downtown
Description:
Publisher Blurb:

Bits of Mayhem: Downtown

Matt Lyon does it again with another incredible expansion to the city of Mayhem. This time we go Downtown and add another booster shot to our extremely popular 'Bits of Mayhem' model set. Let the combat spill over into the business district of Mayhem with these amazing new "HollyWood Flats" style buildings. These models are built with speed in mind allowing you to quickly fill a table with buildings in no time flat! Extend the scope, scale and richness of your city layout with this much needed downtown building set. Mix and match elements to create incredible new buildings of varying size. Slap on a slew of new doors and signs to get those strategic entry points right where you need them!

'Bits of Mayhem: Downtown' includes all of the following:

* Beige Brick Flats (x1)
    * Office Block Flats (x2)
    * Stucco/Brick Flats (x2)
    * Skyscraper Flats (x4)
    * Piped Roof (3 format)
    * Universal Roof edgers
    * Add-on Doors
    * Add-on Business Signs
    * BONUS: Movement guide for 1.5" players

Name: Naufractus
Description:
From the Book:

A prequel to the Legacy of Arrius Lurco. The investigators are shipwrecked and must survive.

Name: Acceptable Losses
Description: From the introduction: Acceptable Losses is a freeform story game of family drama set in a dystopian near future, where people live in a self-sustaining building, large enough to hold hundreds of thousands of people. The social classes are represented by which floor you live on – the higher in the building you live, the higher your social class. Your social status can change depending on how hard you work; an “employee of the month” is announced at the end of each month, and is allowed to move up a floor, while a family that doesn’t fill their work quota is sent down a floor to be replaced.

Name: RPGPundit Presents (Issue 42)
Description:
From publisher blurb:

From the annals of the RPGPundit's (in)famous Last Sun gonzo fantasy campaign, this adventure scenario involves a quest for the ultimate spell: Advanced Magic Missile. This spell can be cast at the darkness in order to liberate the north from the evil domination of the Demon Prince Zozzsz. The PCs must negotiate Zozzsz's Orcish armies and his dreaded Wraith Princes to seek out the only remaining scroll of this mighty spell. Along the way, they'll also encounter the warrior-cultist Halconlords, Lenny the Cannibal, local rebellion against Zozzsz's rule, and a doomed community of Hipster Elves living in a ruined elven dome; all of which might be friends... or foes. Will your PCs be able to obtain the legendary spell or will the terrors of the demon-plagued north destroy them?

Name: Final Fantasy XI
Description:
From the introduction:

Ancient lore states that Vana'diel was created as a playground for the Gods, who themselves were spawned from an enormous andsentient Crystal. For eons, the Gods joyfully played until eventually falling into a deep slumber. It was during this slumber that the children of the Gods rose and flourished in Vana'diel, extracting gold from stones, traveling through the sky, building mighty cities, and giving birth to grasslands across the world.

Eventually, the children longed to join their parents, and constructed a pathway to the Divine Entrance of Paradise. Enraged by such an insolent act, the Holy Gatekeeper smote the children, and cast their cities to the bottom of the sea.

Shortly thereafter, the Goddess Altana awoke, and saw the ruin that had once been Vana'diel. Filled with an emotion that the likes of a God had never felt before, sadness, Altana wept five divine tears. When the five tears fell upon the earth, they gave life to the five races of Vana'diel.

Name: Against the Sky Pirates! (Supers!)
Description:
From publisher blurb:

So - let’s establish two facts:

    Jetpacks are wicked cool,
    jetpacks are far too underutilized given how wicked cool they are.


We're setting out to remedy that with this adventure - which features a group of jet-pack equipped Dieselpunk ruffians doing crimes and in dire need of smiting by the spandex-clad fist of justice.

Against the Sky Pirates! is a short scenario, designed to be played in an evening or two. Included are several pre-gen characters to get the action started quickly.

Name: Sea Intercept
Description:
“Card game for 2 players. Modern Naval Warfare Theme.”

The card deck contains four types of cards: Unit, Detect, Attack, and Counter. Units Cards are deployed as part of a player’s forces and remain in play until the end of the game unless destroyed. Detect Cards and Attack Cards are used to make attacks against enemy units. Counter Cards are used to counter attacks.

“The game ends when a player goes to draw a card, and there are no cards left in the deck. The player with the most deployed units at the end of the game wins.”

Name: Exploration: Recover Spaceship Pack
Description:
This expansion adds a new ship type for more strategies and increased replayability.

Components:

     4x Recover Miniatures
     4x Recover Cards
Mechanics: ['Area Majority / Influence', 'Deck, Bag, and Pool Building', 'Point to Point Movement', 'Take That']

Name: Sep 13, 2019
Description:
Publisher's blurb:

Map Theme: Sewers Under the City

Each Free Map Friday ZIP contains five 5100x3300 pixel (600 dpi) high-resolution versions of a single dungeon map. Those versions include:

1. Virtual Tabletop (VTT) Map
2. Player Map (With Grids)
3. Player Map (Without Grids)
4. GM Map
5. GM Map ~ B&W Lineart Version

Name: Dynasty
Description: A card and board game based on trump taking. The cards are comprised of six suits. When the game begins all suits are of equal value. The player who lays out the highest number takes the hand and then moves their pawn one space forward on the game board. Every fifth or so space is marked "Dynasty" and a player landing on this space may select one of the trump tokens to place at the lowest possible space on the "trump track", in the center of the board. As the suits are added to the track, the order in which suits may trump each other follows. For instance, the first placed (and therefore lowest on the track) suit is jesters. Jesters can trump all cards. The next placed suit (set above jesters on the track) is kings.  Jesters will still trump all cards but kings, kings trump all cards. If a player lands on a "dynasty" spot and all six suits have been set, they may swap two suits. Game ends when one player has traversed the entire board.

Name: The Full Moon Ransom
Description:
From publisher blurb:

For 4-8 Adventurers of 2nd to 4th Level

Each month as the sun sets on Deren, the villagers hold their lottery to select a new messenger for the Hand. That night, under the full moon, the unlucky lottery winner takes the ransom payment to the graveyard, hoping that the tribute will be enough. In previous months, the bag of baubles was sufficient; recently, the Hand is unsatisfied with the measly payment. Messengers and villagers disappear when payment fails to please the ghastly appendage. The Magistrate is tired of the ransom, and losing family members and friends. It is time to end the monthly tribute! Can the adventurers help?  Can they stop the Full Moon Ransom?

An adventure designed to play in a single session!

For Swords & Wizardry or 5E.

Name: Star Trigon
Description:
Star Trigon is a series of video games developed by Namco. Star Trigon puts the player in the role of a spaceperson spinning around a planet, having to rescue the stranded aliens in time before his air supply runs out. Games in this series have been released for iPod, Windows, and iPhone in addition to the arcade versions.

Source: Wikipedia, "Star Trigon", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

Name: Specahouse
Description:
The beginning contractor student will learn to equate particular design structures with appropriate construction materials, while becoming acquainted with amenities that can appreciate the value of homes. Players will be able to build a house to spec on time by completing the house first.

Each player begins to assemble the necessary elements for construction and to collect attribute/obstacle cards to increase property values by retrieving 1 card from the pickup or discard pile. Players scores for completed houses.
The player with the most points wins.

Components:
109 cards
The deck is composed of 7 house element cards with 58 variations, 21 thematic design cards, and 30 attribute/obstacle cards.

Name: Dystopian Legions
Description:
From the company website:

DYSTOPIAN LEGIONS is a fast-paced, action-packed 28mm scale tabletop game set in the exciting world of Dystopian Wars, where Victorian super science fiction has created a fascinating and brutal arena for a deadly world war. The game is scalable from a small number of models right the way up to a full blown company of men with armoured support. A modular approach to army building guarantees the game embraces further new releases and game expansions.
Mechanics: ['Dice Rolling', 'Point to Point Movement', 'Simultaneous Action Selection', 'Variable Player Powers']

Name: Picture Posers
Description:
Party Game. Each guest is given a card. The card is split into 3 different competitions.

1st: Place Names. A montage of 24 illustrations is given. Players must pair them off into pairs that represent the name of a town. Thus, 12 towns in all.
2nd: Words. Similar to the first competition but this time representing 'dictionary' words.
3rd: Silhouettes. There are nine pictures in silhouette and they must be identified.

Up to 12 can play. The host must set a time-limit and when "Time" is called, the guest with the most correct answers wins (and a good host or hostess should have a small gift as the winner's trophy).

Name: Baseball Riot
Description:
User Summary

Help Gabe Carpaccio take vengeance on the unholy alliance of his former team.

Name: Wizards Mutants Lazer Pistols (Issue 1 - Apr 2012)
Description: THE fanzine of old school weirdness.

Name: Vietnam Battles: Snoopy's Nose & Iron Triangle
Description:
For some time, there had been reports that a large area of dense jungle northwest of Saigon was a staging base for the Viet Cong. Ideally situated near Cambodia, a nexus point of the Ho Chi Minh Trail, and proximal to the capital city of Saigon itself, the area that became known as the “Iron Triangle” allowed the Viet Cong to conduct well-organized and well-supplied operations into the very heart of South Vietnam. In the meantime, a hundred miles to the south, a US riverine force, comprised primarily of the newly-arrived 9th Infantry Division, began to penetrate into the hinterland of the Mekong Delta, and even into the overgrown rivulets where only ‘Charlie’ had ever operated before.

In the first in the Vietnam Battles series, two games are included, Iron Triangle and Snoopy’s Nose (named after a distinctive curve in one of the distributaries leading to the Mekong River). Both games utilize the very popular Fire & Movement combat system, and is easy to play.
Units in the game are typically companies and some battalions and occasional brigade equivalents. The full spectrum of the war in Vietnam in 1967 is featured with everything from riverine craft to helicopters. Each hex represents about a half mile, and each game turn represents from about a half a day to several days of operations.
 The game includes one map (22x34”) and 200 counters.

(from the editor's website)

Published with Modern War #7, Sep-Oct 2013

Name: Tomb Raiders Campsite
Description:
User summary:

The maps in this set are "poster-print quality" maps, thematically related, for use with virtual tabletop systems.

The maps in the set also have been gathered and published in The Big Book of Maps for Tabletop Roleplaying Games Volume 1: Fantasy Adventure.

Name: Summon Night: Twin Age
Description:
User Summary

A top down hack and slash RPG that uses only touchpen controls. The two heroes are Aldo and Riiha and the game follows their separate stories as they try to discover why the spirits of nature are behaving strangely.

Name: Connect 4x4
Description: CONNECT 4x4 enhances the classic four-in-a-row game with more competition and strategy in the first-ever four player edition. A clear double-decker checker grid replaces the standard grid, allowing players to win by playing four-in-a-row in a horizontal, vertical or diagonal line on either side of the grid or by weaving through one side of the grid to the other. Look closely to find ways to connect the ringed checkers that may be unseen by your opponents. Or, act defensively and play the new block checker to prevent an opponent from scoring what might be a winning move.

Name: Psychics
Description:
From publisher blurb:

Psychic Enemies and Allies!

Occult Character Codex: Psychics contains 20 detailed psychic stat blocks for the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game, featuring every specialty from esoteric students of dream, tranqulity, and faith to masters of psychic sciences ranging from lore to psychedelia, and of course the dangerous delvers into the darkest corners of the mind that draw their power from pain, mutation, and abomination! You'll find psychic humans, halflings, elves, and dwarves, but also stranger races like nagaji, ratfolk samsarans, and sylphs, running the gamut from good to evil and all points in between. With the Occult Character Codex, you'll have an entire arsenal of psychic characters waiting and ready to blow your players' minds!

The Occult Character Codex series brings you a fantastic collection of detailed, ready-to-use stat blocks for psychic characters using the new classes in the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game Occult Adventures rulebook. These characters can be used by GMs as allies or villains, friends or rivals, helpful characters or mysterious strangers, or any other use the GM can think of. Every installment includes 20 fully developed premade characters from 1st to 20th level, drawn from many races and specialties within each class and designed with a full array of spells, magic items, feats, psychic abilities, and detailed tactics for ease of use. If you'd love to introduce elements of the new psychic and occult rules into your campaign but feel a bit overwhelmed by the sheer volume of new material to absorb, this is the book for you. Each Occult Character Codex is an ideal complement to the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game NPC Codex from Paizo, Inc.

Name: Zombie Fortress 1945
Description:
This game was published in the Japanese magazine "RPGamer" for autumn 2003 Volume 3

Your mission is to capture Dr Devil and destroy his castle.

You control the USA, Japan, Britain or German team

2 maps; outside and inside the castle (A3)

130 counters

No English rules only Japanese and French !!!

Name: Captain and the Kids
Description:
Listed in American Games, #4542.  1947, Comics, Board game.

Submit a better description and contact Admin Skelebone for a GeekGold reward.

Name: WooHiiWooHaha
Description: The goal of this game is to build a pyramid of monkeys. There are three types of monkeys and all three types come in three colors. Per turn you can only build your pyramid in one color. When building the other players only see the back of each monkey, so they don't know the constitution of other players' pyramids. The only way to find out is to attack! And attacking is also necessary to keep other players from finishing their pyramids. Finishing your pyramid is a true feat of bananalympics.

Name: Mombie
Description:
A simple maze game with an evil twist!

Source: The Game Website.

Name: Iron Kingdoms Full Metal Fantasy Game Master Toolkit
Description:
From the Privateer Press website:

Equip yourself with the Game Master Toolkit, loaded to enhance your Game Master experience in the Iron Kingdoms Full Metal Fantasy Roleplaying Game! This toolkit includes a four-panel Game Master screen made from high quality hardcover stock. It is big enough to conceal the Core Rules book as well as adventure notes and secret dice rolls, yet it remains ideally sized to allow unobstructed access to the player area beyond. Featuring full-color art on the player side and frequently used tables and charts on the Game Master side, this screen is perfect for keeping your head in the game and out of the rulebook.

The set of ten reusable dry erase initiative cards easily tracks the order of initiative for player characters and NPCs alike, while ten dry erase life spiral cards make it simple to track damage and healing.

Also included is a pad of 25 full-color encounter sheets designed to help build your encounters and track their outcomes and a pad of 25 full-color character sheets for your full-fledged NPCs as well as your players!

Contains:

1 Game Master screen
10 initiative cards
10 life spiral cards
1 encounter sheet pad (25 sheets)
1 character sheet pad (25 sheets)

Name: G.E.V.
Description:
Microgame #8 in the Metagaming Microgames series, the original release of G.E.V.  A follow-up to Ogre.  Units from Ogre are carried over, with expanded rules for terrain.  A larger map and more ambitious game.

Second base game of the Game: Ogre / G.E.V..

Note: Ogre and G.E.V. were later reissued separately and then repackaged together as Ogre / G.E.V. by Steve Jackson Games. The Steve Jackson GEV edition has a different countermix to the original editions.
Mechanics: ['Dice Rolling', 'Grid Movement', 'Hexagon Grid', 'Movement Points', 'Ratio / Combat Results Table', 'Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game', 'Simulation', 'Variable Set-up']

Name: QUERP Bestiary
Description:
From the publisher:

This Bestiary is the first supplement for QUERP - The game of Quick Easy Role Playing - this tome contains nearly 100 monsters and enemies that vicious and devious Gamesmasters can use to distract and attack their players. Ranging from low power to extremely dangerous, the QUERP Bestiary provides monsters for every occasion, every environment and every group of characters.

Name: Five Tribes: The Thieves of Naqala
Description:
Naqala is now a prosperous place. Gaining the favors of the different tribes was not easy, and your rivals have not been discouraged by your success. In fact, some tribes have now abandoned your cause and rallied to your rivals instead, and you'll soon discover that these tribes follow influential leaders that your rivals hired against you. Every man has his price, though, so perhaps you can return the favor to your rivals — should you have what it takes to recruit the thieves of Naqala.

Five Tribes: The Thieves of Naqala is a mini-expansion of six thief cards and one new djinn for Five Tribes that introduces a new element to the base game to create a real thorn in your opponents' sides. The djinn is shuffled into the deck with the other djinns and protects you from the effects of thieves. One thief card is revealed at random at the start of the game, and whenever someone would buy a djinn, they can purchase the thief card for the same price as the djinn. Each thief is associated with one of the tribes, and whenever you take an action with that tribe, you can choose to activate and discard the thief. If you do, everyone else must get rid of something — two resource cards, one tile they control, even a djinn or palace — after which you get to choose to keep something from all the discarded things.

Name: Wild Cat Platoon
Description:
Wild cats! This will be the start of the military exercises, which are divided into first and second platoons. Your goal is to suppress the three columns in which the enemy can attack, and you can conquer a column by having more cats than the enemy.

In ãƒŽãƒ©ãƒã‚³å°éšŠ (Wild Cat Platoon), each player has a set of twelve cards, with those cards being numbered 1-3 twice in two colors. Starting with four cards in hand, players engage in a placement phase, then an operations phase.

Name: Random Traps & Obstacles
Description:
From publisher blurb:

Watch your step! Our Random Traps & Obstacles deck is filled with 52 cards to challenge players in your adventures. This Cardography deck is packed with twists and turns to keep any party on their toes.

Name: Duke it out in D.C.
Description:
From the back of the box:

The President of the U.S. has been kidnapped - It's up to Duke to set him free!

Aliens have captured the President!  Duke gets word that alien scum have landed in Washington D.C., laid it to waste, and imprisoned the leader of the free world.  Always up for a heroic deed, Duke heads to D.C. to rid the city of enemy dirtbags and return the president to power!

Features:


     9 of the hugest, most incredible Duke levels ever!  There's a 10th "Top Secret" level that we can't tell you about here.  (clue: Duke goes back in time to an ancient world)



     Duke It Out In D.C. guide - which gives you a mission briefing and level storyline



     Award Winning Levels Creator - levels created by winner of TEN's best Duke Nukem 3D levels


Duke travels through the White House, Lincoln Memorial, FBI, Smithsonian, the Naval Institute, Capitol Building, Control Center, Subway System, D.C. Sewage, the Naval Weapons Plant, and much more!!!

Name: Outcast
Description:
From publisher blurb:

It’s been five hundred years since the aliens came and almost as long since they took the Earth away from us.

Now we live in the cracks and crannies of the galaxy with ten thousand other outcast species, scraping up everything we need to live day to day: water, food, even air.

At least we have The Network. The Imperial Races may own all the garden spots, but ninety-nine out of a hundred places it connects are too cold, too hot, too arid or just too all-around awful to interest them. That’s the stage we play on now. Maybe one day we’ll get our own back, but right now our business is survival.

Outcast is an OSR SF RPG using the free Cepheus Engine core rules or other similar game systems. Play as humans or one of five alien races, using any one of fifteen adventure seeds and eleven worlds as a starting point--or use the included rules to create your own.

Name: Play Ball Multiplication
Description: Introduce children to the great American pastime...BASEBALL while they practice multiplication problems with factors of 3,4,6,7,8, and 9. Multiplication problems determine base hits, singles, triples, home runs, and more. Example: 3X7 = 21 which denotes a single. 4X9 = 36 or a "triple". 2 players or teams may play. Grades 4-8

Name: Battering Ram
Description:
From the Introduction:

Battering rams are among the most ancient engines of siege warfare. They are used to crack open walls or it those are too massive, as is the case here, the more vulnerable wooden gates of fortresses. The battering ram in this case is a massive wooden log, its head sheathed in iron, suspended from a sturdy wooden frame by iron chains. The frame is covered by a canopy of wooden boards to provide the personnel operating it with cover against arrow or spear volleys fired from the gatehouse or the walls above it. To ease its deployment to the gate the ram is equipped with no less than four axles with massive iron bound wheels.

Still the success of the ram is anything but given. It is uncertain if it will be even able to reach the gate equally reinforced with steel bands. It could still be set on fire by the defenders. Even if the defenders don't manage to set the ram itself on fire they could still try to torch the bridge the ram has to cross to reach the gate. If the contraption finally reaches the gate it could still be smashed by heavy boulders dropped from the battlement. And the gate itself is not only reinforced by steel bands but held closed by two massive crossbeams each one easily as massive as the ram itself.

Name: Tide of Iron
Description:
Tide of Iron was released by Fantasy Flight Games in 2007. 
Tide of Iron: Next Wave was released under license by 1A Games in 2014.

Even though Tide of Iron: Next Wave is essentially a second edition of Tide of Iron, things are a bit confusing here on BGG since the two games have separate Board Game Links.

For more information about the newer 2014 version of Tide of Iron: Next Wave, you can Click Here.


Tide of Iron is a game of World War II tactical conflict for two to four players. The components in this base game allow players to simulate the dramatic struggle that took place between American and German forces in Northern Europe during the years 1944 and 1945.

Tide of Iron is a scenario-based game, with the available forces, objectives, map, and victory conditions being set by each given scenario. It features loads of plastic figures, including soldiers, equipment, heavy weapons, and combat vehicles, cards, dice, cardboard markers, and modular game boards that will represent the customizable terrain of this scenario-based wargame.

The twelve double-sided map tiles, plus the dozens of included terrain hexes, allow for limitless potential combinations, and each scenario can be enhanced by special rules, objective markers, troop allotments, and other variations. The only limiting factor is your imagination!
Mechanics: ['Action Points', 'Dice Rolling', 'Hand Management', 'Hexagon Grid', 'Modular Board', 'Team-Based Game']

Name: Variant (Volume 4, Issue 2 - Jun 1985)
Description:
Publisher blurb:

Variant is a quarterly publication of Reilly Associates.

Name: Warhammer 40,000: Heroes of Black Reach – Tournament Maps
Description:
In France you can participate in Heroes of Black Reach tournaments, semi regularly organised by Devil Pig Games.

Devil Pig Games made some cool tournament terrain mats for participants to battle on. You're allowed get them printed for personal use. The result would be great on vinyl or mousepad material.

Name: Book of Records, Vol. I: Knights
Description:
From the back cover:

Your own personal, magical scribe

Let's face it – record-keeping is at the bottom of the RPG Fun List, just above fumbling a roll to resist poison. But it doesn't have to be that way. Enter the Book of Records, Vol. I.

This digital download bundle includes a set of two-page record sheets for knight characters in the King Arthur Pendragon roleplaying game. The easy-to-use PDF files are like the character sheets of yore – only imbued with the binary magic of the 21st century, where auto-filling and auto-calculating form fields abound.

The sheets are compatible with the standard warrior-cultures from the Book of Knights & Ladies and are suitable for use in all phases of The Great Pendragon Campaign. Presented in gorgeous full-color, printer-friendly black-and-white versions of the sheets are included as well.

These remarkable sheets allow both players and Gamemasters to spend less time crunching numbers and more time cracking ribs – as it should be.


From publisher's description:

This first Book of Records features a two-page autofilling character record for a knight character in King Arthur Pendragon. This PDF record works for all Phases of the Pendragon Campaign, though a separate sheet suitable for Late Phase knights is included. Both record sheets are also offered in printer-friendly black-and-white versions. The PDF product automatically completes a variety of calculations based on your character choices, including all the options introduced in the Book of Knights & Ladies. The sheet tracks Fealty and Homage, the new Loyalty Passions introduced in the Book of the Estate, though that supplement is not required for play.

Additional features:


     Choose from 13 different cultural backgrounds, from Aquitanian (Arian Christian) to Saxon (Germanic Pagan), though Cymric (British Christian) is the default selection.
     Your cultural selection automatically indicates the Personality Traits associated with your knight’s Religious Bonus and autofills the starting values for all Personality Traits.
     Armor Type, Horses, and a number of fields associated with your knight’s family, including Family Characteristic, feature pull-down menus of the all the available options. The campaign year that a specific horse becomes available is noted as well!
     All of the Derived Statistics (e.g. Damage and Healing Rate) are automatically calculated and filled based on your Primary Statistics (e.g. Strength).
     The Glory Total noted on the front page automatically updates based on Glory gains and losses you note on back page.
     Most fields can be overwritten by the player to allow for house rules and character maintenance over time.


King Arthur Pendragon is a streamlined game system, but knights undergo constant change and growth. The record sheets included here allow your characters to remain current and dramatically simplifies the creation of new knights — PC’s and NPC’s alike! Future volumes of the Book of Records are planned, including auto-calculating records for Estates and Honours, Continental characters and Ladies.


User comment about the PDF:

PDF contains 14-page booklet plus four 2-page character sheets (early-phase and late-phase, each in greyscale and colour) for a total of 22 pp.

Title is generally given as Book of Records, Vol. 1: Knights, but title page spells out "Volume" in full and uses Roman numeral.

Name: HackJournal Annual Volume 1
Description:
From the Back Cover:
Welcome to the first HackJournal Annual! HackJournal Annual collects material previously published in quarterly issues of HackJournal. HackJournal is the official publication of the HackMaster Player’s Association.

For those of you who missed the first four issues of HackJoural, this book provides you with a great opportunity to expand your Hackverse! The HackJournal Annual is packed with over 40 articles essential for both players and GMs! While written for HackMaster 4th Edition, most of the ideas and material are easily adaptable to any RPG system.

Name: Yankee Trader
Description:
Players start from San Francisco on an around the world trading trip. By buying and selling wisely at various ports around the world players may make a profitable voyage.

Players start with 10,000 in cash which is used to invest in various goods that are available at different ports along the way.

First player to get to New York gets a bonus payoff for being the fastest finisher.

Whoever makes the most money on the trip wins the game

Name: Net Worth II
Description: According to Sid Sacksons - A Gamut of Games : Investments are made in savings, oil, cattle, real estate, or stock of three different performance levels. Players buy, sell and collect only their own side of the board. A special backward move can be very lucrative.

Name: Pac-Man World 2
Description:
[From the game box]:

The Ghost Gang strikes again!

They have picked the Magical Golden Fruit from an ancient tree and unleashed the most wicked entity Pac-land has ever seen.  It's time for Pac-man to take control and return what was taken.  With brand new skills, a zany cast of enemies and friends, and a vast world to explore, his heroics will be pushed to the limits.  Step aside 'cause Pac-man is coming through, and he's on a mission!

Name: Blender Bros.
Description:
User Summary by zefquaavius

Blender Bros. is a side-scrolling platform game, in which you play the role of Blender, leader of the Cosmo Keepers.  Blender has enormous, prehensile ears that he can use for all sorts of purposes, including attacking, climbing, performing high-reaching ear-spring jumps, and — amazingly enough — hearing: He can listen for Mini Bros.  This is where the "Bros." part of the title comes in:  As you start each level, you get to select any one of the (up to twenty) Mini Bros. you have gained so far in the game as your helper for the level.  Each Mini Bro. conveys a different benefit, be it extending the reach of your attacks, healing, or something else entirely.

The game has kart-style racing vignettes between some of the normal level.

Name: Lost Tales of Cthulhu: Dunwich
Description:
This is a Cthulhu version of Lost Legacy; while the game designer is different they officially licensed the Lost Legacy Rules.

A simple game where you play one card each turn, you'll try to save the world from destruction by ancient horrors in just ten minutes.

The setting is based on HP Lovecraft's the Dunwich Horror, set after the events of the story.

—user summary

Name: Star Wars Galactic Heroes Game
Description:
A children's game (Ages 5 and up) using a small, simple board, a card deck for each figure, dice, and the "Galactic Heroes" toys as playing pieces. In the game each player selects a character and, on his turn, rolls the die and moves on the board. Board spaces tell the players what to do (draw a new card or fight).

The combat system involves each player secretly selecting a card and then comparing the two; the player with the highest value card wins the fight.

The "hit point" system uses two-sided tiles (six for each character) that are placed to show the character healthy. As fights are lost, tiles are flipped to the "damaged" side. Once all six of a character's tiles are flipped over that character is knocked out of the game.

Available in three different versions.

Anakin vs. Dooku
Obi Wan vs. General Grievous
Clone Trooper vs. Super Battle Droid

Each set can be played alone or sets can be combined for larger games.

Name: The Truce 2D10
Description:
From the publisher's blurb:

For the new 2D10 RPG, the Truce is a free fantasy adventure centered in a frontier village called Jegyr's Creek. Heroes arrive in the town to discover conflict between local centaurs and settlers and have the opportunity to confront a growing evil in the nearby woods. The adventure includes a good mix of both battle and problem solving.

Best of all, it's one page. And free.

The Truce is the first part in a trilogy of adventures which can be inserted into a fantasy setting of choice or used to form the backdrop of a larger story. Look for those additional adventures soon.

Background Notes: This adventure was actually written many years ago, rediscoverd in a backup archive, and edited for use with 2D10. You can easily use it with another game system of choice. Enjoy!

Name: Polyhedron (Issue 68 - Vol. 12, No. 2)
Description:
Cover art: Artist Clyde Caldwell portrays the diabolic pirate Zhen Mirat and his captive, Cyra. (from the contents page)

This issue featured Hero by Don Bingle and Jay Tummelson - Can a song turn a group of adventurers into heroes capable of saving a kingdom?
'Conventions' was on the inside front mailing cover, the overland map for 'Hero' was on the inside back mailing cover, and a 'POLYHEDRON Newszine General Announcement' submission form was on the outside back mailing cover.

Name: Dobbers: Quest for the Key
Description:
Dobbers: Quest for the Key is a whimsical, family friendly board game for 2-4 players. It is a deck building, encounter building, strategy board game.

Create surprise encounters for your opponent while building your deck and equipping your hero.


     The mechanics are simple enough for most children to enjoy, while having strategies that are complex enough that even the most seasoned gamer will feel engaged. 
     It usually takes an hour or less to play. It will take longer while you learn card details and how they may effect your strategy.
     It has a high fantasy theme, with comic-book style, bold illustrations.
     The objective is to move your hero along your chosen path to the final space on the board, represented by “the Key”. The first player to reach the key with their hero wins!


There are two strategies essential to winning the game:
First, placing challenging encounters on the board, preventing other players and their heroes from being able to advance along their chosen path.  Second, equipping your hero and building up your personal deck so that you can more easily overcome any encounters that have been placed along your path. Player will have to do both well if they expect to reach the key first and win the game!

—description from the publisher
Mechanics: ['Action Points', 'Deck, Bag, and Pool Building', 'Secret Unit Deployment']

Name: The Game of Data Processing
Description:
The Game of Data Processing (An Application Approach) consists of advancing discs around a logic flow diagram (the board) and gather points with the goal of becoming a Data Processing Manager before your opponents.

Along the way, player can move into different subroutines, pick up "Stimuli" cards, and branch out at decision points within the program.

Players gain points in Intelligence, Motivation, and External Influence to spend toward promotions and eventually the game winning management goal.

Name: Supers20
Description:
Publisher blurb:

Take your Modern20 campaign where it's never been with Supers20!

This major expansion of the Modern20 rules adds a completely new power system to Modern20, allowing you to design characters from any universe, any genre, any era of comics action.

Supers20 is designed, like the Modern20 rules it builds on to speed up character creation for players and the game master alike. This supers system has no power points, with powers being entirely feat based, allowing characters to be generated in a fraction of the time they would require in other systems.

The book also features a rich selection of campaign models, along with generic NPCs who have just enough unspent feats and skills unspent for the game master to customize a fully featured supervillain in minutes. Your players will never guess you're using an NPC created on the fly and if they do, they'll be having too much fun to care.

Whether your brand of comics adventuring is the disturbed loner meting out justice as he sees fit on the streets, or the last scion of a doomed world fighting cosmic threats in the deeps of space, Supers20 has what you need!

Name: Monophobia: A Fear of Solitude
Description:
From the publisher:

Almost a decade in development, Monophobia is a collection of Call of Cthulhu adventures for lone Investigators (and a willing Keeper). Written by Mark Chiddicks and Marcus Bone, two veteran Call of Cthulhu Keepers, it includes fantastic cover art by Ashley Jones (the artist responsible for the most compelling Tatters of the King).

Name: Grandmaster Chess (1992)
Description:
From back of the cover
The World's Most Powerful Chess Program!

Grandmaster Chess takes you to a new level of experience. Refined in over twelce years of championship competition, this phenomenally powerful program will change your mind and your senses...

Incridble Graphics & Sound
The world's first chess program with Super VGA grahics (shown), plus digitalized voice and music for all popular sound devices.

Multiple Perspectives
Choose 3-D or 2-D views with 180 degree board rotation or try blindfold play.

Multiple Skill Levels
From beginner to grandmaster, each of the four levels includes numberous time control options for indinite variations of play.

Easy Interface & Pull-down Menus. Works with keyboard or mouse, Prints out games and boards. (VGA screen shown)

Help and Analysis
Grandmaster can give you hints as needed - or use it to analyze every move.

Opening Moves Library
Hundreds of classical starting positions.

Replay/Review Options
VCR-type controls allow you to instantly review recent moves or an entire game.

Chess Play Ratings
Grandmaster will monitor your progress and determain your chess rating.

Multiple Chess Sets
traditional, fantasy or medieval chess pieces with an array of different boards. (Super VGA screen shown)

Teaching Mode
This ever-patient mentor teaches basic moves, strategies and the complexities of the game.

Challenging Chess Play
Designed to help you master the intricacies of chess. (Super VGA screen shown)

Name: Tinkle Bavard #6
Description:
La gravité
Robert Silverberg
Les rêves d'Arlequin
Le tinkle revêche
Isaline
Kalys
La recette de l'hydromel
Atlas cryptogamique
Du métal dans l'espace
Le donjon de l'oncle Mac Donald
Concerto thanataire
L'Alliance des damnés
Heavy Fire
L'étui marjanovien

Name: Unlabeled: The Blind Beer Tasting Game
Description:
The game is simple! Each player brings one or two beers to the game, keeping their identities hidden. Unlabeled is played one round at a time. Each round, a small portion of “unlabeled” beer is served. Players taste the beer and ATTEMPT TO IDENTIFY THE BEER’S CHARACTERISTICS, GENERAL BEER CATEGORY, OR SPECIFIC BEER TYPE. The label is revealed and points are awarded. Next round!

Points are awarded based on your accuracy to identify the “unlabeled” beer… Earn 1 point for identifying a simple beer characteristic (ALE OR LAGER?). Earn 2 points for identifying the beer’s general category (PORTER OR STOUT?). Earn 3 points for identifying the specific beer type (OATMEAL STOUT OR IRISH STOUT?). Earn maximum points for identifying the EXACT NAME AND BREWERY. Careful! Push your luck too far and you could score zero!

Name: 1001 Places
Description:
Publisher's blurb:

Some cave somewhere isn't nearly as evocative as the Caverns of Despair, near the Forest of Madness, between the Glacier of Creeping Bone and the Gulf of Desolation.

That's where 1001 Perilous Places makes your game more exciting and your work as a GM easier. Here you have a thousand and one names for dungeons and other adventure locations, ready to use in an instant or to inspire you to create elements for your game world. Each gives a name and a location, so you can use the complete description and location, pick one or the other element out of it for your needs, or mix and match.

Name: The Compendium of Wild Beasts II
Description:
From publisher blurb:

An Add-on of Animal Adversaries and Associates

Add all new beasts to your game of 5th edition. The Compendium of Wild Beasts II is a 25 beast expansion to The Compendium of Wild Beasts. It also includes an all new magic item "Torban's Bag of Many Tricks."

New Beasts include:

Cheetah, Dire Bear, Rabid Raccons, Llama's and More!

Name: Tales of Hearts R - Idol Costumes
Description: A DLC costume theme turning your cast into idol popstars!

Name: Wolfenstein
Description:
"Wolfenstein is a story driven first-person shooter. The story is told through cutscenes, scripted events, telegraph messages, and intelligence that the player finds scattered throughout the game. The game involves the main character, B.J. Blazkowicz, going to a fictional German town called Isenstadt, which serves as "hub" for the player throughout the game. Isenstadt is where the player can get missions from two different groups, or upgrade their weapons and powers at the Black Market.

There are a total of nine weapons, six real-life ones (grenades, the MP40, the Kar98k, the MP43, the Panzerschreck, and the Flammenwerfer) and three fictional ones (the Particle Cannon, the Tesla Gun, and the Leichenfaust 44). Mounted MG42s can be found throughout the game, and each one can be used by the player.

Aside from the weapons, the player also finds a medallion called the "Thule Medallion". With it, the player can get many abilities. The abilities are Veil Sight (the ability to see secrets, and, once upgraded, through walls), Mire (the ability to slow down time), Shield (the ability to throw up a shield that blocks, and, once upgraded, bounces back bullets), and Empower (the ability to significantly increase the damage of the player's weapons).

Every time the player activates the Medallion, the player enters a dimension called the "Veil", which is a barrier between this dimension and the fictional "Black Sun" dimension, the power source the Nazis want to master. Inside the Veil, the player can see floating creatures called "geists". Geists can be destroyed, and destroying them releases an energy burst which can kill or stun nearby enemies. Geists are usually passive, but if the player kills one, others can become angry and attack the player in a suicidal explosion.

Various items can be collected throughout the game: Gold, Intelligence, and Tomes of Power. Gold is used as currency to buy various upgrades from the Black Market. Intelligence provides some background information about the story, and is used to unlock some of the upgrades for weapons. Tomes of Power are used to upgrade the Veil Powers."

Source: Wikipedia, "Wolfenstein_(2009_video_game)," available under the CC-BY-SA License.

Name: Freedom: The Underground Railroad – Insert Here Insert
Description:
This insert holds sleeved cards and has a removable tray that holds the cubes and money tokens. The removable tray was created to help speed up game set-up and tear-down.

- Description from publisher web site

Name: Incredible Victory
Description: A hidden movement (double-blind) game on the Battle of Midway, June, 1942. Two-hour game turns, 40 mile hexes, individual ship counters (except destroyers and transports), and air counters represent squadrons of 3-8 planes. Contents include 300 die-cut counters, 2 strategic movement maps, 8 Task Force Display cards, 5 reference cards, hit record pad and rules. Sister game "Scratch One Flat Top!" produced by 3W.
Mechanics: ['Dice Rolling', 'Hexagon Grid', 'Hidden Movement', 'Secret Unit Deployment', 'Simulation', 'Simultaneous Action Selection']

Name: G.I. Joe Commando Attack
Description:
Note that this game is significantly different than the 2002 G.I. Joe Commando Attack game.  This game features a very different map, different rules, and no missile launcher.

Both the G.I. Joe and Cobra teams consist of two squads of six soldiers each.  Depending on the number of players, each player controls one or two squads.  The object is to enter the enemy headquarters.

Each turn begins with a roll for initiative.  The team winning initiative rolls one die per squad.  The result tells how many soldiers in that squad may be moved that turn.  Each soldier may be moved any number of spaces in a single direction, stopping if they land on a jungle, river, or enemy square.  Up to two soldiers may enter the same enemy square.  Combat is resolved by dice rolls.  Ganging up with two soldiers allows an extra die roll (choose the higher number) and two chances to win the battle (only one of your soldiers may be captured at a time).  There are also rules for freeing captured allies and raiding the enemy supply depot.  The first team to successfully infiltrate the enemy headquarters wins.

Name: Veilia
Description:
https://www.facebook.com/veiliagame/

Veilia is an exploration adventure game, which focuses on the story of Veilia, a cursed girl who has been separated from her body. It is now your job to help her in her search for her old body as well as the sorcerer that took it from her.

Name: Brutal: Sample Characters
Description:
User summary:

Document consists of sixteen sample characters.  Each character is presented on a single character sheet with stats, description, portrait (illustration), equipment, and notes.  Most characters are somewhat humorous.

Available as a downloadable PDF document, the characters were generated with an XLS spreadsheet.

Name: Aspect Core Rulebook
Description:
from the publisher website

Pick up Aspect and start making your own legends.
