Strange happenings are becoming more and more common. The street-side prophets are starting to sound a bit reasonable. The corporations smell power and have started pouring a lot of money into investigating and documenting these occurrences—that’s where you come in.

A Darkening Alley introduces the new Antiquarian playbook, a Trauma system by DYMPHNA, and several magical abilities available to players through basic advances. Because players do not start with magical abilities, you can easily merge this setting with an ongoing campaign.

Name: Death Vegas
Description:
User Summary

A man being questioned by the police reveals what happened in the storyline via flashbacks. Piece together the story as the narrative reveals itself from multiple perspectives in the cutscenes. The gameplay portion of the game features a fighting game with puzzle elements. This is a dark and gritty game.

Name: Slap It!
Description:
A portal to another dimension has opened, and monsters are pouring out. What do you do when you encounter a monster? Slap it!

In Slap It!, players race to be the first to slap the correct monster, but that's not always as easy as it seems. With new monsters coming out of the portal, and the dice changing the rules, you need to stay on your toes and be lightning fast — and if you see a monster coming, slap it!

The player with the dice rolls them within view of all players. The dice will refer to one of the face-up cards on the table. The first person to slap the correct card takes it, and a new card is turned face-up from the deck to replace it. The dice are then passed to the next player in clockwise order, and the same process is repeated.

When only two monster cards remain on the table, the game ends. Players count up the monster cards that they have taken, and the player with the most cards wins. In the event of a tie, the tied player with the single highest monster card wins.

—description from publisher

Name: No Honor Among Thieves
Description:
No Honor Among Thieves is a competitive/cooperative game for three to six players, in which each player assembles a crew of thieves and sets out to see who can steal the most from the rich and powerful of the kingdom.

Each player is the head of their own crew, which consists of different character cards recruited from an array of thieves available for hire. These characters are then sent on heists to try and overcome defense cards in front of objectives, using their different sets of skills to bypass guards, traps and walls to get to the filthy lucre that they're after. Players not involved in the heist will, of course, try and stop the thieves in their tracks by playing Scheme cards, which represent the quirks of fate which might cause a heist to fail--unexpectedly alert guards, City Watch patrols, or the simple mistake that leads to disaster.

Staging a heist alone is difficult, but working together with other players leaves you open to betrayal by your so-called allies, or gives you the chance to betray them, and take it all for yourself. Once any player has been betrayed, the game changes, and more dangerous abilities on different cards can now be played. The Assassin begins killing other characters, the Pickpocket starts stealing from players, the Fall Guy takes the blame, and the whole table becomes a little more vicious. Thieves like to believe they have a code of honor, but once that illusion is broken, there is no going back.

What will you risk to be the richest and cleverest thief in this city of rogues?
Mechanics: ['Action Points', 'Deck, Bag, and Pool Building', 'Dice Rolling', 'Hand Management', 'Modular Board', 'Open Drafting', 'Take That', 'Team-Based Game']

Name: Jakten på Prins Adam
Description:
From Introduction:

Du kommer tids nog att hitta på egna sagor som ni kan spela. För att ni snabbt
ska komma igång hittar du här en väldigt enkel saga ni kan börja med.


Translation courtesy of Google:

You will find enough time on your own stories that you can play. To you fast
to get started here you will find a very simple saga you can start with.

Name: Listening Lotto: Outside Sounds
Description:
In this educational children's game, players match noises occurring outdoors (cricket; lawnmower) to images depictions those items. To play, players listen to the sounds on the CD and place tokens on the images on their game cards that match what they hear.  Players win by matching the most images correctly.

Each game set includes 12 game cards with 8 photos per card, 120 game tokens, an audio CD, and directions in English.

Name: Warhammer 40,000: Kill Team – Rogue Trader: Elucidian Starstriders Dice
Description: This set contains 6 6-sided dice and 2 10-sided dice – the former used during games of Kill Team, the latter used to roll on certain tables when assembling your squad ready for combat. Themed to match the Elucidian Starstriders, these dice are grey with gold markings. The D6 feature the personal crest of noted Rogue Trader Elucia Vhane in place of the 6 and a Kill Team logo in place of the 1; the D10 feature a skull in place of the 1.

Name: Helt Texas
Description:
(Translated from the box, in Norwegian)

"How to become a good poker player?"

Play "Helt Texas"! 
In the first round on the board - the Trivia round - you win chips by answering correctly to questions in three categories: General knowledge, Sport and entertainment and Poker.

After having won enough chips the game progresses into the Bluffing round. Now it's time to test the Pokerface! You challenge your opponents by stating yes/no questions on written statements about yourself.

The first player to qualify to the Finals in Poker, brings the players with oneself, and you play Texas Hold 'em.

2007 Nominert til Ã…rets Selskapsspill - Nominated for Party Game of the Year, Norway

Name: Stop-Over Wiesbaden
Description:
This game consists of two sub-games. In the first game players take the role of journalists and try to get to the sat-van as quick as possible in order to upload the three pictures they have to capture in this game. The pictures are all Wiesbaden-buildings or sites and have a UFO sighting on them.

This is a Malefiz kind of adaptation.

In the second part the game, journalists try to get the cover-story before the other players can by running up the stairs of the publisher trying to beat the others to his office.

Name: The Nautica System: Adventure in the Sky
Description:
User summary:

Characters in this rules-light game have four Core Abilities (Attributes): Drive, Agility, Brawn, and Mind.  These have a Score ranging from 1-3, assigned from a points pool at creation.  Characters also may select up to three Aspects (Traits) which are narrative tags or descriptions.

Difficult or opposed actions use a unique system for resolution.  An eight-point "compass card" is used, and the game master selects a point (which varies with each use).  The player then attempts to guess the point.  The player may select one point for each Score in their relative Core Ability.  Action difficulty yields a "spread" of points from which the guessed number may vary from the selected number and still yield success.

The setting is not well developed but in general has a action/adventure/swashbuckling feel to it.  The setting would not be usable in a campaign without significant development.

Name: Raptor Class Gunship
Description:
From Introduction:

The Raptor Class design was created in response to a military request for a new gunship. Growing threats along the borders of several systems necessitated that this new design enter production as quickly as possible, bypassing the usual research and development (R&D) phase usually associated with new ships. Several ship builders were invited to submit designs for this new contract, titled XG-203. In the end, the Lockdyne corporation received the production contract as none of the other participants could meet the tight production and IOC (Initial Operational Capability) for the first squadron of ships. Lockdyne had been able to meet this timetable by utilizing an off-the shelf approach to many of the ship’s systems and basing the design on the commercially successful C-477 cargo ship. The original contract called for a vessel that would incorporate the new Bruning PPC-4 Plasma Pulse Cannon in addition to the usual compliment of energy weapons and missile batteries. Lockdyne engineers realized that the new ship would essentially be ‘built around’ this new weapon due to its massive size. By making modifications to the existing C-477 design they were able to meet the IOC requirement and bring the project in under budget. Changes to the C-477 design included moving the cockpit right of center to make room for the PPC-4 cannon and related equipment and the addition of “wings” to accommodate the experimental dual Speer XM33 burst guns which were ordered into production for this contract. The XM33 design had not finished its testing when production was ordered, and the design still had one major flaw to overcome. The weapon delivered the expected energy output, but the gun itself emitted a short surge or radiation each time it was fired. To overcome this the decision was made to mount the guns at the ends of two “wings” that would give the necessary distance to protect the crew from any hazards associated with the guns use. The engineers saw an opportunity with these new structures and proceeded to incorporate a new Lockdyne design for magnetic shield emitters into the wing structures. This new design proved highly effective and may be utilized in future Lockdyne ships. The first ship served as the sole prototype/test craft, and after just a month of trial runs full production proceeded on schedule. The production vessel was designated the G-203. While some minor improvements have been introduced throughout the production, no sub-designator has been issued for the design. An advanced version is rumored to be in development by the Lockdyne Corporation.

Name: The Black Spire
Description:
From publisher blurb:

The Village of Greenhelm seems to be cursed. Earthquakes have devastated the area. Vicious raiders have began terrorizing the village. And now this strange giant black spike has risen from underground in the middle of a farm. The villages think these raiders are coming from this black spire. Heroes are needed to stop this threat.

This is an OSRIC adventure for characters of 5th to 7th level.

Name: Casting Traditions
Description:
From publisher blurb:

Spheres Apocrypha: Casting Traditions gives you new drawbacks and sphere-specific drawbacks to help you create new and intriguing casting traditions for your characters. Do you require magic runes, or perhaps you must pre-charged your spells? Perhaps you can even lend your casting to your allies temporarily? These and more options become available with Spheres Apocrypha: Casting Traditions

Name: Mega Raider
Description:
From the promotional blurb:

"Wealth and power beyond your wildest dreams are yours...by building a fortune in companies and cash. Outwit and out bluff other players when you secretly bid to takeover their companies. Top secret information and late-breaking news add to the excitement."

Contents:
board, 2 dice, 6 player tokens, spinner, bid forms, play money, rules, stock cards, and event cards.

Name: Final Hour of a Storied Age
Description:
From the website: The end of an age draws nigh, an age of magic and wonder, a storied age when legends walked the land and great deeds were done. That was all long ago, when lives were larger, before things were settled. Now, if there is any greatness left, it is great evil, evil that will change the world for the worse. In the last hour of that age, a new story begins. Will it be the story of a hero, rising up to save what is good and true about the old age to shepherd it into the new, or will it be a sad lament for things long gone to usher in a new age of darkness? It is now the final hour of a storied age, and telling the story falls to you.

Storied Age is a no-prep GM-less storytelling game that, over a few sessions of play, creates an epic fantasy story in the vein of The Lord of the Rings, The Wheel of Time, or The Sword of Truth. The game weaves together the creative contributions of each individual player in a structured plot arc and then helps you play through a chapter-by-chapter account of how your characters face adversity, similar to the way an author starts with an outline and fleshes it out into a full novel. By breaking up the creative responsibility and providing creative constraints to guide players’ contributions, Final Hour of a Storied Age lets everyone experience an epic fantasy story without asking anyone to shoulder an epic creative burden.

Name: Perilous Passages
Description:
From the publisher:

Perilous Passages offers up five tiles that a game master can use to design deadly hallway and encounter areas. Switch out the details and rearrange them in any number of configurations to get the most out of them. Even a single tile can be changed enough to be used right beside an alternate version of itself without repetition.

Name: Regular Show Fluxx
Description:
Like Fluxx, Regular Show Fluxx is a card game in which the cards themselves determine the current rules of the game. By playing cards, you change numerous aspects of the game: how to draw cards, how to play cards, and even how to win.

At the start of the game, each player holds three cards and on a turn a player draws one card, then plays one card. By playing cards, you can put new rules into play that change numerous aspects of the game: how many cards to draw or play, how many cards you can hold in hand or keep on the table in front of you, and (most importantly) how to win the game.

Regular Show Fluxx features characters and situations from the Regular Show animated series on Cartoon Network.

Name: RuneCast
Description:
The Gods have chosen you and your companions to take part in pivotal battles that will decide the fate of Midgard and Asgard. Use your heroic power to turn the tide of the battle against Loki and his minions. Loki will be working to ensure that you and the Gods fail.

The Gods have decided to bless you with the ability to return to life if you die in battle, but only so many times will you be resurrected by the Gods before you become an Agent of Loki, targeting your former companions until you destroy them or the Gods resurrect you! Fate is revealed in the Runes and can help you prepare for the next battle, or it can punish you for your previous failures.

Rune Cast is a cooperative dice & card game where players attempt to score enough wounds to defeat various scenarios. Players have hands that will allow them to use armor and weapons throughout the duration of the game, and may contain powerful Fate cards.
Mechanics: ['Campaign / Battle Card Driven', 'Cooperative Game', 'Dice Rolling', 'Hand Management']

Name: Punch-Out!! (2009)
Description:
[Game Case]

Use motion or classic controls to slug your way through some of the most outlandish boxers every to win the championship belt. But beware - defeated opponents are looking for a rematch!

Name: Stars Over Landria (Second Edition)
Description:
From publisher blurb:

The aging space station Stars over Landria has inexplicably begun to fall toward Mars. Its crew has stopped reporting, its equipment has stopped functioning, and its computer has gone silent. The research taking place on the S.O.L. represents a considerable investment of both time and resources, and in about 8 hours it's all going to go up in smoke with no clue as to why. Someone needs to get in there, collect the software, protect the project, and put together some answers before the entire endeavor is wasted.

Oh, and rescue the crew, if there are any left.

Stars over Landria is a corp-neutral contract for 3-4 introductory characters, ideal for one 3 hour time slot with new HC SVNT DRACONES 2.0 players. Included in this contract are a  coherent narrative, maps of the environment, new rewards for player completion.

Name: Shuffle Penny Plus
Description: Each player shuffles five pennies from the base line. Each penny scores the highest scoring ring it touches. Total score doubles if penny goes into the center hole. Maximum score is 250.

Name: The Art of Vampire: The Masquerade
Description:
From the Back Cover:

From the Long Night

The Kindred: predators and monsters to the last. A race of biblically cursed parasites, these vampires hide among humanity, eking out a Damned existence under the eyes of God and the noses of mortals. Each night, the Kindred steal forth to take the sustenance they need for their continued survival - human blood.

...To the Final Nights

The Art of Vampire: The Masquerade compiles the most noteworthy illustrations from the critically acclaimed storytelling game. Spanning eight years and more than 60 books, the Vampire game features artwork by top industry illustrators and talented up-and-comers alike. From the early look of the game, back 800 years into the Dark Ages, and returning once again to the modern nights, this book is a beautiful chronicle of the evolution of the vampire.

The Art of Vampire: The Masquerade includes:


     Early and hard-to-find work from the visual artists who defined the look, and the up-to-date illustration from the revised edition and beyond
     Art by Tim Bradstreet, John Van Fleet, Bill Sienkiewicz, John Bolton, Vince Locke, Guy Davis, Kent Williams and a host of others
     A fiction introduction by Sandman creator Neil Gaiman

Name: So Sue Me!
Description: So Sue Me! is the game where you sue your friends, take their stuff and enjoy the wackiness of today's lawsuits.  In So Sue Me! players acquire businesses in order to get income.  But just like real life, any business you own also means you are taking a risk of being sued.  Spin the spinner, and if you land on your own business you collect money.  But if I land on your business, I am likely to SUE YOU!  Five decks of lawsuit cards tell me why I might want to sue, and suggest different amounts for lawsuits.  The backs of the cards, which are unseen by other players show the odds of winning suits at different levels.  So only I know the odds of winning my suit against you.  But look out!  You may have an Unfair Advantage card, which acts as an odds modifier.  Only you know what your UA card says, so we will have to bluff our way to a settlement, or go to trial...
Mechanics: ['Betting and Bluffing', 'Dice Rolling', 'Roll / Spin and Move']

Name: Fix or Repair Daily
Description:
From Sid Sackson's A Gamut of Games:

Gas stations and repair shops are bought in order to collect fees from opponents. Trading to get more of the same type of business ups the price. Landing on an opponent causes an expensive accident. Last to go broke wins.

Name: Android: Netrunner – Alternate Art Seidr Laboratories: Destiny Defined / Skorpios Defense Systems: Persuasive Power
Description: This is a promo card contained in Terminal Directive Event Kit.

Name: Saving Private Sheep
Description:
From the Bulkypix Website

The War of the Sheep

General call-up (speech given by General Sheepard through the microphone of the B.B.Sheep)

The war between wolves and sheep is raging.

The wolves' territory is expanding from one day to the next, encroaching on our green pastures.

We must fight these bloody baaarbarians if we want to graze again in peace!

We will show the enemy that we are not lambs and that we will not be led to the slaughter in silence.

It is time to launch operation "Iron Wool"!

Help the woollen warrior conquer enemy territory by leading it into the secure zone.

To do this, you will need just one weapon: your finger!

Destroy the obstacles in the surrounding area to enable the sheep to achieve its objective in total safety.

Increasingly complex structures and special blocks (indestructible, explosive etc.) coming in a variety of shapes and with different actions will make your mission harder.

Saving Private Sheep offers accessible gameplay for any player, thanks to the progressive difficulty which is perfectly paced over more than 80 levels.

Combine logic, dexterity and strategy to achieve victory!

Will you manage to unlock the bonus levels, win the medals and achieve ultimate success in the game?

Name: Pantomime
Description:
Draw cards. Act out scenes. Gain points.

From the publisher:

THE GAME IN A NUTSHELL - You choose one of eight categories. Draw a card from one of three levels of difficulty. Act out the scene written on the card, while the others try to guess the scene. Then, take turns playing until you're ready to stop. While all the time you HAVE FUN!

ADDITIONAL INFORMATION:
This is our answer to... well, actually, there's no game quite like it! It couldn't be easier to learn and, with 1,000 scenes, is so much fun we couldn't get our test players to stop playing. PANTOMIME™ is contagiously entertaining. It is imaginative and clever - FUN for the whole family, the bigger the better. Wild and crazy, with 8 different categories and 3 different levels of play, it builds personal confidence and increases sensitivity to others. 
Just a pile of FUN for everyone!

It's used in schools, hospitals and anywhere kids and families want to have FUN! The categories include: Science and Nature, Sports, Emotions, Life skills, Professions, Entertainment, Oops and Oh Goody cards. All but the last two have three levels of difficulty and are played by acting them out, without sign language (like Charades) or props, or sound effects. It's pure non-verbal communication from the actor, and nonstop guessing and laughter from the rest of the players.

Name: Millennium Blades: "Game of the Millennium" Upgrade Pack
Description:
From the publisher 

It's no secret that Millennium Blades is the best game we've made in the past thousand years! Now you can celebrate this momentous occasion with the Game of the Millennium Upgrade Pack!

The Game of the Millennium Edition provides an alternate box cover art for the game, in the form of a box wrap (which can be easily removed). It also comes with 12 Alternate Art Character Cards, featuring the 12 gamers from the base game, Set Rotation, and the Card Fusion Promo Pack!

Name: Colorful Ottokar
Description: Each player tries to be the first to thread his disks onto Ottokar the Octopus. The one who does this most quickly wins.

Name: Twisted Lands: Origin
Description:
Experience the birth of the terror that gripped the island of Tormente in Twisted Lands: Origin! This captivating prequel will lure you in with stunning artwork and bone-chilling audio, and then hold you captive as you explore dozens of bloodcurdling locations, search for useful items and solve cleverly designed puzzles! Every story has a beginning, but few are as horrifying as this!

Source: The Publisher Website.

Name: Trivial Pursuit: 1996 Edition (German)
Description: This edition of the TRIVIAL PURSUIT Year in Review Series contains questions about the highlights of the year 1996.

Name: Backpacker
Description:
The game is about traveling around to different cities in the world and answer questions about the locations. In order to get the money needed for traveling, the player have to take different jobs.

There can be several different goals in the game. Either that travel around the world in the shortest time, to visit as many cities as possible or to get certificates in as many jobs as possible.

Backpacker was released in 1995 on one CD-ROM. The game was developed by Stefan Gadnell and Jens Thorsen.

Source: Wikipedia, "Backpacker (series)", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

Name: Lure of the Temptress
Description:
"Lure of the Temptress is a fantasy point-and-click adventure game created by Revolution Software, published by Virgin Interactive Entertainment, and initially released in 1992 for Atari ST, DOS and Amiga systems. This was the first game developed by Revolution Software and was the debut for their own in-house developed Virtual Theatre game engine, which Revolution used in the subsequent games Beneath a Steel Sky and the Broken Sword series.

In Lure of the Temptress, the player takes on the role of a young peasant named Diermot. He was most recently employed as a beater for the king's hunting party. One night, the king receives a note from a messenger, requesting the king's services to help stamp out a rebellion in the remote village of Turnvale. As the king's men depart on their horses to ride to the rescue, Diermot’s pony follows them, and he is unwittingly dragged along to the battle. When the party arrives at Turnvale, they are confronted not by an ordinary peasant revolt, but rather by a band of fierce, inhuman mercenaries - the man-eating Skorl, led by a young and beautiful enchantress named Selena, the titular temptress. The king's men are defeated in the battle and the king is killed. In the process, Diermot is flung from his mount and winds up on the ground unconscious. The Skorl take Diermot prisoner and toss him into the local dungeon, where the player starts the game, and Diermot begins his quest to rid Turnvale of Selena's evil tyranny."

Source: Wikipedia, "Lure_of_the_Temptress," available under the CC-BY-SA License.

Name: ZIN
Description:
This game is played on a 7x7 square board.The board shows several "win-fields", each depicting two symbols (male and female).

The players take turns drawing a tile from his own stack of tiles. They then place the tile on the board. The tile shows one of three symbols: male, female and mountain. The tile must be played next to a win-field, in such a way that the symbols match (a mountain can be played next to a side that shows both male and female, or neither).

When a win-field is completely surrounded, it is scored. Both players count the tiles they have next to the win-field (tiles are worth one or two points). The player who has the most points scores as many points as his opponents has present.

The game ends when all tiles have been played. At that point, some extra points are distributed and the total score is determined. The player with the most points wins.

Name: Magical School
Description:
Magical school: Sorcerers' apprentices begin their training.

In this game, you play the role of sorcerers' apprentices. By rolling the dice (which eyes are "white magic", "black magic", "knowledge", or "fumble" etc.), you may pass difference magic classes like "Magic Familiar" or "Astrology" which are worth points. The first player to reach a number of points is the winner.

The basic game is simple and fast. With the advanced rules, the classes you pass give you additional magic powers. For example, if you have passed the class "Chanting", it allows you to use an additional die; "Alchemy" allows you to change one die result. By using these powers, the apprentices will finally be able to learn high level magic like "Homunculus".

Contents:
31 subject cards
1 turn player's card
5 blank dice 
1 sheet of dice-seals (with 30 seals)

Name: Ruinations: Post-Apocalyptic Roleplaying
Description:
From Introduction:

Ruinations is a post-apocalyptic roleplaying game based on the framework and tradition of old school gaming. While many modern games focus on grandiose story telling with imperishable player characters, Ruinations predominantly focuses on two key elements: ruin-running and survival.

Where warriors, wizards and thieves delved into dungeons and catacombs to face certain death in the hunt for fortune, knowledge and glory, characters in this post-apocalypse venture into crumbled cities, underground bunkers, and sprawling silos to discover valuable goods, information and artifacts.

Unlike many post-apocalyptic games, Ruinations is not focused on a setting littered with super-science, plasma rifles and ‘gonzo’ creatures, but rather a grittier near-future as
depicted in media such as The Road Warrior, The Last of Us, and Wasteland. While mutations and highly advanced technology may exist, they are not the norm and should not be treated as such. And though raiders, feral creatures and irradiated men are common enemies in the wastes, the true horrors hiding among the ruins should be singular and unique: that is not an aberration, it is the aberration.

Resource management is vital. Sleep and rest are necessary. Every shot matters and some battles are best avoided. At the end of the day, chances are good someone in your party will not make it back alive.

Name: So you wanna be a Superhero...
Description:
So you wanna be a Superhero… is an adventure game where you get to play an aspiring hero attempting to save the world. From the moment your hero steps out of his home, he will be righting wrongs by investigating suspicious activity, arresting bad guys and otherwise protecting the good citizens of Big City.
 It won’t be easy, as a matter of fact, the bad guys are as tough or tougher than your hero, especially in the beginning. And although he’ll likely not win every encounter, he will learn from his mistakes and grow stronger and stronger.  Eventually, he’ll be powerful enough to rid the city of all 7 supervillain bosses and save the world, well, at least he’ll save Big City.

So you wanna be a Superhero… features 61 supervillains, 4 Hero characters and their respective markers, a rule book, 4 six-sided dice and a map of Big City. Encounters and missions are assigned by die-rolling and chart lookup. It is incredibly unlikely that two games would ever be the same. The combat system features ‘exploding’ sixes allowing super-powered possibilities. There is experienced-based character building, nosey reporters, dedicated sidekicks, worshiping fans, and useful gadgets.

So you wanna be a Superhero? Do you have what it takes? There are crimes to investigate and criminals to round up. There are supervillains running amuck and you are the only hope for justice and protection.

Let’s see what you got, Hero!

User Summary

Name: Aerineya City Ruins
Description:
From publisher blurb:

The Realm of Aerineya was not always so lofty. Elevated to such heights following a great cataclysm, the place is seldom visited, except by those that are able, and willing, to risk such dangers. These ruins are typical of many across the region, representing the remains of the various cities destroyed by the event.

A printable battlemap compatible with any RPG/Dungeon-Crawl game. Use as a standalone gameboard, or combine with any same-scale tileset.

Contents: A 30 x 30 map depicting the overgrown ruins of a city, high on a set of floating shattered islands. Perfect for visiting if you have an airship, or can fly. Otherwise, not so perfect..

Name: We Saw Spain Die
Description:
WE SAW SPAIN DIE is a solitary game simulating military operations during the Spanish Civil War (July 18 1936 - April 1 1939)

The board covers the historical space of this conflict. 
The goal of the game is to reduce the Republican morale and increase the Nationalists morale.
To get those victory/morale points, areas must be captured, provinces and main towns that are military objectives.

As a player you are in charge of the Nationalist group and try to topple the Republican government elected in 1936.
In a context of European division between democracies and dictatorships, you get support from Nazi Germany , Fascist Italy and the authoritarian Portuguese regime. 
The player gets to pick different combat strategies to achieve his goal - Mass attack, Safe progress, Armoured attack, coordinated maneuvers or a non-combat reinforcements action.

1 turn = 3 months
12 turns total

Game published in French

Name: SoulCalibur Legends
Description:
From the game box:

SoulCalibur Legends, a 3rd person action adventure, exclusively for the Wii console follows the exploits of Siegfried and other SoulCalibur favorites. Fight in a new adventure set between the events of Soul Blade and the original SoulCalibur game.

Name: Guildlings
Description: Guildlings is a fantasy adventure. in a world of wizards and wifi.

Name: Hunted: Mining Colony 415
Description:
You were on your way back to earth after a year-long mission when a distress beacon abruptly roused you from hypersleep. The message was mostly static, but it was obvious that something terrible was happening at Mining Colony 415.

Once you and your crew landed and started looking around, unidentified lifeforms started wreaking havoc. During the chaos, everyone got split up and you don’t know if anyone is alive or dead. Even Sprinkles, the ship’s cat, is missing.

You just heard over the colony’s announcement system that the self-destruct protocol has been activated, so you’ll have to race back to Landing Pad 7 to get aboard your ship and get out of there before everything explodes… and you’ll have to do it while being hunted by the aliens.

Hunted: Mining Colony 415 is a fast-paced solo game that constantly presents you with tense choices. All the cards are multi-use forcing you to make quick decisions about which ones to discard and which ones to activate. You'll have to balance running, fighting, and hiding if you want to get off the planet alive.

This game in the Hunted series uses a dexterity mechanic to resolve events and combat.

—description from the designer

Name: G.M. Magazine (Issue 6 - Feb 1989)
Description:
User Summary:

Table of Contents...

     News by Paul Boughton, Tim Metcalfe, & Wayne
     Raven Fantasy Armoury by Paul Boughton
     GM Survey
     Reviews - Gangers, Renegade Legion - Centurion and Interceptor, Ellery Queen, Family Wars, BattleTech Books, The Five Shires, Toon, MERPs Guide Books by Tim Metcalfe, Wayne, & Johnny Razor
     GM's Convention Corner by uncredited
     Adventure Corner by The Shambler
     PBM Update by Wayne
     The Paint Shop Special by uncredited
     Zine Scene by Wayne
     GM's Free Poster
     Findings -- "Anvil of Ice" short story by Michael Scott Rohan
     MERPS Competition by uncredited
     Books by Alan Crump
     Where to buy GM by uncredited
     Comics by uncredited
     How to be a better PBMer by Pete Thornhill
     The Immortals - GM's GURPS Scenario by Chris Elliott and Richard Edwards
     Next Month by uncredited
     MUGs by Qadile
     The Roleplaying Club by Piers Massey
     The Axeman Commeth [Letters]
     Dave Langford's Critical Hits

Name: Redux: Dark Matters
Description:
User Summary:

Redux: Dark Matters is a remake of the game DUX. The game is a sideway scrolling shoot'em up. There is six stages in the game, and the aim is to destroy the bosses at the end of every stage. You can play the game at normal och veteran difficulty, each with different ship to control. You begin the game with three lives and can upgrade the ship during the game.

Name: XBOX Music Mixer
Description:
The Official servers were shut down in 2010.
Some features related to the transfer of media between Xbox and PC is still available, provided a copy (no longer produced) can be found.

Transfer your music and pictures directly from a PC to your Xbox. Create a custom soundtrack to go with a photo slideshow which you can view on your television.

Name: Infernal
Description:
From publisher blurb:

Welcome to Eldruden Earth. God is dead and so are his Angels. Demons and Devils maraud the haunted landscape, where humans hang from the skies, Hell has fused with nearly ninety percent of the Earth, and the oceans, seas, rivers and lakes have turned to blood.

Humanity is threatened with extinction. Hell Storms frequent the remaining cities. Butcher men prowl the streets in packs, preying on innocents. Serial Killers are initiated into demonic cults where their deadly art is refined and skills honed.

This Demon Tome features a variety of Dark Angels that inhabit the Metaverse. Within are all the rules necessary for a Hell Master to include Dark Angels in their "Godchild RPG" Nightmare.

Name: Starry Wisdom (Volume 1, Issue 1 - Winter 1997)
Description:
Contents:

Words of Wisdom by Dustin Wright
Why Chaosium Is by Greg Stafford
Pick a Card by Shannon Appel
Dreamlands two page spread by uncredited
MYTHOS FAQ by uncredited
View From Zenith by Rob Heinsoo

Name: A Madman's Guide To Happiness
Description:
User Summary

The game is a single-player horror/mystery game that puts you in the role of a detective that’s the first to respond to the scene of a suicide. You then begin to examine the man’s computer files which promise you the key to happiness.

Name: When Darkness Comes: The Most Dangerous Game
Description:
You are a spy, a superspy if you will, working for a large world organization to sequester the political and not so political entanglements that threaten the calm and quiet existence of a world on the brink of disaster.

This game will take you on wild chases through the small streets of Europe as you run for your life or pursue your enemy. Failure is not an option, and sometimes it takes the assistance of others and a little luck to complete your mission. But trust no one, and proceed carefully.

The set contains a rulebook, scenario book, 8 tiles and 48 disks. You will find new rules for vehicles, chases, disguises and traps.

This is an expansion for When Darkness Comes. (But, the first scenario can be played without the core set.)

Name: The Glyph Stealth Mod
Description:
Publisher's blurb:

The stealth rules are all very simple and is based around the Awareness Scale, which serves to turn whatever compound (be it a castle, a bank, a star ship) into an entity against which you are competing with to remain hidden. The Awareness Scale represents the compound's mood and allow the GM to have the NPCs inside the compound react accordingly to what you, the player, is doing.

As to what the player is doing, they'll be trying to raise hell as quietly as possible, while their actions (both narrative and through Skill Checks) will raise their Awareness Level along the Scale, while time and the use of the Sigils meta-currency hope to bring it back down.

If you've ever wanted to try your luck and skills at sneaking through an entire area, skulking around where you shouldn't be, and taking down enemies before they reach you, well we got the Mod for you.

Name: Tipsy Tower
Description:
The Tower Rocks ... Careful! Don't let the figures fall!

Strategy, planning, coordination and balance ... in an action-filled game that is fun for the whole family.

In turn, each player rolls the die and places a Daredevil on the colored Tower Ring that matches the color die roll.  If the Tower tips and Daredevils fall off, the last player who rolled the die must add all of the fallen Daredevils to his or her Daredevil pile.  This ends that player’s turn!  Play then continues clockwise with the next player.  Players continue to take turns rolling and placing Daredevils until one player is out of Daredevils.

Name: Lunch Box Heroes
Description:
From the introduction:

The game is about flexibility & common sense adjudication by the Judge running the game, with player input, in order to tell a collaborative story.

Everyone is playing LBH for the common goal of having fun.

User summary:

The rules-light game assumes a generic fantasy genre (with magic and monsters), but the rules are flexible (and simple) enough to easily adapt to any genre.  The document includes a print-and-play character sheet and also includes the rules in miniature for printing on a series of pocket cards.

Name: Tajemnicze Domostwo: Plansza Ducha
Description: A board with hints going from the ghost to others players. The expansion makes game easier than regular.

Name: Speed Dating for Ghosts
Description: Speed Dating for Ghosts. Branching dialogue! Hard choices!

Name: Puppet Heresy: Artbook - Gioco di Ruolo - Ambientazione
Description:
From the back of the book:
Anno 7435, la terra è dominata da esseri in parte umani e in parte elementali chiamati Puppets

English translation:
Year 7435, the earth is dominated by a race of mixed human/elemental beigns called Puppets

Name: Spherewalker Sourcebook
Description:
Spherewalker Sourcebook is the first major supplement for Everway.

From the back cover:

"Apex Soulsinger drew her knife and buried it in her own heart. Her scream of death rang across the land, and it rang across a thousand spheres as a gate opened in her flesh. Although its outline bore the shape of their ally and friend, it seemed to have within it the brilliance of the sun. It began to flicker with the views of countless worlds.... Realizing that their lives were to be bought with her death, the legion charged into the gate. Countless worlds flashed through the gate, shimmering like reflections on a pond when ripples collide. One soldier would step through into a jungle, while the next would arrive in a desert, and another would find herself in a distant city..."
-- Spherewalker Sourcebook

Breathtaking tales, mysterious peoples, exotic worlds: such is the landscape of Spherewalker Sourcebook. The Spherewalker Sourcebook is the perfect reference tool for gamemasters and players of the Everway game system, as well as excellent reading for those who enjoy fantastic yarns set in a richly embellished multiverse. Experience the power and diversity of a thousand possibilities as you embark on your journey as a spherewalker!

"Covering the range of views from the mundane... to the cosmic, Greg shows that his imagination works at any scale, whether he's talking about the effects of wearing brown or the origin of humanity. This range of attention allows the reader, player, or gamemaster to see the grand scope... as well as the day-to-day details... Greg's heavy use of dialogue, the first-person accounts, his humor, and his sense of drama make the sourcebook an easy read."
--Jonathan Tweet, Everway Game Designer
from the foreward

Name: A Study in Emerald - A Jumpchain CYOA
Description:
From the introduction:

Treachery and despair stalk London streets.

Queen Victoria Gloriana of New Albion, long may her many arms hold the Crown, has been shocked by the murder of Prince Franz Drago of Bohemia.

Name: The Pillars of the Earth
Description:
Die Säulen der Erde / The Pillars of the Earth is based on the bestselling novel by Ken Follett and the 2006 game in the Kosmos line of literature-based games.

At the beginning of the 13th century, construction of the greatest and most beautiful cathedral in England begins. Players are builders who try to contribute the most to this cathedral's construction and, in so doing, score the most victory points.  Gameplay roughly consists of using workers to produce raw materials, and then using craftsmen to convert the materials into victory points.  Workers may also be used to produce gold, the currency of the game.  Players are also given three master builders each turn, each of which can do a variety of tasks, including recruiting more workers, buying or selling goods, or just obtaining victory points.  Getting early choices with a master builder costs gold, as does purchasing better craftsmen.  Players must strike a balance between earning gold to fund their purchases and earning victory points.

Expanded by:


     The Pillars of the Earth Expansion Set (which include the Expansion Cards in some editions)
     The Pillars of the Earth: Expansion Cards (which are included in the Expansion Set in some editions)
Mechanics: ['Events', 'Market', 'Turn Order: Claim Action', 'Turn Order: Random', 'Worker Placement', 'Worker Placement, Different Worker Types']

Name: Around The Horn
Description: While watching a baseball game, all players are dealt 7 cards. The remainder of the deck becomes the draw pile. Before each at bat, all players select one card from their hand, trying to predict the outcome of the at bat. Any number of players may select the same card. If the result of the play is a gomer or triple, player that selected that result receive 2 points. Any other result, players that selected a matching result receive 1 point. All cards selected cards are discarded replaces drawn and then next at bat is played. After the game ends the player with the most points wins.

Name: CATAN: Traders & Barbarians
Description:
Traders & Barbarians is distributed as the third major expansion for The Settlers of Catan, although it is actually a compilation of small expansions and variants.  (It is independent of the Seafarers and Cities & Knights expansions, but can be combined with them.)

All of the variants and three of the scenarios have been available from various sources in Europe and the United States or through official websites. The Great Rivers and the Fishermen of Catan have been expanded somewhat for this expansion through extra tiles and player pieces.

This compilation includes 5 scenarios:

     The Fishermen of Catan - Originally released in the 05/2006 Spielbox magazine and then subsequently released in Games Quarterly magazine.  Expanded in this edition.
     The Rivers of Catan - Originally released in the Atlantis scenario box, then subsequently in Games Quarterly magazine as "The Great River".  Expanded in this edition to include two rivers, one occupying 4 tiles, and one occupying 3.
     The Great Caravan - Originally released as a free expansion in Germany.
     Barbarian Invasion - New in this edition. - Barbarians are invading Catan and the players have to try to stop them with new knight pieces. This plays very similarly to the flood mechanic in the Atlantis scenario from the Atlantis and Das Buch scenario packs.
     Traders & Barbarians - New in this edition. - You get new hexes, one for the castle, one to produce glass, and one to produce marble. You try to rebuild Catan after the invasion. You get gold and victory points if you finish tasks in the castle, but to do so you have to travel back and forth to the castle on roads and undeveloped paths. There are still some barbarians around who interfere with trade routes.


It also includes 4 minor variants:

     2-Player Rules - Use the new "Commercial Chips" to force trade with your opponent. Use 3rd and 4th neutral player to block your opponent.  Also available online: Klaus2player.pdf
     Catan Event Cards - Originally released in the Atlantis scenario box, then subsequently released for sale separately. Replaces the dice with a deck of cards to minimize randomness.
     The Harbormaster Card - Originally released in the Atlantis scenario box, then subsequently available online: harbormaster.pdf. Gives two victory points to the player with the most harbor points.
     Friendly Robber Rules


This game belongs to the Catan Series.
Mechanics: ['Auction/Bidding', 'Dice Rolling', 'Hand Management', 'Memory', 'Modular Board', 'Network and Route Building', 'Trading', 'Voting']

Name: House in the Hills
Description:
From the back cover:

You can’t remember how long you have been running. A large pack of wolves has been chasing you through wooded hills since the early afternoon. You were ambushed by a group of thugs just before dawn. You tried to put up a good fight, but a club to the back of your head knocked you unconscious before the battle even began. They took your weapons, armor, and equipment, and left you for dead. You awoke to the sound of howling wolves. Suddenly, on the hilltop just ahead, you can make out the silhouette of a small building illuminated by the moonlight.

Suitability: A warrior of 1st to 2nd level with 10 to 20 adds

Name: Myth: Roleplaying in the Lands of Mythic Fantasy
Description:
From the Game's Introduction:

The task of creating a roleplaying game is one thing, creating one in 24 hours is a task in itself. Trying to get clip art and everything else together to is a feat of pure madness. This is my attempt to make such a game. I thought back to my childhood long and hard, searching for ideas.

Within the first thirty minutes of my looking for ideas I stumbled upon the Brothers Grimm book of fairy tales. I thought for a moment, its been done. Move on. But then after sitting there I said to myself what makes fairy tales and things like mythology so interesting?

After brainstorming for a short time I realized fairy tales, mythology and pulp heroes all have one thing in common. All the characters in these stories are usually larger than life and that's why people like them so much. They were flawed heroes who always over come the odds.

Will I succeed? Not going to be sure until this is done and people grab a copy and start to read. Welcome to the world of Mythica.

Name: USA On The Road
Description:
USA On The Road is a spin-and-move game originally included in Chik-fil-a kids meals.  Players spin to move along a track that traverses the United States.  Some spaces cause players to move forward, back or lose a turn.  Other spaces ask players to do some sort of activity (e.g. pretend to water-ski or tell a story), sometimes earning an extra move or spin.  The first player to reach the Statue of Liberty wins.

On the back of the game board is one section of a five-part game called "Our Big World."

—user summary

Name: The Manx TT Race Game
Description:
The Isle of Man TT races are held every year. The TT stands for Tourist Trophy. Bikers get to ride very fast around the lanes and roads on the island.

This game relates to their popularity. It is a relatively simple dice and move game, with certain spaces around the track giving instructions if you land on them. In addition, if two pieces end up on the same space, they are said to have crashed and must miss a turn. Also, if you roll too high a number when going round certain bends, you crash and must miss a turn.

First to the finish line, wins. If you want a longer game you can play on for whatever number of laps you choose.

Name: Mr. Wimpy: The Hamburger Game
Description:
Mr. Wimpy is a platforming video game released by Ocean Software in 1984. The game was intended to be a promotional tie with Wimpy restaurants as their logos, company mascots, and theme tunes were reproduced. The game was released on the Oric 1, ZX Spectrum, BBC Micro and Commodore 64. The gameplay is similar to the video game BurgerTime.

At the start of the game Mr. Wimpy has to cross his kitchen while avoiding moving potholes to get to the larder so that he can collect ingredients and make his burgers. As an added hazard a character called Waldo tries and steal these ingredients from him. After the opening level the game becomes a traditional platform game where the player must guide Mr Wimpy across the platforms whilst walking over four various burger ingredients which in turn causes them to crash to the platform below and finally to the four plates at the bottom.

Source: Wikipedia, "http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mr._Wimpy," available under the CC-BY-SA License.¨

Name: Ecchi Sketch: Draw Cute Girls Every Day!
Description:
User Summary

Visual novel, the story of Yume Akiyama, who works in a dead end job.

Name: The Age of Discovery
Description:
User summary:

This fan-made item presents a large variety of supporting materials for the game.  The content includes a lengthy timeline derived from the novels, as well as significant setting information from the same source.  After most things are described, game statistics are offered.

Name: Der Wolf von Winhall
Description:
Translated from the back:
In Winhall a werewolf is on the loose. Someone has to dispose of this threat and free the land from this menace.
One werewolf versus a bunch of experienced heroes - no big trouble one would think - but the wolf of Winhall seems to be special. Why else emperor Hal would have personally sent his high inquisitor to Winhall? Will the heroes succeed to beat the professional werewolf hunters to it or will they be caught in the crossfire?

Name: d6 Hero (3Muse)
Description:
d6 Hero - Truth, Justice, & Men in Red Spandex

User summary:

The rules presented in d6 Hero adapt the generic, universal d6 RPG rules to a superhero genre.  Characters have one additional Attribute, namely Reaction Adjustment--this helps the hero when they interact with the press, police, or even alien beings.  Super powers are assigned a "Level", indicating a dice roll (e.g., 1d6 or 2d3).  This Level indicates the amount of damage caused or prevented by the power.  The document presents several types of powers and discusses how super heroes might acquire their powers and status.

Name: Grumpy Bear
Description:
From publisher blurb:

Widows Cove, Colorado. The bodies of two hikers have been found mutilated in the hills overlooking the city. The first findings seem to indicate an attack of a brown bear ... but the last sightings of such a specimen in the area dates back more than twenty years ago !


Widows Cove, Colorado. Les corps de deux randonneurs ont été retrouvés mutilés dans les collines qui surplombent la ville. Les premières constatations semblent indiquer une attaque d'ours brun ... mais la dernière apparition d'un tel spécimen dans la région remonte à plus de vingt ans !

Name: The Reeve's Tale
Description:
From the back cover:

The castle of Brochleah Bluff stands warden over the Coronach Marsh, but its crumbling battlements can do nothing against the curse that has plagued the lords of Broachleah for centuries. Chaos haunts the marshlands, while in the darkness, something evil and alien stirs in its sleep for the first time in a thousand years. Can the heroes prevail where even the fell might of Balor himself failed?

A scenario for a group of 5th-6th Rank adventurers.

Name: Isla Chupita
Description:
At the beginning of the game, take a pawn, 25 Chupitos and a token of each bar.

Launch the dice and move in the direction you want the number of boxes indicated by the dice trying to enter a bar.

If you go into a bar where you were not ever been:


     Drink a drink
     Discard the token of that bar
     Draw a card from the deck Movida
     Pay 5 Chupitos, unless you have cards (including the one just caught) that let you not to do so.


If you go into a bar where you were already been:


     Drink a drink
     Pay 5 Chupitos for consumption, unless you have cards that let you not to do so.


WARNING: Any time in the game are asked to "drink a drink", you must drink it REALLY!

The player who discards first his last bar token is the winner.

Name: Re
Description:
Re is a popular Chess variant.

The game is played on a 5x5 board. When the game starts, the board is empty. Each player starts with 10 player pieces: One king, one queen, two rooks, two knights, two bishops, and two pawns.

On your turn, you can do one of the following three things:


    Put one of your pieces (not yet put into play) on an empty square on the board.
    Make a capture with one of your pieces on the board.
    Pass. Note: This may only be done when you have put all your pieces on the board.


When both players pass consecutively or when all pieces of a player have been taken, the game ends. Each player earns points for their remaining pieces on the board: 3 points for each king or queen, two points for each rook, knight, or bishop, and one point for each pawn. Each player counts the total number of points for the pieces they have taken, and the player with the largest number of points wins the game (the score is the difference between the point totals).

Originally published as Spielbox Edition No.8 in Spielbox issue 2/1994.

Name: Alta Società
Description:
From the back of the book:
Persone famose, ricche, rispettabili, insomma l'alta società londinese. Ma quali tremendi segreti nascondono questi individui nella loro vita quotidiana?

English translation:
Famous people, rich and respectable, in short, the London high society. But what terrible secrets these people hides in their daily lives?

Name: Blue Dragon, White Tiger
Description:
From the Publisher:

Welcome to Hong Kong movie magic, where heroes eat bullets for breakfast and villains are one-person armies. Expanding on the core HKAT! RPG, this sourcebook focuses on the magic, religion, and high-flying martial arts movies that made wuxia popular across the world. With influences ranging from movie classics like "Crouching Tiger, Hidden Dragon" to authentic Chinese Mythology, this supplement contains everything players need to create their own warrior-monks, lone swordsmen, and magician-priests.

Some problems need big sticks to solve. When guns aren't enough, however, Blue Dragon, White Tiger steps in with a healthy dose of rules, history, story seeds, and NPCs for Chinese magic and religion (from the authentic to the fantastic), high-wire tricks, and good old martial arts without the bad dubbing. Fans of the genre can expect more history and biographies, while Game Masters are treated to a streamlined and revised magic system dedicated exclusively to Hong Kong Action Theatre!

Name: Breaking the Ice
Description:
Breaking the Ice is a Romantic Comedy role playing game for two players. Players help one another tell the tale of romance arising between two characters, and the set-backs and wacky twists the lovers' tale may take. Quick and easy, the game can be played in one sitting with no prior preparation required.

Play out the ups and downs of a couple's first three dates. From first bumbling attempts to get to know one another, to the stirrings of trust and desire. Watch the attraction flare, and see if the flame will light a fire that will last for a lifetime, or just burn brightly for a moment, and then flicker out.

- Unique word-web character generation. 
- Simple and intuitive mechanics. 
- Collaborative, synergistic play. 
- Great introductory game for non-gamers. 
- Rules for more than two players.

Name: Everyday Golf
Description:
This exciting interactive golf board game requires a little luck and a little skill. Players move through the board’s fairways by rolling the dice and picking the right club. All the while avoiding the sand traps, water hazards-and consequences which are determined by which card they draw. When a player reaches the green they putt!

Game includes:

* 4 Dice
    * Consequence Cards
    * Golf Carts, Club Cards
    * Golf Ball
    * Game Board
    * Putting Hole and
    * Scoring Pad

Name: Above Top Secret
Description:
Above Top Secret is a turn-based strategic Card Game designed as a two player game or team play for 4+ players (which would require an extra copy of the base game). The game is suited for ages 12+. Depending on how many players are involved, the game will take approximately 60 - 100 minutes to complete.

You have been recruited to take command of the Defense Systems for a Top Secret Military Base.

There are many weapon systems at your disposal, including some that are classified Above Top Secret. These include prototype systems, which have been reverse engineered from recovered Extraterrestrial Technology.

As your Security Clearance Level increases, you will gain access to ever more advanced technology.

But beware; there are Extraterrestrial forces monitoring the conflict closely. Your brilliant strategic plans may be upset by their direct interference when you least expect it..

Each Military Base consists of four main areas. Players must protect their Base using the Technology and Weaponry at their disposal, subject to their level of Security Clearance. Secret Technology, Alien Technology and, at times, direct Alien interference features heavily within the game and will play a part in the strategies you develop.

Using your personal deck of Defense Cards, which you are able to configure depending on the way you play, you must seek to break through your opponent’s Defenses and destroy their four Base Areas, whilst ensuring that at least one of yours remains standing.
Mechanics: ['Deck, Bag, and Pool Building', 'Hand Management', 'Open Drafting', 'Player Elimination']

Name: Entobian
Description:
From the publisher:

Intelligent insects-- we know of their hive like minds, alien dispositions, and callous attitudes. We have seen the mantis warriors, the bee people, and the ant-men. These are popular races, and those looking for something different are often drawn to them. Unfortunately, their hive society and tendency to be anti-human often makes these bug-men a poor match for many campaigns. Enter the entobian: These tenacious caterpillar people thrive in human societies. They hunger for adventure, individuality, and diversity. Driven by many of the same desires as other adventurers, they freely and willingly relate well with other races. They also have all the great aspects that make insects so interesting; 6 appendages, the ability to spin silk, and a truly different physiology than the other PC races. As an added bonus, at paragon levels they have the option to metamorphosis into a completely different insect; gaining not only a new form, but new powers and abilities as well. Imagine playing an axe wielding grub guy, an assassin beetle person, or even a spell slinging moth-man. Well, now you can, with the Entobian PC race brought to you by Alluria Publishing!

Name: Trigger Warning (2013)
Description:
From the introduction:

Trigger Warning is a game for 2 players. One player plays a sniper watching their target while waiting to pull the trigger. The other player plays the target. To play you just need a pair of two way communication devices (Walkie Talkies, A Cell Phone, or a wireless phone work), some kind of optical magnification (Binoculars, A monocular, a rangefinder, a rifle scope, or a camera with good zoom) and a good location.

Name: Crown of the Emperor
Description:
Players construct a deck of military might, characters, and industries, vying for the emperor's seat in the year 2909. Building your own empire Players start with 10 Prestige points, and win by either raising their own Prestige to 40, or lowering their opponent's prestige to 0.

Five pre-constructed decks are offered, each representing a different "faction" with a special way of gaining bonus prestige.

Name: The Drow of the Underdark
Description:
From the back cover:

The Drow of the Underdark
They are the favorite foes of many a party of adventurers. In these pages, the drow come to life, their culture and powers detailed for the first time. This guide presents new rules galore: new spells, new magic items, insight into the mysteries of Lolth, Monstrous Compendium entries for related monsters of the Underdark- and much, much more.

Learn all about the drow herein, from words of the ancient sage Erlathan Greycloak:
"Proud, graceful evil. Cruelty personified; talent wasted, beauty lost in darkness."

to the lore of Elminster:
"Did I ever tell thee how close I came to having a drow wife? No? Well, then..."

From the publisher:

All that is powerful and frightening about the race called Drow is detailed in this accessory!

The dark Drow elves are a magical race living far underground.  Coming to the surface world only to make war, they are one of the most feared races in the Realms.  All facets of Drow life are detailed in this 128-page product.

Name: The Mind Game
Description:
Create the longest possible line in a growing grid of lines on Hex tiles, each with 3 lines in two colors.  This was an antecedant of Tantrix, and was called Tantrix at one time.

Similar to:

    Tantrix
    Kaliko

Name: Warfare in the Age of Madness
Description:
From the publisher:

Warfare in the Age of Madness is a game of company-level battles in a dark near future. Designed for 15mm figures, opposing forces fight to survive by scavenging supply caches from the battlefield, stripping enemy casualties of their gear, and raiding the enemy field camp. Features include easy to learn rules, small armies of just a few dozen 15mm figures (about 10-12 elements/stands) and a few vehicles, and a flexible force creation system. Create a completely custom force representing anything from a former regular rifle company (and now your personal war band!) to a hardened civilian militia from your hometown. The game uses only standard 6-sided dice and can be played on the average dining room or kitchen table.

The game is available in electronic and hard copy formats.  Players can use 'extra' 15mm figures they may have lying around or simply reuse miniatures they have for other games to create post apocalyptic warbands with minimal cash outlay.  Players build customized forces and are able to tweak stats, weapons loadouts, morale and other factors to both optimize and personalize their force.

Name: Darkest Night: Hero Cards
Description:
This accessories package includes replacement Hero cards for the Darkest Night base game and select expansions (including the Nymph).

Components:

•   One package of 22 Hero cards

Base Game
Knight
Rogue
Wizard
Druid
Prince
Seer
Acolyte
Priest
Scholar

With an Inner Light
Shaman
Crusader
Paragon
Monk

On Shifting Winds
Scout
Wayfarer
Wind Dancer
Ranger

From the Abyss
Mesmer
Valkyrie
Exorcist
Channeler

Nymph Promo

Name: Knights of the Dinner Table Magazine (Issue 54 - Apr 2001)
Description:
"Speak Easy & Carry a Big Stick"

Cover by George Vrbanic and Jackie Vrbanic

The table of contents is detailed in the Article list below.

Name: Prodigal Son
Description:
Publisher's blurb:

In this case note, the crew are taken on by a prominent magician in the Council of Merlin to track down his missing son. Naturally, things are more complicated than they seem. There is the question as to why someone in the arrogant Council of Merlin needs people involved who do not belong to the organisation. It turns out that getting involved with werewolves is the easy part of the case.

Name: Schweine Poker
Description: Every player is dealt 5 cards and one player is the start player. The start player reads one of special event cards and players have to follow the instructions on the event cards. The effects can be put certain cards in front of you, face up or face down, discarding a card or giving cards to another player. Once all players have 5 cards in front of them, the round is over. The 5 cards are your current poker-hand. The player with the best hand wins. The game is a nice variation of standard poker.

Name: AutoHARP Fantasy: Folkways
Description:
From publisher blurb:

AutoHARP Fantasy: Follkways is an add-on database (drawing upon the HARP Folkways supplement) for the AutoHARP Fantasy software.

The database file includes all the new professions and races introduced in HARP Folkways

The software works under Windows and most Linux distributions. Use the exe file for Windows and the jar files for Windows or Linux - note the jar files require the Java Runtime Environment. An OSX version using Java is also included.

Name: The Iscariot Conspiracy
Description:
From publisher blurb:

Secrets and blood are the coin of this realm.

Villified by the Church, the persona of Judas Iscariot now serves as the rallying point for a vampiric conspiracy in Victorian London, a siren's call to those who have found that no good deed goes unpunished.  The system doesn't reward those who undertake necessary tasks, or follow good form in good faith.  Instead, it only seems to exalt those with the power to do as they please.  It is time for those with the courage for right action be recognised, rewarded, and given the power to transform the world before the turn of the century.

The Iscariot Conspiracy includes:

    An overview of the conspiracy and the plans for Victorian England;
    The mastermind behind the cult-like secret society
    A glimpse at the dread Enochians and possibilities to take them beyond the fictitious  
    A thirst for vengeance undimmed by age
    Those indoctrinated to the conspiracy
    Story seeds for your chronicle, and the longer-reaching implications of this conspiracy

Name: Monopoly: Neubrandenburg
Description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μÏŒνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεá¿–ν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements from Neubrandenburg, in Germany.

Name: Digital Empires
Description:
An ambitious project, Digital Empires attempted to cover rules for all miniatures periods and scales: skirmish to large armies, caveman wars to science fiction battles of the future.  It was only available as a pay-per-PDF file from the publisher, and was over 50 pages long.  It covered everything in miniatures combat: movement, morale, ranged weapons, melee, terrain, etc.

Later expanded into:
All-purpose Miniatures Rules

    All-purpose Miniatures Rules
Categories: ['Ancient', 'Fantasy', 'Medieval', 'Miniatures', 'Modern Warfare', 'Science Fiction', 'Wargame', 'World War I', 'World War II']

Name: Ant Move
Description:
User Summary

An unusual mix of myrmecology and Flight Control. Ants emerge from warrens; you must draw a path for each ant to a destination hive. There are two game modes over several maps:


     Death limit: Your game ends when a certain number of ants die.
     Time limit: Your game ends when the timer runs out.

Name: The Corruption of G'Hyr
Description:
From the introduction:

...this sixth person was the leader of the cult of Hastur, and he has sworn revenge on the captain and his crew for their bravery. It has taken him three years of careful research to discover the means of his revenge; the foul Corruption of G’Hyr.

Name: Encounter 8 - Savage Gorge
Description:
User Summary:

The Savage Gorge is part of Caverns Deep!

The Savage Gorge is a complete kit with multiple subcomponents to build the Savage Gorge Encounter Area in Caverns Deep!

It is made of "Dwarvenite" and includes some metal and magnetized parts.  Some parts have LED circuitry (switch, battery, and socket) to support LED lighting attachments.   
This item was initially available as an add-on for the Build Your own Cavern pledge level and included in one of the other pledge levels during the Caverns Deep! Kickstarter. The item is available in painted and unpainted versions.

The Savage Gorge contains the following subsets:
Savage Gorge - Core Pack 8
Savage Gorge - Adventure Pack 8
Suspension Bridge Pack
Hollow Elevation Blocks
Rising Elevation Pack
Stalagmite Pack
Savage Gorge - Terrain Trays

Name: Donald Duck Universal Travel Game
Description:
The Donald Duck Universal Travel Game was produced by Nintendo under licence from Walt Disney studios in the early 1960s.

This futuristic space themed game sees players follow a path through the cosmos moving by the number determined by a spinner. Certain spaces on the playing board will help or hinder progress. Players move to a launch pad on a space station and flick their playing disk towards a target, similar to the other Disney game, Tomorrowland Rocket to the Moon. The playing piece closest to the middle of the target receives the most points and that player wins the game.

—user summary

Name: The 7th Continent: What Goes Up, Must Come Down
Description:
The Expansion What Goes Up, Must Come Down invites you to come and discover, or perhaps return to, The 7th Continent for some fresh adventures! Two new curses are waiting, each with their own unique gameplay elements, for you to discover.

In “A Prison of Clouds” you’ll find yourself aboard a Hot Air Balloon, in search of salvation and in “The Veins of the Earth” you will delve deep below the Continent in order to triumph over the Evil consuming you.
—description from the publisher
Mechanics: ['Bias', 'Cooperative Game', 'Modular Board', 'Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game', 'Solo / Solitaire Game', 'Storytelling']

Name: Owlboy
Description:
Owlboy is set in the land of the sky; the islands of the world below have been separated by a catastrophic event. The player controls a boy named Odus, who is a member of an owl–human hybrid race called the Owls. When Otus' village is attacked by a band of pirates, he sets out on a journey to save it from them.

Source: Wikipedia, "[en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Owlboy Owlboy]", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

Name: Fleet: Charter Boat Cards
Description:
Part of Fleet: Arctic Bounty Kickstarter campaign. They will be available by other outlets

Using a combination of Fleet and Fleet: Arctic Bounty along with the Charter Boats, Fleet will be able to be played with 5 and 6 players! All 12 Charter Boat Cards are added to the Boat Card supply. Charter Boats can be launched under any license!

The Charter Boats can also be used as a mix in at any player count to spice Fleet up even more.

Name: Epic Charlie
Description:
User Summary

Your master has been murdered, and you are under suspicion because only his students have the power to create such destruction. You must seek out this former student and defeat him, for your sake as well as the village. Control your character through a number of challenging levels, with bonuses for getting through the levels quickly.

Name: Diverse City
Description:
The Queen has challenged two rival leaders to build a city together where all factions can live in peace. Each faction brings unique abilities, and more actions become available to players as the city grows. You'll need to build a diverse set of locations to win and become the new mayor. Can you unite the people and create Diverse City?

Diverse City is a fantasy-themed, worker placement, city building game for 1-2 players. The players are rival leaders competing to build and visit locations. As the city grows, more actions become available, but players must race to claim the diminishing real estate. Specialists can be hired, granting powerful abilities to combo and enhance player actions. Points are awarded for locations, specialists, and the diversity of factions represented. Whoever has the most points wins.

You and your rival take in turns placing workers on the border locations of the city. Where your workers intersect you place additional workers - place them on empty spaces to build new locations there, or on existing locations to perform new and powerful actions. Instead of placing a worker, you can recall all of your workers to perform the action of those spaces, including harvesting resources, building locations for new actions, and hiring specialists to improve productivity.

All cards that you build and hire are worth points. You gain bonus points for sets of different factions, building adjacent to other factions, and increasing the city’s population. As the name suggests, diversity is key to victory and becoming the new mayor.

—description from the publisher

Name: Bifrost Volume 1: Faerie
Description:
User description: "Book I of the three-volume Bifrost RPG rules set.  This volume covers character creation, travel, equipment, illnesses and wounds, gods and goddesses, encounter tables, morale, weather, and character advancement.

Books II and III contain rules for creatures, combat, treasure, magic, demonology, magical items and 'Cosmic Magic.'"

Additional Information:  Information is limited regarding this rare role-playing game.

Additional Acknowledgements:


     South East London Wargames Group.
     The Playtesters, Universities of Newcastle, Bath and East Anglia.
     The nearest off-license and take-away..
     All our helpers who have given lifts, inspiration, encouragement etc. especially Les and George.



     Rules compiled: Orpington, Bath, Norwich, Newcastle, Athens, Exter, over the period June 1974 to February 1977.

Name: Red Clay, 1835: Cherokee Removal and the Meaning of Sovereignty
Description:
From the introduction:

Cherokees like to say that unity is one of their highest values. They speak of the “kituwah spirit,” the very essence of what is to be Cherokee: “loyalty to each other, concern for the spiritual power in their way of life, and their insistence upon the importance of tribal unity and harmony.” Yet for years they have been anything but loyal, united, and harmonious. Forty-five years before the Removal crisis, it was a split between the Upper Towns under Old Tassel and the hard-line Chickamaugas of the Lower Towns under Dragging Canoe. That rift was only healed by the deaths of both chiefs. In 1835, the division is between the Ross and Ridge factions.

Name: China: AD 850
Description: Expansion map for China / Web of Power. Available for online play at www.michaelschacht.net. Portrays the same area as Web of Power, but divided into areas differently. New rule for this expansion is that roads can cross the sea.

Name: Star Realms: Federal Transport
Description:
Promo Card for Star Realms
Cost: 2
(Blue)

1 buy and 5 health
Blue: 2 buy
Mechanics: ['Deck, Bag, and Pool Building', 'Hand Management', 'Open Drafting', 'Take That']

Name: The Complete Book of Yoma Volume 1
Description:
From the back cover:

Welcome to the comprehensive, one-stop "monster of the week" resource book for Sailor Moon fans everywhere! Inside you will find full background writeups, physical descriptions, nyumerous pictures, and Tri-Stat game stats for every Yoma, Cardian, and Droid from the first two seasons of Sailor Moon.

Over 70 Yoma. Their mission: destroy the Sailor Scouts!

Name: Trivial Pursuit Mini Pack: Sports
Description: This Mini or Pocket Pack was made for use with the Trivial Pursuit Pocket Player Set Game but also featured color coded questions for use with the regular Trivial Pursuit games.  This set contains 120 sports themed cards: "From baseball to bullfighting - With an emphasis on recent times."

Name: Borderlands 2 - Sir Hammerlock's Big Game Hunt
Description:
User Summary

Sir Hammerlock’s Big Game Hunt is the third story-based DLC for Borderlands 2. In it, the Vault hunters are tasked with locating a crashed Hyperion ship rumored to be filled with loot.

Name: Zuqi
Description:
Zuqi is a game of intense strategy in which players try to achieve the classic goal of getting four pieces in a row or occupy all four corners at once, but there's a twist. Each piece in your arsenal has unique movement abilities, capture abilities, and other powers at their disposal, and you may only bring 5 out of 8 of them to every game, so each game will play out very differently.

With unique rules that keep the game balanced and fair from beginning to end, every game is intense, and even if you're winning in one moment, the tide can quickly turn. Compete with your opponent for supremacy on the battlefield in a mental tug of war. You take one piece from him, he places another. He takes one from you, you place another. Eventually something has to give, and it shall. This is a game of strategy and skill and only the strong shall prevail.

Name: 2CGazette (Issue 24 - Feb 2018)
Description:
2CGazette
February 2018
A Grisly Tale (EL 11)

Name: Totally Spies! The Mobile Game
Description:
User summary:

Beverly Hills teenage superspies Sam, Clover, and Alex are whisked away from their classroom by their boss Joey, leader of the secret World Organization of Human Protection (WOOHP). The Scarab of Salitis has been stolen from an Egyptian pyramid and the girls have to retrieve it. That first mission will then take them to Himalayan Mountains and finally a space station - 8 levels in total.

Name: Gnomopolis: Magic!
Description:
Magic was always a useful tool in gnome creations but used sporadically. Now with the exodus to a new place, some magic focused guilds have to reveal themselves and take part in Gnompolis construction!
